listing_jobDesc:
Axiom Technologies is an Australia-based entity with a history of providing Managed IT solutions to medium to large-scale enterprises globally. Please visit our website for more information about what we do at www.axiomtechnologies.com.
Axiom Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourage applicants from all backgrounds and gender to apply, including, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates
Roles and Responsibilities:
Research and identify solutions to software and hardware issues
Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues, including account setup and network configuration
Ask customers targeted questions to quickly understand the root of the problem
Track computer system issues through to resolution, within agreed time limits
Talk to clients through a series of actions, either via phone, email, or chat, until they’ve solved a technical issue
Properly escalate unresolved issues to appropriate internal teams (e.g. software developers)
Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
Refer to internal database or external resources to provide accurate tech solutions
Ensure all issues are properly logged
Prioritize and manage several open issues at one time
Follow up with clients to ensure their IT systems are fully functional after troubleshooting
Proactively work with the wider Technology Department team, contributing to the delivery of the ICT Plan.
Escalate issues to other members of the Support team, Network/Systems Administrator or IT Manager as needed.
Undertake other activities or tasks as directed by the IT Manager.
Respond to requests for help, and provide training for staff and students, in a way which fosters confidence and literacy with technology.
Support the ICT Service Desk by responding to tickets, answer phone calls and walk-ups, physically visiting staff and students, and other administrative tasks as needed. Creation, maintenance, and support of Parent Portal Accounts.
Follow and proactively contribute to the policies and procedures of the Technology Department.
IT Skills and Experience
Computer OS/Peripherals troubleshooting
Handling Different PC Operating Systems ( Windows 7/8 and 10)
Performing Hardware Software Installation ( understanding of deployment tools like SCCM)
Basic knowledge of SOE and group policies
Printer support
Good knowledge of MS Office tools installation & troubleshooting
Excellent customer service and people skills
Field experience supporting a variety of technologies and services
Advanced technical abilities including solid troubleshooting skills applicable to Windows, Apple, and virtual operating systems
Ability to manage time and resources to meet or exceed expectations in high-profile situations while maintaining professionalism under pressure
Personal Attributes:
Excellent End-user computing skills.
Good knowledge of Infrastructure support.
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
Well organized and extremely detail-oriented
Strong customer service ethic and great communication skills, both oral and written
Passionate about delivering quality no matter what you are doing
Can work both independently and in a collaborative team-oriented environment
A self-starter, motivated to push the limits and think outside of the box
Fondness for solutions that are simple, elegant, and effective
Ability to work with and maintain confidential information
In-depth knowledge of:
Windows OS (e.g. XP, Vista, Windows 7, 10)
Microsoft Office applications
PCLaptop hardware
PCLaptop peripherals, including printers
Mobile devices
Basic knowledge of:
Active Directory
Exchange
Apple OS
SCCM
Experience in a similar role
2+ years of relevant experience.
Note: Preferable Australian Citizen/Local Candidates only
What next?
If you are looking for that next challenge in your career and wish to apply for this role, please forward your resume to careers.au@axiomtechnologies.com Axiom Technologies is an Australia-based entity with a history of providing Managed IT solutions to medium to large-scale enterprises globally. Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW
Job Category: Manufacturing, Transport & Logistics
Job Location:
Macquarie Park, NSW, AU, 2113
Job Ref No: 74114
Employment Type: Permanent Full-Time
Salary Range: $120423.0-$134872.0
About us

Transport for NSW is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate road, rail, bus and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.

The Division
We are a trusted partner to our clients, within Customer Strategy and Technology, developing and delivering smart, integrated and sustainable data and analytics solutions which enable evidence-driven decisions to benefit our customers and communities, and leading an uplift in data literacy of use of data insights across the cluster.

The opportunity
Right now, we have an exciting opportunity for a Full Stack Developer in Data Engineering & Architecture team. The work involves working with mobile, web and integration frameworks to deliver great analytics themed products. The role is also responsible for the implementation of various data APIs onto our data platform.

The role requires strong business stakeholder management ability to ensure stability of the AAI team through its growth. The role is permanent full time based at Macquarie Park with flexible work options available.

What you will be involved in but not limited to:
Develop Web/Mobile/API Applications using a range of technologies for the purposes of visualising and communicating information, analytics, and insights to stakeholders.Build wrappers around 3rd party products to deliver a cohesive product-based experience regardless of the backend technologies and provide on-going 3rd level support of developed applications to reduce the impact of production defects and related incidents.Assume technical responsibility for all stages of the software development process to ensure compliance with application development standards and achievement of documented requirements.Utilise technical expertise in the requirements analysis phase to ensure the solution is both fit for purpose and fit for use.Design automated testing and work with CI / CD processes testing to improve the quality and reduce operational risk of the developed application or front-end.Provide on-going 3rd level support of developed applications to reduce the impact of production defects and related incidents.

Please click here to view a copy of the role description.

About you:
Strong AWS cloud knowledge and experience deploying serverless and containerised applications.Proficiency with fundamental understanding front-end languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.Experience developing for a range of mobile devices, tablets and desktops with responsive front-end designs.Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React and TypeScript.Proficiency with server side and scripting languages such as Python, C# & Java.Familiarity with database technology such as PostgreSQL, NoSQL and Oracle.Proven experience in user interface and strong problem solving skills.Excellent stakeholder engagement and management skills.Ability to influence and quickly build relationships.

Salary and Benefits
The salary for this position is Transport Grade 8 ($120,423 - $134,872) plus 10% superannuation and annual leave loading.

How to apply

To apply for this position, please answer all questions within the online application process and submit a resume.

Applications Close: 11:59PM, Sunday 21st August 2022


We are the community we serve

We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.

We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and are proud to be recognised as a FlexReady Certified employer for our flexible work policies, offerings and practices. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.

Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options.

For any enquiries, please email Jagadeesh Sethuraman at JAGADEESH.SETHURAMAN@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU.

Learn more about how Transport supports people with disability and those providing care via https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us/careers/people-disability
We’re certified as a Family Inclusive Workplace

Our flexible work practices and policies for parental leave, employee and family wellbeing and family care enable us to provide genuine support for our people to thrive at work and at home.

Working with Transport gives you access to a range of benefits that help you balance work with the things that matter to you. Look through our Employee Benefits Guide to learn more.
Apply today to register your interest!

Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us.

Take a look at our application tips video series for plenty of great information on navigating and acing the application and recruitment process here at Transport.
Our COVIDSafe Measures Policy

All Transport for NSW workers are required to have:
appropriate evidence of being fully vaccinated with a TGA approved COVID-19 vaccine; or
an approved medical contraindication.

You will be required to show proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status or apply for a medical exemption prior to securing this role.

Strong AWS cloud knowledge and experience deploying serverless and containerised applications.Proficiency with fundamental understanding front-end languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.Experience developing for a range of mobile devices, tablets and desktops with responsive front-end designs.Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React and TypeScript.Proficiency with server side and scripting languages such as Python, C# & Java.Familiarity with database technology such as PostgreSQL, NoSQL and Oracle.Proven experience in user interface and strong problem solving skills.Excellent stakeholder engagement and management skills.Ability to influence and quickly build relationships.

The salary for this position is Transport Grade 8 ($120,423 - $134,872) plus 10% superannuation and annual leave loading.

 About us

Transport for NSW is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate road, rail, bus and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.

The Division
We are a trusted partner to our clients, within Customer Strategy and Technology, developing and delivering smart, integrated and sustainable data and analytics solutions which enable evidence-driven decisions to benefit our customers and communities, and leading an uplift in data literacy of use of data insights across the cluster.

The opportunity
Right now, we have an exciting opportunity for a Full Stack Developer in Data Engineering & Architecture team. The work involves working with mobile, web and integration frameworks to deliver great analytics themed products. The role is also responsible for the implementation of various data APIs onto our data platform.

The role requires strong business stakeholder management ability to ensure stability of the AAI team through its growth. The role is permanent full time based at Macquarie Park with flexible work options available.

What you will be involved in but not limited to:
Develop Web/Mobile/API Applications using a range of technologies for the purposes of visualising and communicating information, analytics, and insights to stakeholders.Build wrappers around 3rd party products to deliver a cohesive product-based experience regardless of the backend technologies and provide on-going 3rd level support of developed applications to reduce the impact of production defects and related incidents.Assume technical responsibility for all stages of the software development process to ensure compliance with application development standards and achievement of documented requirements.Utilise technical expertise in the requirements analysis phase to ensure the solution is both fit for purpose and fit for use.Design automated testing and work with CI / CD processes testing to improve the quality and reduce operational risk of the developed application or front-end.Provide on-going 3rd level support of developed applications to reduce the impact of production defects and related incidents.

We’re a Brisbane-based ‘fintech’ (financial technology) company, more specifically in bill payments or ‘billtech’ as we like to call it. We were established in 2013 and our founder remains at the helm.
We’ve grown our Sniip family to 14 people of predominantly tech/ developers at this stage. Our office is an open plan, warehouse style space above the bustling Fish Lane in the trendiest part of South Brisbane.
Sniip invests in its people through training and an enhanced working environment, nurturing a creative and inclusive culture. Sniip is an equal opportunity employer that advocates the principle that a company is only as strong as its people.
Sniip opens its doors to those that want to be proud both of the place where they work and the work that they do.
Overview
Working as a member of the agile delivery team to develop new features and automation tests for our mobile applications
Provide ad-hoc production support for either the native iOS application or Android application.
Attend, contribute and provide updates in standard agile meetings; elaboration, estimation, daily stand-up, retrospective
Contribute ideas and provide feedback on the continuous improvement of the solution and technology roadmap.
Qualifications
Recent graduate with GPA 6+ in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics degree.
Skills & Experience
Passion about mobile application development.
Self-motivated with a ‘can do’ attitude.
Well organised, diligent and has high quality standards.
Has strong understanding of programming principles.
Excited about working in a fast growing, professional start-up environment.
Keen to learn Agile development practices (Scrum and Kanban).
High coding standards with a strong emphasis on testing.
Desirable Technical Skills and experience
Experience in developing personal or commercial projects in Android (Java/Kotlin) using native Android frameworks (Jetpack Compose/Android Navigation Library/View Binding)
Experience using terminal/command line commands
CircleCI or other continuous development/integration tools
What’s in it for you?
Sniip invests in its people through training and an enhanced working environment, nurturing a creative and inclusive culture. Sniip is an equal opportunity employer that advocates the principle that a company is only as strong as its people.
Sniip opens its doors to those that want to be proud both of the place where they work and the work that they do.
Our office is an open plan, warehouse style space above the bustling Fish Lane in the trendiest part of South Brisbane.
There’s a beautiful yoga studio and a fun Escape Room below our space and some of Brisbane’s best entertainment, restaurants and cafes at your fingertips (hi QPAC, Chu the Phat, Lune, Southside, Kiki and Julius).
Every public transport option is available – the South Brisbane Train Station on Grey St (200m) and the Cultural Centre Bus Station (250m) on the doorstep of our centrally-located office.
Sniip HQ features end-of-trip facilities (bicycle parking and showers) along with a genuinely collaborative and friendly culture (pool table and ping pong included!). The office features a kitchen stocked with tea, coffee (almond and oat milk too)! We have regular team events, monthly Friday Forums, fun activities and celebrations.
We hope you want to join us on this adventure of a lifetime!

As a member of our global R&D team, you will be based in Camberwell, Melbourne. You will have the opportunity to write code for products used by thousands of customers globally and help them move their business forward with real-time data.
Develop, enhance and maintain Teletrac Navman software solutions and be involved in all stages of an Agile team-based software development process including:
Breaking down requirements for new products and collaborating with Products when some clarification is required.
Producing high-quality technical designs and specifications.
Producing high-quality maintainable software.
Developing efficiently and accurately to specification.
Ensuring clear technical documentation is completed.
Locating and resolving customer issues with existing software and systems in conjunction with appropriate support teams.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU
You will enjoy:

12 weeks of paid parental leave for the primary carer and 4 weeks for the secondary carer.
Development opportunities with 1:1 mentoring, online courses, product training, Lunch ‘n’ learn, and so much more.
Flexible start and finish times and work-from-home options.
Community impact. Volunteering and fundraising activities.
Networking opportunities. Inclusion & Diversity Employee Group and dynamic social communities.
Employee Assistance Program (EAP), health insurance, and other wellness initiatives.

If you like to have the flexibility to bring ideas and test new tools, join our culture of continuous improvement and help our customers keep the world moving.
.
At Teletrac Navman, we believe in your potential to make an impact. And we believe in giving you the opportunity, accountability, and visibility to do just that.
At least 5 years of experience in Android development using Kotlin and Java.
Experience with Flutter is a bonus.
Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software Engineering, or another related technical discipline, OR equivalent experience.
Strong understanding of Android Architecture Components and design patterns.
Demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality applications to Google Play Store.
Good knowledge of test automation framework and continuous integration.
Knowledge in the location services, GIS, or geospatial industries would be an advantage but not essential.
Worked in an agile development environment.

All applicants for this position must be authorized to work full-time in Australia.
Teletrac Navman manages more than 500,000 vehicles and assets for more than 40,000 companies around the world. With headquarters in Orange County, CA, we have an international presence with additional offices in the United States, United Kingdom, ANZ and Mexico. Check our website for more info at www.teletracnavman.com
Vontier is a $3B global industrial technology company focused on smarter transportation and mobility. Our six operating companies—Gilbarco Veeder-Root, Global Traffic Technologies, Teletrac Navman, Matco Tools, Hennessy Industries, and DRB Systems—are united by a powerful purpose: mobilizing the future to create a better world. Our portfolio of trusted brands includes market-leading expertise in mobility technologies, retail and commercial fueling, fleet management, telematics, vehicle diagnostics and repair, and smart cities. Vontier’s pioneering solutions advance safety, security, efficiency, and sustainability worldwide.

Energized by our shared purpose and values, we have a strong culture shaped by a deep organization-wide commitment to inclusion, diversity, and equity (ID&E) and environmental, social, and governance (ESG). Eight vibrant global employee resource groups serve as powerful focal points for connection, community, and advocacy, and we actively support community causes through Vontier Cares. We offer flexible remote and in-person, open-space work options. As a member of our global R&D team, you will be based in Camberwell, Melbourne. You will have the opportunity to write code for products used by thousands of customers globally and help them move their business forward with real-time data.

Ensuring clear technical documentation is completed.
Locating and resolving customer issues with existing software and systems in conjunction with appropriate support teams.

Employee Assistance Program (EAP), health insurance, and other wellness initiatives.

If you like to have the flexibility to bring ideas and test new tools, join our culture of continuous improvement and help our customers keep the world moving.
.
At Teletrac Navman, we believe in your potential to make an impact. And we believe in giving you the opportunity, accountability, and visibility to do just that.

Our portfolio of trusted brands includes market-leading expertise in mobility technologies, retail and commercial fueling, fleet management, telematics, vehicle diagnostics and repair, and smart cities. Vontier’s pioneering solutions advance safety, security, efficiency, and sustainability worldwide.

Energized by our shared purpose and values, we have a strong culture shaped by a deep organization-wide commitment to inclusion, diversity, and equity (ID&E) and environmental, social, and governance (ESG). Eight vibrant global employee resource groups serve as powerful focal points for connection, community, and advocacy, and we actively support community causes through Vontier Cares. We offer flexible remote and in-person, open-space work options. As a member of our global R&D team, you will be based in Camberwell, Melbourne. You will have the opportunity to write code for products used by thousands of customers globally and help them move their business forward with real-time data.
Develop, enhance and maintain Teletrac Navman software solutions and be involved in all stages of an Agile team-based software development process including:
Breaking down requirements for new products and collaborating with Products when some clarification is required.
Producing high-quality technical designs and specifications.
Producing high-quality maintainable software.
Developing efficiently and accurately to specification.
Ensuring clear technical documentation is completed.
Locating and resolving customer issues with existing software and systems in conjunction with appropriate support teams.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU
You will enjoy:

12 weeks of paid parental leave for the primary carer and 4 weeks for the secondary carer.
Development opportunities with 1:1 mentoring, online courses, product training, Lunch ‘n’ learn, and so much more.
Flexible start and finish times and work-from-home options.
Community impact. Volunteering and fundraising activities.
Networking opportunities. Inclusion & Diversity Employee Group and dynamic social communities.
Employee Assistance Program (EAP), health insurance, and other wellness initiatives.

If you like to have the flexibility to bring ideas and test new tools, join our culture of continuous improvement and help our customers keep the world moving.
.
At Teletrac Navman, we believe in your potential to make an impact. And we believe in giving you the opportunity, accountability, and visibility to do just that.
At least 5 years of experience in Android development using Kotlin and Java.
Experience with Flutter is a bonus.
Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software Engineering, or another related technical discipline, OR equivalent experience.
Strong understanding of Android Architecture Components and design patterns.
Demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality applications to Google Play Store.
Good knowledge of test automation framework and continuous integration.
Knowledge in the location services, GIS, or geospatial industries would be an advantage but not essential.
Worked in an agile development environment.

All applicants for this position must be authorized to work full-time in Australia.
Teletrac Navman manages more than 500,000 vehicles and assets for more than 40,000 companies around the world. With headquarters in Orange County, CA, we have an international presence with additional offices in the United States, United Kingdom, ANZ and Mexico. Check our website for more info at www.teletracnavman.com
Vontier is a $3B global industrial technology company focused on smarter transportation and mobility. Our six operating companies—Gilbarco Veeder-Root, Global Traffic Technologies, Teletrac Navman, Matco Tools, Hennessy Industries, and DRB Systems—are united by a powerful purpose: mobilizing the future to create a better world. Our portfolio of trusted brands includes market-leading expertise in mobility technologies, retail and commercial fueling, fleet management, telematics, vehicle diagnostics and repair, and smart cities. Vontier’s pioneering solutions advance safety, security, efficiency, and sustainability worldwide.

Energized by our shared purpose and values, we have a strong culture shaped by a deep organization-wide commitment to inclusion, diversity, and equity (ID&E) and environmental, social, and governance (ESG). Eight vibrant global employee resource groups serve as powerful focal points for connection, community, and advocacy, and we actively support community causes through Vontier Cares. We offer flexible remote and in-person, open-space work options. Show more

Hybrid working arrangement, mix of working from home and the office
Highly supportive and fun team environment!
Exciting time to join a top 100 ASX listed business
We’ve only just begun, but what a beginning. In a once in a generation moment, we’ve brought together powerful brands to create one united force. TPG Telecom has a powerhouse of brands which include Vodafone, TPG, iiNet, Internode, Lebara, AAPT and felix. The latest technology and brave thinking let us connect our people and communities. You could play a role in that. A big one. We invite you to bring your boldness and stand out. You are empowered. Opportunities are plenty for those ready to accept the challenge.
This opportunity
We have an exciting opportunity for a Developer early in their career who is looking to gain experience in a dynamic and diverse work environment. Along with being mentored by one of our team members to develop your industry skills and experiences, this role will take you through new and exciting challenges that will help you grow and develop.
Essentially, you will be working as part of a team of developers that focuses on supporting customer portals, ordering platforms and as well as back-end systems across the business. You may be involved with assisting project work in line with assigned priorities and schedules. Open to all locations, we
Responsibilities
Developing internal web/intranet-delivered applications
Writing great code supported by automated testing (TDD)
Developing and supporting projects or systems by utilising Linux, Apache, Java Spring Boot and Angular technologies
Maintaining/updating critical operational support documentation as part of project deliverables
Effectively collaborate and communicate within a team spread across multiple locations
Knowledge and experience
Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related discipline
Experience utilising design technics to demonstrate concepts
Excellent programming skills and a willingness to learn new technologies
Some experience with Java language, web frameworks (Spring in particular), HTML/CSS, and Angular
Some experience with SQL for database query and table design.
Benefits and perks
Flexible hybrid way of working (work from home and office)
‘Stay Connected Mobile’ – Access to a free mobile plan
‘Stay Connected NBN’ – Access to a free NBN 100 plan
‘Your Leave’ - an additional 4 days of leave to be used whenever you like - every year
Access to TPG Learning Hub platform and internal development opportunities
Access to Corporate Partner Discounts
Our TPG Telecom Spirit
We believe in the power of meaningful relationships to support vibrant, connected communities where everyone belongs. You will join a supportive company that is diverse and inclusive, and celebrates what makes our employees different, as well what brings us together. We want you to bring your true self to work, and to feel like your contribution matters. We encourage ambition in everything we do, from telco solutions to customer experience, to community impact. You will have real opportunities to take charge and take control.
Bolder and better together!
Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and those of underrepresented groups are less likely to apply for roles unless they meet every single criteria. At TPG Telecom we recognise that what may make you different, makes the difference!
We’re all about enabling every individual to be their authentic selves and creating a place where everybody belongs. If you are excited about this role, but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to APPLY NOW regardless. You may just be the right candidate for this or perhaps another similar role with us.

We're REA
An Australian start-up success story we're quietly proud of.
From a garage in Melbourne to the global stage is an achievement we're humbled by. Our idea to put pictures of houses on the internet has blossomed since 1995, and we now have businesses across Australia, India and North America.
Our purpose is to change the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help on every step - whether that's buying, selling, renting or renovating.
Some of our brands include realestate.com.au, realcommercial.com.au, Flatmates.com.au, Proptrack.com, Smartline.com.au and Mortgage Choice.
We’re proud to have been named one of Australia’s Best Workplaces for 2021. This recognition is a great proof point of our unique and special culture. A culture that is driven by our people, our values, and our commitment to making a difference in the community.
What we’re doing
This role sits within Consumer Journeys, Property Owner. The Property Owner team has end-to-end responsibility for the delivery of new features specific to ‘My Property’ section on the realestate.com.au website and app used by millions of Australians every year. Our job. The team’s purpose is to discover and prioritise the things that enable and assist consumers on their buying and selling journey beyond the traditional property purchase and sale events REA is so well known for.
What the role is all about:
Working across our modern mobile apps, specifically in the property owner section of realestate.com.au, doing cool stuff with Android & Kotlin
Working in a highly supportive environment that values every single persons input and opinion
Contributing to the overall technical solution design and product direction
Working in agile teams, where we value experimentation and data driven decisions
Utilising modern software development techniques such as CI/CD and test driven development
You build it, you run it. We are responsible for delivery into production
Work with reactive programming paradigm.
Who we’re looking for
But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It’s our connection, acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be:
You love Android development (or desperately want to be an Android dev !), but with an open mind to working on iOS apps from time to time if the need arises
Knowledge of software design patterns and best practices for software development
Active contribution in technical decision-making process – we love hearing from every single person in the squad !
Work productively in a fast paced and agile environment
Happy to ask questions and challenge the status quo
An existing investment and ongoing commitment in your own learning and/or career change pathway (Hackathons, Short Courses and other Self-learning)
A growth mindset - it's not about what you know but how you learn
A focus on collaboration, communication and alignment with the REA values (see link for more info) - https://www.rea-group.com/careers/rea-culture/our-values/
The REA experience
The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.
We offer:
A flexible working environment, meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes, our leaders fully understand the benefits of working flexibly)
A hybrid approach to the future of work - https://rea.to/hybrid-working
Generous and flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers
Summer Fridays – time back to focus on your wellness every Friday afternoon from December through to March
Support for your mental and physical health and wellbeing via our ‘You Matter’ Program
Because We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community
Hack Days for you to bring so you can bring your big ideas to life in a supportive learning environment
An additional day of leave just for your birthday
Oh, and by the way:
At REA we value diversity and inclusion in all forms. Gender, religion, ethnicity, LBTGIQ+, neurodiversity and so much more. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you've got the must-haves, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.
If you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. While we're looking at your application, and preparing to come back to you with an update, why not get to know us a bit more through our various social channels? We're REA

Working in a highly supportive environment that values every single persons input and opinion
Contributing to the overall technical solution design and product direction
Working in agile teams, where we value experimentation and data driven decisions
Utilising modern software development techniques such as CI/CD and test driven development
You build it, you run it. We are responsible for delivery into production
Work with reactive programming paradigm.
Who we’re looking for
But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It’s our connection, acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be:
You love Android development (or desperately want to be an Android dev !), but with an open mind to working on iOS apps from time to time if the need arises
Knowledge of software design patterns and best practices for software development
Active contribution in technical decision-making process – we love hearing from every single person in the squad !
Work productively in a fast paced and agile environment
Happy to ask questions and challenge the status quo
An existing investment and ongoing commitment in your own learning and/or career change pathway (Hackathons, Short Courses and other Self-learning)
A growth mindset - it's not about what you know but how you learn
A focus on collaboration, communication and alignment with the REA values (see link for more info) - https://www.rea-group.com/careers/rea-culture/our-values/
The REA experience
The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.
We offer:
A flexible working environment, meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes, our leaders fully understand the benefits of working flexibly)
A hybrid approach to the future of work - https://rea.to/hybrid-working
Generous and flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers
Summer Fridays – time back to focus on your wellness every Friday afternoon from December through to March
Support for your mental and physical health and wellbeing via our ‘You Matter’ Program
Because We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community
Hack Days for you to bring so you can bring your big ideas to life in a supportive learning environment
An additional day of leave just for your birthday
Oh, and by the way:
At REA we value diversity and inclusion in all forms. Gender, religion, ethnicity, LBTGIQ+, neurodiversity and so much more. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you've got the must-haves, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.
If you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. While we're looking at your application, and preparing to come back to you with an update, why not get to know us a bit more through our various social channels? We're REA 
An Australian start-up success story we're quietly proud of.  
From a garage in Melbourne to the global stage is an achievement we're humbled by. Our idea to put pictures of houses on the internet has blossomed since 1995, and we now have businesses across Australia, India and North America.  
Our purpose is to change the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help on every step - whether that's buying, selling, renting or renovating.  
Some of our brands include realestate.com.au, realcommercial.com.au, Flatmates.com.au, Proptrack.com, Smartline.com.au and Mortgage Choice.  
We’re proud to have been named one of Australia’s Best Workplaces for 2021. This recognition is a great proof point of our unique and special culture. A culture that is driven by our people, our values, and our commitment to making a difference in the community.  
What we’re doing 
This role sits within Consumer Journeys, Property Owner. The Property Owner team has end-to-end responsibility for the delivery of new features specific to ‘My Property’ section on the realestate.com.au website and app used by millions of Australians every year. Our job. The team’s purpose is to discover and prioritise the things that enable and assist consumers on their buying and selling journey beyond the traditional property purchase and sale events REA is so well known for.

Job Description
We are looking for a qualified Mobile developer to join our Engineering team. You will be working with our engineers to develop and maintain high quality mobile applications.
If you’re passionate about mobile platforms and translating code into user-friendly apps, we would like to meet you. As a Mobile developer, you’ll collaborate with internal teams to develop functional mobile applications, while working in a fast-paced environment.
Ultimately, you should be able to design and build the next generation of our mobile applications.

Skills
Android Java Application Development QA HTML5 AJAX JavaScript jQuery SDK
Responsibilities
Acting as lead iOS and/ or Android developer. Depending on the skills set can be lead on one platform and play a supporting role across the other
Working closely with another mobile app developer leading the other platform development
Deliver across the entire app life cycle –concept, design, build, deploy, test, release to app stores and support
Working directly with developers and product managers to conceptualise, build, test and realise products
Gather requirements around functionality and translate those requirements into elegant functional solutions
Build prototypes at tech scoping stage of projects
Working along the web developers to create and maintain a robust framework to support the apps
Working with the front end developers to build the interface with focus on usability features
Create compelling device specific user interfaces and experiences
Standardising the platform and in some cases apps to deliver across multiple brands with minimal duplication of effort
Optimising performance for the apps
Keep up to date on the latest industry trends in the mobile technologies
Explain technologies and solutions to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Attend industry events/ conference – both attending and presenting
Job Summary
Offered Salary
4000
Career Level
Internship
Experience
3 year
Qualification

BCS Technology, headquartered in Sydney, is a leading global IT professional services organization focused on the delivery of customised solutions in emerging technologies including blockchain, mobile apps, digital, cloud, big data, AI, predictive analytics and machine learning. You’ll be part of a cross-functional international team that’s responsible for the mobile application development using ios, android and react.At present we work with React Native, to build and deliver end to end features on our iOS & Android mobile applications, but as we grow in complexity, our stack would too, and YOU would have a chance to shape it!We are lean, customer focussed and, on a mission to build a quality mobile product for businesses globally. We value what each one of us brings to the table and our happiness, growth and personal development means the worldAs a Software Engineer in the Mobile Apps team you will be involved in improving the Mobile experience of our 8+ million customers.Role and responsibilities: · Collaborating with Designers and Product managers· Defining the new mobile product that we're building all the way from tools, technology, processes and customer value· Improving the software delivery system, including decreasing build times and increasing automated testsTechnology and experience: Well versed with React Native.You have 3+ years of solid software development and are a skilled mobile app developer. You have 3+ years of building native mobile apps with 1-2 years of those building React Native mobile apps for Android and iOS, deploying to Appstore and google Play (We'd love to see your work on the stores). Building Mobile apps is as familiar to you .Proficiency with Android OR iOS app development.Native iOS or Android apps using Swift, Objective C, Java or Kotlin and you are just starting to become an amazing React Native developer. That's okay with us, as you know what makes mobile apps special, and love building app-y apps with rich interactions.Other skills that would bring in success: · Innovation. You are a creative thinker and love the thrill of building something from scratch.· Outstanding communication, collaboration and problem-solving skills. You encourage diversity of thought and thrive in a team environment. You have good facilitation skills that guide discussions into outcomes· Customer-oriented mindset. Excellent team & company culture,Chance to work on challenging & impactful projects for clients like Nando’s, Linfox, ahm, Chadstone, Movember, and more…Plenty of ownership of projects,Growth & learning focussed environment with clear progression pathways and support,Lots of exciting work lined up,Flexible working within a supportive & friendly team,Join us in our brand new office in Clifton Hill, purpose built with hybrid work being central to its design.
Inlight is a digital services business leveraging strategy, design and technology to solve complex and intriguing business challenges. We are passionate about working in partnership with our clients, helping them leverage digital to enhance their business, deliver real outcomes and co-create exciting, product led growth journeys.
Our teaming structure means you will collaborate closely across a range of other disciplines. You’ll join forces with a team of #goodhumans including designers, developers and strategists where you’ll hone your skills and discover the personal and professional growth to take your career to the next level.
You’ll be driven by interesting work and collective success, working with smart people and pushing the boundaries of what our clients need and what technology can deliver. At Inlight we believe that people, not technology, produce the best outcome. This is a great opportunity to join a passionate, proactive and creative team who can bring our vision to life.
The role
We’re looking for an experienced mobile developer to be involved in building exciting and complex digital products from conception through to delivery and work collaboratively with a talented team of developers.
You’ll produce well structured-code that is valid, tested and of a high production standard and provide technical input to help guide our team and build trust and credibility with our clients. On a typical day, you’ll be driving your own work forward and work closely with our producers on technical planning and decisions, reviewing PRs and assisting other devs with technical questions and bug fixes. You should be able to contribute to new and innovative solutions whilst staying up to date with new technologies by experimenting, learning and improving.
We work with a number of different technologies to suit the individual challenges faced by our clients.
On the front-end, we favor React and NextJS, using both Javascript and Typescript. On the back-end, we enjoy using everything from serverless architecture to serving REST and GraphQL. APIs using NodeJS, to hosted CMS solutions using Craft CMS, MySQL, Docker and Lightsail.
We use React Native for app development, as well as Swift and Java for hardware-specific solutions.
Inlight utilises AWS products and infrastructure. We value experience with AWS, including Elastic Beanstalk, Cloudfront RDS, DynamoDB, and Lambda, as well as experience using Terraform, CDK and Serverless.
Inlight is a Vercel partner, and any experience using Vercel or NextJS will be highly beneficial.
Any further experience with caching, logging, monitoring, testing, deployment, or any other areas is a bonus. We understand we’re all on individual journeys so you may not have all the skills. That’s ok - we are always learning, and we hope that you are too.
You're someone who
Is comfortable around both IOS and Android environments and has experience using the React Native framework,
Has experience with a variety of front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries,
Has experience of working with agile methodologies and tools,Has a Computer Science qualification or equivalent experience,
Has provided technical leadership across projects and have first-hand experience crafting end-to-end solutions and designing complex backend systems,
Applies reasoned logic when solving problems,
Is pragmatic and looks at ways to make things easier,
Follows curiosity to challenge how things are done and can work through problems,
Is a team player and enjoys collaborating and sharing ideas and knowledge with your peers,
Can develop empathy when considering different perspectives,
Can confidently contribute to technical discussions with the team and clients,
Invests in learning and enjoys experimenting with new tools and technologies.
A few more benefits
The ability to have a broad and significant impact in a growing and proudly independent business,
Work on complex and interesting projects that create genuine value for the people who use them,
You'll get your own MacBook and will be surrounded by all the modern and latest tech,
Work with a great combination of technologies (React, React Native, iOS: Swift, Android: Java, CraftCMS, Node and AWS,
Our team’s learning is important to us. You will get access to a $1000 annual learning fund,
Since we are a remote friendly workplace, we offer a $1000-WFH stipend to spend on your home set up,
A wellbeing day to help support mental health,
A supportive parental leave policy.
Our values
Our values articulate our culture. They describe what is meaningful to us, make clear our standards and expected behaviours, help us guide our decisions and solutions and help us navigate new challenges. Individually and collectively, we;
Care and support each other
Always learn, always improve
Show curiosity with purpose
Challenge well
Commit to impact
Take responsibility
Diversity in all forms is embraced and encouraged in our team. We are an equal opportunity employer and believe that we are all the better for inviting different perspectives into the thinking, designing, and building of our work. We also think it makes for a more interesting place to work!
We care about each other and in providing an environment where everyone feels welcome and is free to contribute ideas, have an impact and to build a career that they’re excited by.

For further enquiries, feel free to reach out to Malou (Talent) at careers@inlight.com.au Excellent team & company culture,Chance to work on challenging & impactful projects for clients like Nando’s, Linfox, ahm, Chadstone, Movember, and more…Plenty of ownership of projects,Growth & learning focussed environment with clear progression pathways and support,Lots of exciting work lined up,Flexible working within a supportive & friendly team,Join us in our brand new office in Clifton Hill, purpose built with hybrid work being central to its design.
Inlight is a digital services business leveraging strategy, design and technology to solve complex and intriguing business challenges. We are passionate about working in partnership with our clients, helping them leverage digital to enhance their business, deliver real outcomes and co-create exciting, product led growth journeys.
Our teaming structure means you will collaborate closely across a range of other disciplines. You’ll join forces with a team of #goodhumans including designers, developers and strategists where you’ll hone your skills and discover the personal and professional growth to take your career to the next level.
You’ll be driven by interesting work and collective success, working with smart people and pushing the boundaries of what our clients need and what technology can deliver. At Inlight we believe that people, not technology, produce the best outcome. This is a great opportunity to join a passionate, proactive and creative team who can bring our vision to life.
The role
We’re looking for an experienced mobile developer to be involved in building exciting and complex digital products from conception through to delivery and work collaboratively with a talented team of developers.
You’ll produce well structured-code that is valid, tested and of a high production standard and provide technical input to help guide our team and build trust and credibility with our clients. On a typical day, you’ll be driving your own work forward and work closely with our producers on technical planning and decisions, reviewing PRs and assisting other devs with technical questions and bug fixes. You should be able to contribute to new and innovative solutions whilst staying up to date with new technologies by experimenting, learning and improving.
We work with a number of different technologies to suit the individual challenges faced by our clients.
On the front-end, we favor React and NextJS, using both Javascript and Typescript. On the back-end, we enjoy using everything from serverless architecture to serving REST and GraphQL. APIs using NodeJS, to hosted CMS solutions using Craft CMS, MySQL, Docker and Lightsail.
We use React Native for app development, as well as Swift and Java for hardware-specific solutions.
Inlight utilises AWS products and infrastructure. We value experience with AWS, including Elastic Beanstalk, Cloudfront RDS, DynamoDB, and Lambda, as well as experience using Terraform, CDK and Serverless.
Inlight is a Vercel partner, and any experience using Vercel or NextJS will be highly beneficial.
Any further experience with caching, logging, monitoring, testing, deployment, or any other areas is a bonus. We understand we’re all on individual journeys so you may not have all the skills. That’s ok - we are always learning, and we hope that you are too.
You're someone who
Is comfortable around both IOS and Android environments and has experience using the React Native framework,
Has experience with a variety of front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries,
Has experience of working with agile methodologies and tools,Has a Computer Science qualification or equivalent experience,
Has provided technical leadership across projects and have first-hand experience crafting end-to-end solutions and designing complex backend systems,
Applies reasoned logic when solving problems,
Is pragmatic and looks at ways to make things easier,
Follows curiosity to challenge how things are done and can work through problems,
Is a team player and enjoys collaborating and sharing ideas and knowledge with your peers,
Can develop empathy when considering different perspectives,
Can confidently contribute to technical discussions with the team and clients,
Invests in learning and enjoys experimenting with new tools and technologies.
A few more benefits
The ability to have a broad and significant impact in a growing and proudly independent business,
Work on complex and interesting projects that create genuine value for the people who use them,
You'll get your own MacBook and will be surrounded by all the modern and latest tech,
Work with a great combination of technologies (React, React Native, iOS: Swift, Android: Java, CraftCMS, Node and AWS,

About Us Our business has been shaped by the requirement of companies to thrive in the evolving digital environment. We specialize in delivering complex digital projects to Private, Public and Government Organizations, which include large Enterprises, Hospitals and Universities.Our developers are experienced in delivering complex software applications which are built using our preferred technology stack which is React Native, Ember.js, React.js, Python, Django, JavaScript and websites using WordPress and Shopify.We provide a full range of services, which includes web app development, mobile app development, API design & development, 3rd-party API integration and device integration.Your role and dutiesFull stack development to build web applications, mobile apps and websites;Participate in cross-functional teams to design and deliver products or features, according to the specification of our clients;Build, maintain and improve the code for applications and be involved in the entire agile software delivery cycle;Test and modify software applications as part of the test team environment.Assist with research and develop tasks required on a project expected toProvide ongoing technical support to our client’s projectsDevelop and maintain project documentation, internal procedures and end user documentation.What we’re looking forYou have strong experience with building mobile applications and database development with technologies such as React Native, Flutter or Android SDK and iOS SDK.You have strong experience with the development of web applications using React .js or Ember.js, Javascript, PHP and Django Python;You have tertiary qualifications in Information Systems and Technologies;You have at least 2-3 years’ commercial work experience in full-stack development - Job Description
Corptec Technology Partners is an international player in the areas of business transformation and organizational performance. With a team of capable technologists, stoked by cultural and business success, Corptec functions as a strategic partner for its clients.


Our diversified client portfolio includes Australia’s best and brightest in FinTech, Retail, Telco, and Government organisations.
One of Australia’s largest banks is looking for Native Mobile Developers extensive experience in Android/ iOS development using Kotlin/ Swift. While you will be part of a large, collaborative team but this role will also provide the opportunity to shine and display your skills!
Responsibilities
Create, maintain, and implement the source code to develop mobile apps and mobile platform programs
Perform detailed design, development, documentation, debugging and implementation of technical products
Recommend alterations and enhancements to improve the quality of products and processes
Use advanced knowledge of Kotlin/ Swift to produce fully functional mobile applications and write clean code
Share knowledge, coach and mentor team members
Extensive experience in Mobile Application Design using Swift and/or Kotlin is mandatory.
Experience with modern Android architectural patterns (Android Architecture Components) or iOS architectural patterns.
Thorough knowledge of programming concepts, design, procedures and practices
Experience with creating APIs and interfacing with backend services, including familiarity with JSON, REST and XML.
Experience with automated build process, unit testing, source code analysis, and obfuscation.
Ability to work in an agile environment.
Experience with networking, concurrency, design patterns, memory management and debugging in the context of Android applications.
Function well in large-scale, highly complex, cross-functional / platform environment
Good relationship skills, both in directing the technical team and stakeholder interaction.
Only candidates with a high level of expertise in the above list will be contacted so if this is the role you have

been looking for, Apply Now!
Enquiries are welcome and can send to Samiksha at recruitment@corptec.com.au

Stake is looking for a Front End Engineer to focus on our Web (Angular) and Mobile application (Ionic) to join our team, either in Sydney HQ or anywhere remote in Australia.
Stake is a digital brokerage offering seamless access to invest in shares. It is an exciting working environment where everyone is challenged to deliver high-quality execution. It's collaborative and high energy. It's a supportive environment where people are encouraged to take ownership and try things, even if they may fail. Our internal mantra is ‘never settle' and we all share an ambition to do whatever it takes to grow this business forward. This is your opportunity to join a global brand rocketing forward and a team hungry to shake up a category.
About this role
In this role, you will be working on developing a product and you must have a love for design and understand UX/UI principles. You'll also have the freedom to implement suitable technologies to solve particular challenges associated with the global expansion of our products.
A bit about you
Financial markets are complex so we're looking for a hands-on and creative problem solver. You must love working as a team and collaborating with other developers on various features. Also, you have experience with:
Ionic (ideally 6) or Angular (ideally 13)
HTML, CSS (SCSS) and TypeScript;
Let us know if you also have the following experiences but if you don't, we'll show you the ropes!
You have an interest in finance or the markets. Can be a curious interest or a lifelong passion;
You have some experience working on multi-region products or in the financial services sector;
At Stake, we value hustle over honours degrees, so we're more interested in you than your resume. If you believe this is a role you want to jump into head first and be part of our mission, please apply and let us know why in your cover letter!
Our benefits
An Employee Stock Ownership Plan that reflects Stake's high-performance culture and recognises that employees aren't only contributors to the business but are owners of Stake's success
Free Stake Black membership and FX rebates each time you fund your Stake account
An annual discretionary performance bonus (cash or options)
More to come as we grow!
Stake is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We aim at providing an inclusive work environment and do not discriminate based on race, religion, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.
So what happens next?
Once we've received your application, we'll give it as much attention as it deserves and you'll hear from us either way. If we think you will be a good addition to our team, we will give you a call and from there, you'll cruise through our recruitment process. About Us

LocalCryptos is a leading peer-to-peer crypto marketplace. Every day, thousands of people use LocalCryptos to buy and sell cryptocurrencies using our non-custodial wallet and escrow service. Launched in 2017 with an emphasis on privacy and security, LocalCryptos is the first and most popular non-custodial marketplace.

You can learn more about our product at LocalCryptos.com.

Your Role

We are seeking a highly motivated React Native Mobile App Developer to lead the development of a new mobile app interface for LocalCryptos. You will work closely with our technical founder to port our existing React web application to a full-featured React Native mobile application. As the lead developer for mobile, you will be responsible for the full software development life cycle from conception to deployment.

This offer is for a full-time position in Richmond, Melbourne (AU).

Security Emphasis

The LocalCryptos marketplace is not only a website, but an all-in-one cryptocurrency wallet and end-to-end encrypted messaging platform. Because of this, development of any kind requires special attention to detail with security in mind at all times. Applicants should bear in mind that this heavy focus on security can interrupt ‘normal’ coding practices; developers will need to continuously assess potential risks to user's private keys and create innovative alternatives or workarounds.

More information: https://localcryptos.com/security

Tasks and responsibilities will include:

Conceiving, planning, and developing a modern highly responsive and secure mobile user interface with React Native
Building reusable components and libraries for future use
Translating designs and wire-frames from our design team into high-quality code

Requirements:

Proficiency with JavaScript and React Native with at least 3 years of experience in mobile app development
Proficiency with other server-side and front-facing JavaScript technologies, including NodeJS, the DOM, and React
Experience with databases (SQL and NoSQL)
Experience in a broad range of security principals and secure software development practices
Ability to learn new technologies and languages quickly
Strong understanding of mobile application security fundamentals
Familiarity with applied cryptography concepts (private keys, public keys, hashes, encryption)
Familiarity with cryptocurrencies including at minimum Bitcoin and Ethereum

Bonus skills:

Experience with JavaScript testing frameworks such as Mocha
Experience with design tools such as Sketch and Figma
Protocol-level familiarity with Bitcoin or Ethereum

What we offer:

A competitive salary with perks and flexible working arrangements
A chance to work in the emerging blockchain sector and use emerging security technologies

Arq Group is the dynamic space for smart thinkers. We create unforgettable experiences, solve complex challenges, and provide seamless, end-to-end solutions for businesses, big and small…. from design thinking to customer solutions, leading mobile, cloud and analytical insights, digital marketing, to web design. We are Australia’s leading digital partner, powering the growth of businesses, big and small.
ARQ Group enables new opportunities, delivering innovative solutions with passion and purpose to help our customers solve real-world problems (both big and small).

We are an award-winning tech consultancy delivering advisory, design and experience, engineering including mobile, emerging technology, data science, cloud, and managed services; making ARQ Australia’s only end-to-end digital services partner for everything you need in-house, under one roof.
Proudly Australian owned with a 26-year heritage of technological innovation, ARQ bring ideas to life for some of Australia’s largest companies and most-loved household brands with over half of Australia’s top 20 ASX companies and Government trusting ARQ to develop their digital solutions

Our people are our passion, and we have a reputation for only hiring the best out there! Sound like YOU?
What you'll do
Work on large scale enterprise projects
Develop apps used by millions of consumers
Contribute to projects for a wide range of organisation within the Government, Banking and Insurance, Telecommunications, e-commerce, transport,
Work in an agile team who focus on software engineering best practices.
Flexibility to work in multiple projects.
What you’ll be familiar with:
Architecture and design patterns such as MVVM / MVC/MVP,
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience working with iOS programming tools and frameworks (essential) – Xcode, Swift, Combine, SwiftUI
Writing unit tests and E2E tests
What’s in it for you?
Competitive salaries comparable to industry standards
Opportunities to change projects and get entirely new experiences
Fully hybrid work from home / work from office
True work life balance
Highly active social clubs and regular weekly social events and activities
“Well-being” compensation packages
Counselling and support sessions
Board game nights
Team lunches
FREE CAFE COFFEE
Make an impact, not just a living.
At ARQ we build innovative solutions with passion and purpose. That means you’ll be contributing to projects impacting the lives of Australians from real time tracking of bushfires to coronavirus detection in our public water supply.
So, if waking up each day and working on projects with a positive impact and purpose appeals to you, consider joining ARQ to make your mark.
Born locally, built globally.
Join the hometown advantage where investing and up-skilling local talent and supporting local economies is a core value, not a tag line.When you're in between projects we enable people to get their hands on the latest tech and make impactful contribution to organisations around Australia.
So, who are we?
ARQ is Australia's only full-service digital consultancy with a who’s-who of clientele from start-ups, not-for-profits and Australia's biggest banks, airlines, and government departments. We were here at the advent of the internet and have continued to evolve at the speed of technology. As finalists in AFRs Best Places to Work 2020 and with two ARN Women in ICT Finalists, we not only support diversity – we thrive on it. You’ll be part of a professional team that’s all about diversity, equality, teamwork, and mutual support.

Humble when you’re hot?
Like shiny stuff? So do we!
62 design awards, 572 technical certifications, and 17 certified partnerships means ARQ is your multi award-winning technology and innovation think tank helping Australian businesses shape the future.
So, if you can dream it, we can build it.
If it can be imagined, it can be designed, developed, and created.
But it all starts with a vision - your vision - so join us, and together we promise to build a better tomorrow. Apply now!
At ARQ we believe a diverse workforce supported by an inclusive culture is central to our success and we actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity of thought to our business. We support candidate requests for adjustment to accommodate an illness, injury, or disability to equitably participate in the selection process.
At Arq you’ll find a true work-life balance. You’ll be part of a sincere team that’s all about diversity, equality, teamwork and mutual support. Sound like the place for you? Then tell us why you’re the one for us.

At ARQ we build innovative solutions with passion and purpose. That means you’ll be contributing to projects impacting the lives of Australians from real time tracking of bushfires to coronavirus detection in our public water supply.
So, if waking up each day and working on projects with a positive impact and purpose appeals to you, consider joining ARQ to make your mark.
Born locally, built globally.
Join the hometown advantage where investing and up-skilling local talent and supporting local economies is a core value, not a tag line.When you're in between projects we enable people to get their hands on the latest tech and make impactful contribution to organisations around Australia.
So, who are we?
ARQ is Australia's only full-service digital consultancy with a who’s-who of clientele from start-ups, not-for-profits and Australia's biggest banks, airlines, and government departments. We were here at the advent of the internet and have continued to evolve at the speed of technology. As finalists in AFRs Best Places to Work 2020 and with two ARN Women in ICT Finalists, we not only support diversity – we thrive on it. You’ll be part of a professional team that’s all about diversity, equality, teamwork, and mutual support.

Humble when you’re hot?
Like shiny stuff? So do we!
62 design awards, 572 technical certifications, and 17 certified partnerships means ARQ is your multi award-winning technology and innovation think tank helping Australian businesses shape the future.
So, if you can dream it, we can build it.
If it can be imagined, it can be designed, developed, and created.
But it all starts with a vision - your vision - so join us, and together we promise to build a better tomorrow. Apply now!
At ARQ we believe a diverse workforce supported by an inclusive culture is central to our success and we actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity of thought to our business. We support candidate requests for adjustment to accommodate an illness, injury, or disability to equitably participate in the selection process.

Job ID: 593598

Job type: Full Time - Permanent

Categories: Information Technology

Who we are

Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure and facilities.

Position summary

Flexible Working Arrangements

Urban Infrastructure Powerhouse

Learning and Development Opportunities

Downer's Road Services business unit is one of the largest non-government owned road services businesses in Australia. We operate from a network of over 50 depots and maintain more than 30,000 km of road. Our Business is involved in many exciting ventures within the civil road industry throughout the country.

This role reports to the Operational System Leader and is primarily responsible for the front end design and development of Downer’s Asset Management system with the aim of providing a quality user experience.

This is your opportunity to shape the future of major infrastructure in Australia and contribute to the smart cities of the future .

About You

Strong web development skills in React & C#

Understanding of Web API Security Best Practices

A strong full stack development background

The capacity to design and create usable interfaces encompassing both tablet and mobile devices with responsive design techniques

What we offer

Flexible Working

Learning & Development

Highly supportive, team orientated organisation

A strong commitment to Zero Harm environment for all our employees and visitors

Competitive remuneration with on-going training and support

Career opportunity for working with an ASX listed company

Introduction:
About CES

Container Exchange Services (CES) is a joint venture between Coca-Cola Europacific Partners and Lion that was established to provide scalable and sustainable solutions for Container Deposit Schemes (CDS) in Australia and around the World. We power one of Australia’s largest recycling programs: Containers for Change.

We believe there is a better way to recycle that positively impacts individuals, communities, and the environment. Our mission is to increase recycling rates, rid the world of drink container litter, and empower community participation in an accredited circular economy. Our services include IT technology, payments, brand experience, customer support, and auctions.

As an organisation, we are in our fourth successful year of operation having grown rapidly in revenue and people. The business is undergoing massive growth through as we expand into new states.

Description:
About the role

This is a great opportunity to contribute to and work with an organisation making a difference in technology and the circular economy space with exponential and rapid growth plans.

With the attitude of a start-up but the support of a significant multi-national company, CES is a unique place to work.

We are looking for an all round Mobile Developer to join our team and become a key member to contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of our applications.

You will build solutions using the latest delivery techniques, guide others on the journey, and help drive the Container Exchange Services technology strategy.

Skills and Experiences:
Some of the key deliverables of the role:
You are an experienced Mobile Developer who enjoys the challenge and satisfaction of writing complex and efficient code. You will come with knowledge of software engineering best practices (e.g. agile software development, unit testing, code review and design documentation).

Some of your technical experience will include:
Cross platform development using Xamarin, C# and .Net Core
iOS and Android development with Swift, Kotlin/Java, Flutter and Ionic
Mobile testing tools such as Appium
Designing REST APIs
Strong Agile experience
Working with Atlassian tool set, Confluence and Jira.

If you'd like to be considered for this role, please apply now or for further information please contact peopleandculture@coexservices.com.au Introduction:

Opportunity to be a founding member of a new engineering team
Work from the heart of the Gold Coast with flexible working
Significant career opportunities as this division scales around you
This is an opportunity to be a forming team member for one of the biggest software engineering team builds ever seen on the Gold Coast. Working with the latest and greatest in FinTech you will bring work class engineering skills to this high-profile digital engineering team. The role offers hybrid working. This business promotes personal health and work-life balance alongside investment in your career. This is a really exciting time to join this organisation where you can contribute to a significant team ramp up and help set the strategic direction for this digital product roadmap. Roles like this don't come up on the Gold Coast often so reach out to find out more.

Requirements:

Experience in using Redux in both Swift and/or Kotlin
Experience in multiple platforms including iOS and Android
End-to-end experience that extends beyond front-end mobile to the back
Experience working with Agile methodology using tools like JIRA, Bitbucket, Confluence etc.
Understanding of design patterns- MVP/ MVVM / Clean/ Viper architecture
Experience with CI/CD tools such as Bamboo and exposure to testing automation


What's in it for me?

Market leading salary combined with annual bonus
Get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market
Extensive access to personal and technical training
Highly flexible working environment
Work with the latest in fintech
Leadership opportunities as the team grows
Central Gold Coast location near all public transport
WFH the majority of the time
Work with a high-profile corporate with strong community ties on the Gold Coast
