Are you curious about how digital is changing the world?
Join us to lead the digital revolution
Do you want to help the world’s leading brands and governments do more for the people they serve through the power of digital? We can help you do it by broadening and deepening the skills you need to succeed in a fast-moving digital environment. Using your digital talents, you will be ready to challenge the status quo and develop new digital strategies, implement digital technologies and run digital processes on behalf of clients.
Accenture Digital
At Accenture Digital, you will be part of a passionate team leading the way in the fastest paced industry there is. Our entrepreneurial nature allows you to work in a “start-up” culture while enjoying the benefits and opportunities of a global business. Your opportunities to learn and grow are almost limitless, with a range of career options across Mobility, Interactive and Analytics working with diverse teams from Accenture Strategy, Technology, Operations and Consulting.
About you……
The ideal candidate is expected to have a strong experience in mobility with software development skills. The role will be cross industry but experience in Accenture industry groups would be a benefit – Financial Services, Resources, Health & Public Services, Communications, and Media & Technology.
Can demonstrate a deep understanding of SDK’s, frameworks and app development in two or more of the following:
Native iOS app development (Swift / Objective-C is beneficial)
Xamarin iOS/Android/Forms app development
Native Android (Java / Kotlin is beneficial) app development
React Native app development
Has a strong understanding of app security best practices
Has a strong understanding of design principles, patterns and best practices
Has previous experience integrating with JSON/RESTful APIs and authentication models
Has previous experience with TDD and automated test frameworks
Has previous experience working in an Agile environment
Has previous experience using tools such as or similar to JIRA, Confluence and Bitbucket
Has previous experience working with designers and using design tools such as Invision, Zeplin, Freehand
Can demonstrate a deep understanding and experience using source control such as GIT
Previous Team Leadership experience
Excellent presentation, communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Strong organizational, multi-tasking, and time-management skills
University degree in Computer Science or in a related field
Accenture is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All suitably qualified applicants will receive equal and fair consideration for employment.
About Accenture
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 710,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
At Accenture, our philosophy is anchored in recognising that our people are multi-dimensional. We take an intersectional human approach to create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day.
We believe that equality drives innovation. Our commitment to accelerating equality starts at the top with our board and CEO and extends across every part of the company. This comes to life when our people own the equality agenda, making it part of their jobs – every decision, every day – and feel free to speak up and to act.
We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation. We want a workplace that is inclusive and diverse to that end we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals, we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs.
Learn how Accenture protects your personal data and know your rights in relation to your personal data. Read more about our Privacy Statement.

COMPANY OVERVIEWProspecta was founded in 2002 in Sydney, Australia, to provide data management and automation software for enterprise clients. Prospecta has evolved to be a leading data management software company. Prospecta’s flagship product, MDO (Master Data Online), is an enterprise Master Data Management (MDM) platform that enables data management processes: creating accurate, compliant, and applicable master data through to data disposal. We are experiencing rapid growth globally and are expanding our product portfolio with new features, capabilities, and industry-specific solutions. We have a robust process in asset-intensive industries such as Energy and Utilities, Oil and Gas, Mining, Infrastructure and Manufacturing. Our head office is in Sydney, Australia, with offices in India, North America, Canada and local presence in Europe, UK, and Southeast Asia.CULTUREOur culture is built around growth, as we are all loving this challenge. We have a passionate team that work collaboratively to create value for our customers. Our team are from diverse backgrounds, which makes it an exciting place to work. We aim to create an environment that prioritizes individual development and is built on a mutual success culture. Both professional and personal development are major factors contributing to an individual’s success. Therefore, we support our employees’ passion, making them feel more engaged and motivated at work and life in general. Career progression looks less like climbing a ladder and more like a continuous flow of exciting, meaningful opportunities that facilitate personal development and technical mastery under the mentorship of great leaders. We are a growing organization backed by private equity funding that allows us to scale up, and “Human Capital” is fundamental to us. We have flexible working arrangements during these unprecedented times to come to work only for two days, only if you live near a Prospecta Office. We have an interconnected organisational structure with a focus on being agile, responsive, and achieving outcomes. Our Benefits are a mix of the Industry Benchmark Compensation and the Employee Share Options. The ESOPs are more notable in Prospecta, as there is substantial growth in the coming years. We are all striving and contributing towards the growth of our options. If you are the one who would want to be part of the growing company and, at times, wear multiple hats and does not resist walking that extra mile to meet the goals, then this is the workplace for you. We courageously work hard and aim to push the boundaries in everything we do while sharing a sense of fun and celebrating both the small and big wins.ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Product design and development ensuring MDO Platform is functional and visually appealing.Lead ideation sessions to progress the UX/UI of the product.Translate customer insights into concepts, personas, user journeys, storyboards, system maps, user flows, wireframes, visual design comps and prototypes.Create and implement innovative user experiencesAlongside understanding the customer, understand business drivers, define UX metrics against those drivers, measure and report on results, followed by championing UXD strategy and enhancements based on data analysis.Work closely with Engineering to ensure a high-quality implementation and user experienceWork closely with the Product Management team to improve UX and refine the product roadmapCommunicate the product’s vision, based on testing and design principles, to team members and internal stakeholders.EXPERIENCE & SKILLSMust have either bachelor’s or equivalent degree or certification in Web Technology.5+ years of work experience with the product company.Experience in designing digital products, from web/desktop to mobile.Strong understanding of design thinking.Experience with wire-framing and prototyping as a means to explore and convey design solutions.Experience using Human Centred Design techniques to understand user behaviour and expectations.Familiarity with design and prototyping tools like Figma, Adobe Creative SuiteA strong portfolio of interaction and visual design workDemonstrated capability in designing end to end UX, from discovery to polished designsDemonstrated capability in creating digital user experience strategiesAbility to work independently in a small team with broad responsibilitiesStrong people skills and the ability to work flexibly and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, Angular, JavaScript, jQuery, and CSS.WHAT WILL YOU GET?You will be part of a rapidly growing Australian-based global company. You will be part of a team who are experts in enterprise data management, working in a company that has a 20-year history of delivering valuable client solutions. You will have the opportunity to take your experience and skillsets to new levels We are an inclusive organisation that respects diversity and is supportive of flexible work practices. The contribution of our people is our greatest asset – we appreciate that and continually strive to provide an environment that encourages autonomy, mastery and purpose.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $80,000.00 – $110,000.00 per yearBenefits:Referral programWork from homeSchedule:Day shiftSupplementary Pay:Overtime payPerformance bonusAbility to commute/relocate:Chatswood, NSW 2067: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Education:Bachelor Degree (Preferred)Experience:Software development: 1 year (Preferred)Work Authorisation:Australia (Preferred) COMPANY OVERVIEWProspecta was founded in 2002 in Sydney, Australia, to provide data management and automation software for enterprise clients. Here at Luxury Escapes, our mission is to delight our customers with incredible deals for the world's best holidays.
Unlike most travel companies investing in our tech and our teams while the rest of the travel industry has done the opposite. We had been saying “it’s a funny time for a travel company to be hiring” – but that’s no longer true. Travel is bouncing back in a big way.
As customers return to travel with new habits, the industry is re-shaping itself, and a lot of business will move online. At Luxury Escapes, we want to take advantage of that shift. So, we are building new teams to help us deliver some very exciting projects, which we will tell you all about once you apply!
Our cross-functional teams include Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers, focused on delivering solutions and solving problems rather than simply completing tickets.
The structure is flat and the process super-lean, focusing on a culture of MVP, iteration, and "build, measure, learn", with continuous improvement at the heart of everything we do.
Our team share in-depth experience from the worlds of Android, iOS, Node/Typescript, React, PostgreSQL, AWS Lambda, and more. We love learning and hold regular "tech forums" to learn from peers or discuss the tech issues of the day. We also have some really great developers, so you'll be both well supported and challenged!
As a Mobile Engineer here at Luxury Escapes you will be responsible for the delivery of features and enhancements relating to the Luxury Escapes mobile platform. We're part way through a complete re-build of both our iOS and Android apps, so it's an exciting time to be in the mobile team.
We're agile, so we have daily stand ups, autonomous teams, and developers deploy to production many times every day. We have a flat, collaborative structure both within and between teams.
We are operating a hybrid working model (collaboration is at the heart of everything we do) so you'll split your time in the office and a home. In Sydney, we are a short walk from Wynyard station, close to great lunch spots and cafes.
Employee experience is king here, with weekly events, monthly recognition programs and significant professional development opportunities. (We have won awards for it – but the HR team don’t like to brag much!)
Relevant skills:
Swift, Swift and Swift!
Reactive Programming (ReactiveSwift, RxSwift or Combine)
Experience with SwiftUI and Combine
Automated testing and continuous integration
High level of attention to detail and a passion for problem solving
Strong self-motivation
Good communication skills
A genuine passion for seeing our customers enjoying their escapes.
Nice to have: Android experience (we use Kotlin and Jetpack Compose!) or Node.js
Benefits:
Excellent Remuneration package
20% Discount on Luxury Holidays and Experiences
Buy up to 4 weeks extra annual leave a year.
Health and Wellbeing programs
A bonus day of birthday leave
Flexible working conditions
Breakfast, coffee and fruit provided
A super collaborative team that enjoys creating great platforms
If this role sounds appealing but you don't check every box, apply anyway, we want to hear what you can do!

Mobile Apps(Android) Developer
Work Location:

Sydney
Role type:

Full Time
Job Description:
5+ years of development experience in Android App Development. Android with Kotlin experience.
Familiar with different versions of Android and Android SDK. Ability to understand the requirements of business and translate them technically.
Familiar with outside data sources and APIs. Strong knowledge of Google’s Android design principles and guidelines.

Collaborate with the Senior Android Developers and Software Engineers to work on different layers of the infrastructure.
Determine the UI/UX requirements, mockups and APIs to develop high-performing Android apps. Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Must have full Australian working rights (PR / Citizen).

In this role, your day will look something like this:

Develop, record and maintain web-based PHP applications.
Build innovative, state-of-the-art applications and collaborate with the User Experience (UX) team
Utilize backend data services and contribute to increase existing data services API
Use test driven development and acceptance tests to ensure feature quality
Coordinate with co-developers and keeps project manager well informed of the status of development effort and serves as liaison between development staff and project manager

You’ll fit right in if you have the following skills:

Must-Have:

Excellent knowledge of the core PHP, HTML5, JavaScript, JQuery Expert
Good knowledge of SQL and related databases, with a preference for those with MySQL experience.
Experience with PHP MVC frameworks (Laravel, CodeIgniter)
Experience with building restful JSON web services for Mobile API
User authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments

About Costa:
Costa, an ASX listed company, is Australia’s leading grower, packer and marketer of premium quality fresh fruit and vegetables.
On the land, in distribution centres, and out on the roads – Costa people work hard to bring the freshest produce to tables across Australia. But joining our team is about more than just hard work. It’s about picking a meaningful, sustainable job that’s good for you, and for Australia. Costa is committed to sustainable agriculture. Not only is it a key strategy for maximising our profitability, it’s also crucial to ensuring that our country’s natural resources are utilised in both an environmentally responsible and efficient manner. By taking this approach, Costa grows products which are healthy, safe and of the highest quality, while at the same time protecting and improving the natural environment. With over 60 farms across Australia, our produce includes avocados, berries, citrus, grapes, mushroom and tomatoes.
Our produce is supplied to all the major Australian supermarket chains, as well as independent grocers and a range of food industry stakeholders. We also export to Asia, North America and Europe.

About the Role:
This position offers an opportunity to an ambitious and career minded individual wanting to be part of a great team within Costa. You will be part of the Technology Solutions Team, developing solutions both for SAP ECC6 and in BW/4HANA.
The role involves:
Design, develop and test custom programs, transactions, custom tables and data objects based on functional requirements in SAP ECC6
Assist with day to day SAP support (level 2 and 3) and effectively engage with the business to provide viable and best practice solutions.
Develop, test and implement Enhancements / BAdi's/ user exits to standard SAP programs
Develop, test and implement custom reports, BAPI's, RFCs
Develop, test and implement APIs (OData Gateway Services) for consumption by web applications and mobile devices
Develop, test and implement SAP forms (Adobe PDF Print Forms, Smartforms)
Provide technical documentation of all developed programs and transactions based on functional requirements.
Ensure all processes in your area are covered thoroughly for Integration and UAT test cycles.
Investigate and resolve efforts, defects, and incidents reported on the test and production systems as required.
Perform all necessary steps to ensure smooth Cutover.
Meet project deadlines. Participate in project planning activities and manage the execution of work program according to plan.
Work closely with other developers, technical and functional team members to deliver and deploy outcomes.
Based in our corporate head office in Melbourne (Western suburbs), this permanent full time role offers flexible working arrangements including work from home if desired.
About You:
The successful candidate will have a proven SAP technical and functional experience, excellent communication skills, team skills, and knowledge of ITIL tools, methodologies, and approaches.
Key skills and experience required for this role include:
Expert knowledge in ABAP, ABAP OO and related development technologies (minimum of 8 years of experience)
Outstanding technical skills, with the ability to understand complex processes and systems
Good understanding of core SAP functional areas
Experienced in a commercial IT development environment.
Exceptional communication, organisational skills, both written and verbal
Must be a team player with experience in working across multiple technology teams
Ability to work across a complex IT environment in a global environment
Passionate about building a service delivery culture to Costa Technology
Resilient and supportive to manage change in behaviours, technology and processes
Preferred Skills:
Understanding of Microsoft Azure platform options for integration with SAP
Experience in working in an agile environment
Experience with Eclipse as IDE for ABAP development
Experience with Git for source control (ABAPgit)
For further information please contact Mark Brown (CIO) mark.brown@costagroup.com.au

Mable is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. People with lived experience of disability or personal experience with the aged care system are strongly encouraged to apply.

About Us
Founded in 2014, Mable has become one of Australia's largest and fastest growing healthtech marketplaces. Our platform is an online community of independent support workers who offer their services directly to people who are seeking aged care or disability support.
With over 3 million hours of support being facilitated through its platform annually, Mable has been growing at a very fast pace and is now at 300+ employees strong.
We’re thrilled to have been recognised within AFR’s Fast 100 list in 2021, Deloitte’s Tech Fast 50 2021 Awards and we won the Australian Growth & Australian Technology Growth Company of the Year Award 2020! This is an awesome opportunity to join a thriving scale up whose profit for purpose mission is transforming the aged care and disability support sectors.
Mission: We’re redefining support for disability and aged care in Australia by helping people who are aging or living with disability to connect with independent support people in their community.
About the role As Mable’s continues to grow and scale, so do its engineering requirements. This role will play a critical role in contributing towards our Frontend Team, primarily working with Angular (v10) framework. This role will be placed in a cross-functional squad and work on key aspects of our platform to deliver values to our customers.
How you will make an impactWe take user experience very seriously at Mable and as a member of the Frontend Team, you will be responsible for delivering exceptional user experience through your implementation and problem solving skills. We take great pride in making our platform as accessible as possible for a wide range of users and you will contribute towards solving real problems and delivering innovative solutions.
Who you will be working with Within your squad, you will be working with a product manager, a data scientist, UI/UX designer, QA and several engineers. Your squad is autonomous and empowered to validate problems faced by real users and collaborate to come up with solutions. You will also be part of the Frontend Team. There you will provide your technical expertise and experience to maintain and improve our frontend codebase.
What will I be doing?
Be part of our cross-functional squad and collaborate with its members and stakeholders to solve problems and design solutions for our users in both the disability and aged care sector.
Be part of our Frontend team, understand the best practice in frontend engineering, contribute your technical expertise and help the team produce consistent and high-quality code.
Work with UX/UI designers and QA to make sure our web and mobile applications are designed and developed purposefully and meeting high accessibility standards.
Own the features you work on, help other engineers with code reviews, release our features to our production environments, help squad maintain and fix bugs.
What are we looking for?
Someone with 3-5 years of professional experience in working with Angular (2-14) applications
Extensive knowledge of CSS and JS
Unit testing experience with ideally Jasmine/Karma
Experience implementing responsive applications on web
Ability to translate static designs / interactive prototypes into Angular
Demonstrate empathy for the end user
Comfortable working in an agile environment with a cross-functional team.
Excellent in both written and verbal communication.
Benefits of Working at Mable
WFH Set Up Allowance - $800 (gross) payment to all new employees to kit out their home office.
Competitive salary packages everyone at Mable contributes to the bigger picture mission. We want you to feel rewarded with our packages & incentives.
Floating Public Holidays is just one way the company demonstrates its commitment to the wellbeing of our people and creating a culture of greater inclusion.
Volunteer Day A paid day per calendar year to volunteer for your community
Wellbeing Day Enjoy a paid day each calendar year to focus on your health and wellbeing.
Birthday Leave Take your birthday off on us!
Work Away Work overseas for four work weeks in a rolling 12 month period so long as you are available during core business hours
Paid Parental Leave a gender neutral policy for primary (14 weeks + super) and secondary (6x weeks + super) carers
We value wellbeing: We’re here to support you in times of need with our Employee Assistance Program (App + counselling)
Diversity & Inclusion we are endorsed by Work180 as an accredited employer for women in tech.
Team hybrid working arrangements balance collaboration with home and family commitments.
Office Location Two minutes walk from Town Hall station, we’ve recently taken over an entire floor of the Hilton Hotel building (hello, #scaleup life)
Celebrate Success we’re here for the good vibes and celebrating our wins, no matter how big or small.
Anniversary Awards - a visa gift card on us to celebrate each year you work at Mable
Reward and Recognition Program We have a fun, easy and accessible Reward & Recognition Program in place, aligned to the Mable values with quarterly nominations and winners.
Accelerate your career: Be a part of one of Australia's fastest growing Marketplaces. We are a scale-up tech-co and our people are a huge part of this. We want all of our Mablers to feel supported in their careers and for Mable to be the place where they can grow to their full potential.
Our Values
All About People - We put our customers at the centre of everything we do
Better Together - We are stronger, better and faster when we work together
Challenge Openly - Speak up. Candid discussion helps us make better decisions.
Do The Right Thing, Always - We hold ourselves to the highest standard. What we say and do matters.
CrEate Impact - We are passionate about having an impact.
Role Location
At Mable we believe that collaboration and team connection is key for success. This role can either be based in Sydney (mix of office / home) or fully remote within Australia. We're all about creating opportunities for people, regardless of where they live.
Additional Information
We’re endorsed by Work180 which showcases our commitment to our policies, flexible working and inclusion practices for women in tech.
Our Work180 page - https://tinyurl.com/3m8xxa6z
If this role has stood out to you but you don’t feel like you ‘’tick all the boxes’’, we strongly encourage you to apply nonetheless. We value diversity across experience and you might well just bring something to the Mablehood that we are looking for!
Our interview processes are inclusive and will accommodate additional needs when required.
We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant

LinkedIn:https://bit.ly/3ie6Q4U Mable is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. People with lived experience of disability or personal experience with the aged care system are strongly encouraged to apply.

About Us
Founded in 2014, Mable has become one of Australia's largest and fastest growing healthtech marketplaces. Our platform is an online community of independent support workers who offer their services directly to people who are seeking aged care or disability support.
With over 3 million hours of support being facilitated through its platform annually, Mable has been growing at a very fast pace and is now at 300+ employees strong.
We’re thrilled to have been recognised within AFR’s Fast 100 list in 2021, Deloitte’s Tech Fast 50 2021 Awards and we won the Australian Growth & Australian Technology Growth Company of the Year Award 2020! This is an awesome opportunity to join a thriving scale up whose profit for purpose mission is transforming the aged care and disability support sectors.
Mission: We’re redefining support for disability and aged care in Australia by helping people who are aging or living with disability to connect with independent support people in their community.
About the role As Mable’s continues to grow and scale, so do its engineering requirements. This role will play a critical role in contributing towards our Frontend Team, primarily working with Angular (v10) framework. This role will be placed in a cross-functional squad and work on key aspects of our platform to deliver values to our customers.
How you will make an impactWe take user experience very seriously at Mable and as a member of the Frontend Team, you will be responsible for delivering exceptional user experience through your implementation and problem solving skills. We take great pride in making our platform as accessible as possible for a wide range of users and you will contribute towards solving real problems and delivering innovative solutions.
Who you will be working with Within your squad, you will be working with a product manager, a data scientist, UI/UX designer, QA and several engineers. Your squad is autonomous and empowered to validate problems faced by real users and collaborate to come up with solutions. You will also be part of the Frontend Team. There you will provide your technical expertise and experience to maintain and improve our frontend codebase.
What will I be doing?
Be part of our cross-functional squad and collaborate with its members and stakeholders to solve problems and design solutions for our users in both the disability and aged care sector.
Be part of our Frontend team, understand the best practice in frontend engineering, contribute your technical expertise and help the team produce consistent and high-quality code.
Work with UX/UI designers and QA to make sure our web and mobile applications are designed and developed purposefully and meeting high accessibility standards.
Own the features you work on, help other engineers with code reviews, release our features to our production environments, help squad maintain and fix bugs.
What are we looking for?
Someone with 3-5 years of professional experience in working with Angular (2-14) applications
Extensive knowledge of CSS and JS
Unit testing experience with ideally Jasmine/Karma
Experience implementing responsive applications on web
Ability to translate static designs / interactive prototypes into Angular
Demonstrate empathy for the end user
Comfortable working in an agile environment with a cross-functional team.
Excellent in both written and verbal communication.
Benefits of Working at Mable
WFH Set Up Allowance - $800 (gross) payment to all new employees to kit out their home office.
Competitive salary packages everyone at Mable contributes to the bigger picture mission. We want you to feel rewarded with our packages & incentives.
Floating Public Holidays is just one way the company demonstrates its commitment to the wellbeing of our people and creating a culture of greater inclusion.
Volunteer Day A paid day per calendar year to volunteer for your community
Wellbeing Day Enjoy a paid day each calendar year to focus on your health and wellbeing.
Birthday Leave Take your birthday off on us!
Work Away Work overseas for four work weeks in a rolling 12 month period so long as you are available during core business hours
Paid Parental Leave a gender neutral policy for primary (14 weeks + super) and secondary (6x weeks + super) carers
We value wellbeing: We’re here to support you in times of need with our Employee Assistance Program (App + counselling)
Diversity & Inclusion we are endorsed by Work180 as an accredited employer for women in tech.
Team hybrid working arrangements balance collaboration with home and family commitments.
Office Location Two minutes walk from Town Hall station, we’ve recently taken over an entire floor of the Hilton Hotel building (hello, #scaleup life)
Celebrate Success we’re here for the good vibes and celebrating our wins, no matter how big or small.
Anniversary Awards - a visa gift card on us to celebrate each year you work at Mable
Reward and Recognition Program We have a fun, easy and accessible Reward & Recognition Program in place, aligned to the Mable values with quarterly nominations and winners.
Accelerate your career: Be a part of one of Australia's fastest growing Marketplaces. We are a scale-up tech-co and our people are a huge part of this. We want all of our Mablers to feel supported in their careers and for Mable to be the place where they can grow to their full potential.
Our Values
All About People - We put our customers at the centre of everything we do
Better Together - We are stronger, better and faster when we work together
Challenge Openly - Speak up. Candid discussion helps us make better decisions.
Do The Right Thing, Always - We hold ourselves to the highest standard. What we say and do matters.
CrEate Impact - We are passionate about having an impact.
Role Location
At Mable we believe that collaboration and team connection is key for success. This role can either be based in Sydney (mix of office / home) or fully remote within Australia. We're all about creating opportunities for people, regardless of where they live.
Additional Information
We’re endorsed by Work180 which showcases our commitment to our policies, flexible working and inclusion practices for women in tech.
Our Work180 page - https://tinyurl.com/3m8xxa6z
If this role has stood out to you but you don’t feel like you ‘’tick all the boxes’’, we strongly encourage you to apply nonetheless. We value diversity across experience and you might well just bring something to the Mablehood that we are looking for!
Our interview processes are inclusive and will accommodate additional needs when required.
We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant

Our Digital team is looking for a talented Engineer with development skills across a variety of languages and technologies to join our growing team.

The Role:

The role will involve working as part of the Empired team to lead the way in delivering new functionality, enhancements and performance improvements, using primarily Microsoft tooling such as .NET (web and desktop), WebApi, SQL (Oracle and SQL Server). You must be a strong team player and will need to have strong verbal and written communications skills, as the role will involve working directly with clients as part of an Empired team.

What you will do:

Work as part of a team, providing digital consulting services to one of our customers, a global mining client.
Develop a deep, expert-level understanding of our client's software systems, becoming an acknowledged expert and trusted advisor.
Develop web, desktop, services and database systems in .NET Framework, .NET Core, WebApi, Oracle or SQL Server. Skills in Java, F# and other languages would be highly valued.
Produce high quality code that follows coding best practices and is unit tested.
Provide guidance and support for junior team members, including reviewing their code and mentoring.
Be a team player who shares knowledge and works to uphold high standards within our team.
Contribute to our vibrant and diverse team culture.

What you need to be successful:

At least 2 years commercial web/desktop applications development experience
At least 2 years commercial C# and SQL experience in either Oracle or SQL Server.
Excellent understanding of the .NET Framework
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Relevant tertiary qualifications and / or industry certification & experience
Outstanding communication and relationship building skills.
A sense of humour!

Desirable skills:

Knowledge of industry best practices, coding standards, effective documentation, and production of maintainable code
Knowledge of Agile methodologies
Knowledge of multiple programming languages or a willingness to learn will be an asset in our team.

Why join us?
Because it means being part of an exceptionally talented group of people that deliver leading edge advice and solutions to our clients.
We want you to love it here as much as we love having you! So, aside from offering a great job in fantastic locations with plenty of opportunities to train and progress your career we offer; health insurance, mobile phone plans covered by us, travel insurance and so much more.

What next?
Head on over to our website to really get to know us and find out more about who we are and what we get up to.
We really want to hear from you, even if it's just to ask some questions, or to have a chat in confidence. Email Sam Hooper, Talent Experience Business Partner. sam.hooper@intergen.co.nz

Empired and Intergen are committed to considering all applications for employment from all suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, race or skin colour, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, family or carer's responsibility, pregnancy, religion or political opinion, or national origin

Hello. We’re Bilue.Bilue is an Australian consultancy company focusing on mobile technology. Our founder and CEO, Cameron Barrie, an app developer himself, originally started the company in his living room. 11 years later we now have offices in Sydney and Melbourne and a growing team of 60+.Bilue = Big + Blue OceanAt Bilue, we take our clients confidently out into the 'Big Blue Ocean' where we can explore new opportunities together.About the role: As a Senior Mobile Engineer at Bilue, you’ll be working in an agile environment alongside an in-house team of engineers, designers and product owners. You'll be working on a range of exciting projects, partnering with some of Australia's most well known and loved brands.Reporting to the Head of Engineering, you will be required to:Design, build and maintain high performance reusable and reliable code for the relevant platformEnsure the successful integration with back-end servicesEnsure the best possible performance, quality and responsiveness of applicationsHelp maintain code quality, organisation and automation through user testing and peer reviewsIdentify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugsBe informed in the emerging ways to approach testing and encourage better practices to improve overall product qualityAbout you: In-depth experience in creating large scale mobile applicationsStrong knowledge and experience using the relevant programming languages ie. Job DescriptionThis is your opportunity to join a team of forward-thinking, change-making individuals transforming healthcare experiences. Operating at the intersection of two fast-growing industries – health and tech – you’ll play an active role in shaping the future of healthcare in Australia.Our missionHealthengine is a purpose-led business, and Australia’s largest consumer healthcare platform, helping people navigate the complex world of healthcare. We’re on a mission to transform humanity’s health, one care experience at a time. Healthengine’s platform brings together a leading range of healthcare practices, healthcare specialties and health ecosystem partners in a suite of integrated offerings to help people get a better experience across each step of their healthcare journey.We’re all patients, right? So, it’s easy to get behind a mission that seeks to improve the healthcare experience for all Australians.The GigThe purpose of this role is to support our marketing, growth and product teams by producing both digital and non-digital assets to be used in marketing campaigns. You’ll be asked to shape the direction of our products, turning insights into innovative, transformative experiences.Responsibilities: Gathering and interpretation of user insights, feedback and behavioural information to inform product needs and design.Design and develop assets including but not limited; SaaS product packaging, web graphics, Company web pages, email marketing, product brochures, promotional materials in line with our brand guidelines and graphic design basics.Work alongside other designs, developers and marketers to influence web design and ensure the consistency and effective delivery of product positioning.Maintain our brand guidelines and empower other departments to use these consistentlyFollow UX methodologies to gather and interpret user insights, feedback, and behavioural information to inform and validate design decisions.Facilitate and participate in design thinking workshopsDeliver and take ownership for solving design problems, from running research to wireframes through to finalised UI design and working with engineers for implementation.About YouYou flourish in a fast-moving, agile environment and thrive in a tech culture where growth is inevitable. You are smart, strong and passionate and always lead with head and heart. You are balanced; knowing how to have fun but how to focus and get things done. You speak openly, candidly and authentically to challenge yourself and others. You’re impact and results driven, with a ‘done is better than perfect’ attitude. You are a creative problem-solver, always seeking to find unique and valuable solutions.Experience you’ll bring: 3+ years experience as a Graphic Designer, with some user experience/interface designArray of practical graphic design experience supported by a portfolio of relevant work including demonstrating a track record of delivering end-to-end UX and UI design.Highly proficient with Figma, Sketch (for Mac) or Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign (for Windows).Ability to produce original vector graphics for use in marketing materials.Ability to effectively create draft design ideas that can be presented to stakeholders.The ability to deliver cross-platform design, including demonstrated experience designing for mobile with strong understanding of Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines & Google’s Material Design Guidelines.The ability to translate UX design into highly-polished, detailed, and considered interface design.Additional InformationThe perks behind the workHealthengine is where you’ll be your best self. You’ll collaborate with smart, interesting people who will challenge you to be better. In addition to an array of growth opportunities, we also offer:Freedom and flexibility to work the way you want, including remote workRegular virtual and in-person social eventsFully stocked kitchen with coffee on tap (Perth)Salary sacrifice and salary packaging optionsExtra leave so you can recharge and focus on your wellbeingWorkplace wellness benefitsA base salary between $80,000 - $90,000 plus superDiversity and inclusionHealthengine believes in the power of a diverse work environment and are fully committed to building and maintaining an inclusive culture. We believe that our differences can create new ideas, offer unique perspectives and speak on behalf of all of our customers and consumers. If you think you have what it takes but don't check all the boxes, reach out anyway - we’d love to hear from you.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $80,000.00 – $90,000.00 per year Job DescriptionThis is your opportunity to join a team of forward-thinking, change-making individuals transforming healthcare experiences. Arq Group is the dynamic space for smart thinkers. We create unforgettable experiences, solve complex challenges, and provide seamless, end-to-end solutions for businesses, big and small…. from design thinking to customer solutions, leading mobile, cloud and analytical insights, digital marketing, to web design. We are Australia’s leading digital partner, powering the growth of businesses, big and small.
The Angular Developer role is an exciting opportunity to join Arq group at a pivotal time as we are shaking things up in Federal Government. We’ve already got significant momentum, so looking for someone who represents our core values (Impact, Innovation and Local) to help us continue towards achieving our big hairy audacious goals. You will deeply understand the importance of culture, and be experienced in driving it through your personal leadership capability, collaborative approach, and positive ‘how can we’ attitude critical in a fast paced start-up/ scale up environment.
Our team is currently looking for skilled Angular Developers that share our passion to work on a key enterprise project noting immediate availability and Australian Citizenship will be key to successful appointments on these projects.
It’s a unique opportunity, so we are looking for the best, If you are humble, hungry and smart, and looking for an opportunity to build something amazing that really makes an impact, we would love to hear from you and discuss the opportunity together.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop code for intermediate modules, following documentation and development standards.
Recommend project approaches and submit time and cost estimates.
Responsible for designing environment with licensing restrictions and future upgrades in mind.
Analyze Production implementation – identify and resolve errors, ensure ongoing stability of the environment
Assess implications of leveraging portlets and architect solutions accordingly.
Communicate topology server administrators.
Establish bandwidth limitations and plan accordingly.
Initiate and manage POC’s and prototypes as required.
Assist in load testing & penetration testing on different environments.
Track and resolve intermediate defects and assists in planning efforts of intermediate functional tests in support of Quality Control (QC).
Conduct basic levels of module and integration testing according to process standards; track and resolve moderate defects.
Required Experience / Skills
At least 4 years of hands on experience with the following technologies:
Angular, React, TypeScript, JavaScript(ES6), HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, Git,
Proven experience implementing front-end and back-end JavaScript applications.
Extensive experience in web testing stack - Karma, Chai, Sinon, Jasmine
Familiarity with more current specifications of EcmaScript, core JavaScript concepts like object-oriented programming.
Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token
Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools using Agile methodology.
At Arq you’ll find a true work-life balance. You’ll be part of a sincere team that’s all about diversity, equality, teamwork and mutual support. Sound like the place for you? Then tell us why you’re the one for us.

About Us A man, a van, and a lot of hard work. That’s where we were when we started more than 38 years ago. Back then, we were supplying local motels and cafes in Shepparton. That gave us the regional outlook that we have upheld ever since.We have expanded to other important hubs in Mount Gambier and Geelong to support the regional cafes. We brought Evoke Coffee and Belfresco into the family in 2021 and now roast them in our Shepparton facility.We are a family-owned business with a soft spot for COFFEE. We are a trusted leader in the coffee industry, providing you with top-quality wholesale brands, coffee education and consulting.As a family-owned business, we are focused on building partnerships that last with our customers.Who we are looking for: We’re looking for a super talented Senior app developer who is ready to test their skills and help us build an app to make our customer’s life easier. In this role, you will be empowered to contribute to our technical direction and work closely with internal teams. We want you to bring your own ideas to the table, and to have a critical voice in the direction of both the product and the company.To succeed in this role, we are looking for someone who applies a high-level of craftsmanship to the job, has a pixel-perfect attitude, and is passionate about the work they do. You must be an effective communicator, a strong team player and someone who loves building quality software. You must be agile in mindset and practice. We have a huge vision so it’s not for the faint-hearted.You have: Preferably, a bachelor’s or above degree in Software Engineering or a related field3+ years working in and designing for both Android and iOS appsExperience with native development on Android and iOS platformsFirm grasp of the JavaScript language and its nuances, including ES6+ syntaxAbility to write well-documented, clean JavaScript codeExposure to TypeScriptUnderstanding of REST APIs, the document request model, and offline storageProficiency in mobile app security best practices (OAuth / OpenID)Experience with Figma, Visual Studio Code, Azure DevOps and Git repos highly valuedYou will: Lead the development of our Evolve North ordering mobile appWork collaboratively with our IT Manager and sales teams to build an app people rave aboutBuild pixel-perfect, silky smooth UIs across Android and iOS mobile platformsBring a sense of acumen to the product by proactively identifying improvements and optionsLeverage native APIs for deep integrations with both platformsWork with internal and external teams to ensure that the product meets our company goalsDiagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks for performance that feels nativeQuality assurance testing, bug fixing and improving application performanceWhat success looks like: In the first month, you will get into the core of the product, building a strong knowledge base, and identify improvements both to the product and build ship quality code. We want your fresh perspectives and best-in-class practices to permeate throughout the engineering team.In the next few months, you will start executing against our North Star objectives, elevating our product to the next level and leading the launch of our exciting roadmap of new features. Most importantly, you will become a key focal point of our organisation, and a key component of our future success.The team You will be directly reporting to the General Manager and work closely with our IT Manager and Marketing Manager. Your valued input and ideas will positively impact the current and future operations of the company.Values· Contactable· Accountability · Reliable · EasyHelping businesses succeed is why we show up every day. We invest time into understanding what matters most in accomplishing our purpose and use data to make sound decisions and determine the best course of action.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $90,000.00 – $100,000.00 per yearBenefits:Visa sponsorshipSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplementary Pay:Performance bonusAbility to commute/relocate:Shepparton, VIC 3630: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Experience:App Development: 1 year (Preferred)Work Authorisation:Australia (Required) About Us A man, a van, and a lot of hard work. That’s where we were when we started more than 38 years ago. Back then, we were supplying local motels and cafes in Shepparton. That gave us the regional outlook that we have upheld ever since.We have expanded to other important hubs in Mount Gambier and Geelong to support the regional cafes. We brought Evoke Coffee and Belfresco into the family in 2021 and now roast them in our Shepparton facility.We are a family-owned business with a soft spot for COFFEE. We are a trusted leader in the coffee industry, providing you with top-quality wholesale brands, coffee education and consulting.As a family-owned business, we are focused on building partnerships that last with our customers.Who we are looking for: We’re looking for a super talented Senior app developer who is ready to test their skills and help us build an app to make our customer’s life easier. In this role, you will be empowered to contribute to our technical direction and work closely with internal teams. We want you to bring your own ideas to the table, and to have a critical voice in the direction of both the product and the company.To succeed in this role, we are looking for someone who applies a high-level of craftsmanship to the job, has a pixel-perfect attitude, and is passionate about the work they do. You must be an effective communicator, a strong team player and someone who loves building quality software. You must be agile in mindset and practice. We have a huge vision so it’s not for the faint-hearted.You have: Preferably, a bachelor’s or above degree in Software Engineering or a related field3+ years working in and designing for both Android and iOS appsExperience with native development on Android and iOS platformsFirm grasp of the JavaScript language and its nuances, including ES6+ syntaxAbility to write well-documented, clean JavaScript codeExposure to TypeScriptUnderstanding of REST APIs, the document request model, and offline storageProficiency in mobile app security best practices (OAuth / OpenID)Experience with Figma, Visual Studio Code, Azure DevOps and Git repos highly valuedYou will: Lead the development of our Evolve North ordering mobile appWork collaboratively with our IT Manager and sales teams to build an app people rave aboutBuild pixel-perfect, silky smooth UIs across Android and iOS mobile platformsBring a sense of acumen to the product by proactively identifying improvements and optionsLeverage native APIs for deep integrations with both platformsWork with internal and external teams to ensure that the product meets our company goalsDiagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks for performance that feels nativeQuality assurance testing, bug fixing and improving application performanceWhat success looks like: In the first month, you will get into the core of the product, building a strong knowledge base, and identify improvements both to the product and build ship quality code. We want your fresh perspectives and best-in-class practices to permeate throughout the engineering team.In the next few months, you will start executing against our North Star objectives, elevating our product to the next level and leading the launch of our exciting roadmap of new features. Most importantly, you will become a key focal point of our organisation, and a key component of our future success.The team You will be directly reporting to the General Manager and work closely with our IT Manager and Marketing Manager. Your valued input and ideas will positively impact the current and future operations of the company.Values· Contactable· Accountability · Reliable · EasyHelping businesses succeed is why we show up every day. Work Type: Full Time

Lead Role
Flexible Working
Great Benefits Package

Leading Australian Company requires a Mobile Application Technical Lead to support a large-scale transformation program. The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering initiatives spanning business and technology teams leveraging agile practices to deliver exceptional member, employee and partner experiences and outcomes. This role exists to perform all aspects of programming for assigned projects to develop, enhance or maintain software applications.

Responsibilities:

Work across multiple project teams for the successful delivery of programs of work to meet company objectives by:

Conducts analysis to determine system requirements and system impacts for new or enhanced applications to plan and provide estimates for development tasks
Determines development approach options and recommends the most effective approach
Engages with business users, business/technical analysts, solution architects and others to understand needs and requirements for project and maintenance development tasks
Designs and codes quality programs of all levels of complexity in alignment with business requirements and solution architecture for project and maintenance activities
Required Skills & Experience:


Extensive expertise in Web/Mobile application development including:
Delivering high quality native and hybrid mobile solutions
Working with entire mobile application stack and mobile development best practices
Strong hands on experience on React Native, framework based mobile app development
Working with Android Studio and Xcode IDEs
Significant knowledge of object-oriented programming, applying SOLID principals and design patterns
Excellent knowledge of system development lifecycle methodologies including agile
Proven track record in integration and development of distributed software applications including cloud-based applications
Strong understanding of web services/REST, client server technology, web architectures including SEO, mobile web and responsive web design
Working with mobile and web data structures and design patterns
Releasing applications though the App Store or Google Play Store
Source control management tool, such as TFS and GIT
Reference Number: BH-25727

Contact Details: callum.barnes@2xmtechnology.com.au

About Credabl
Hi, we’re Credabl! Being nimble, flexible and responsive with the client top of mind are very important to us. Servicing the medical and healthcare professions means we use a human-to-human approach. Our shared purpose is to help our clients realise their goals and empower them to serve the greater Australian community.

In a fast-paced, agile and entrepreneurial environment, we encourage our people to Fuel Ambition. They take the initiative, aim for excellence, stay curious with a growth mindset, provide high-touch experiences and are digitally minded.

We place high value on embracing excellence and bringing the energy needed to fuel the ambition. Our culture and work environment embraces belonging together as a team and keeping it real.

Credabl is an equal opportunity and LGBTI-inclusive employer.

www.credabl.com.au

www.linkedin.com/company/credabl/about/

Scope:
We are seeking a NSW based Full-Stack Developer who will design, build and develop enterprise grade software systems. Located in our Sydney office you will play a key role on some exciting projects, enhancing productivity of our internal users an uplifting mobile ad website experience for our clients.

The role will appeal to those who appreciate variety and learning from those around them. It is also largely autonomous, so you are given the responsibility to manage your tasks and your stakeholders appropriately. We encourage thinking outside the box and being innovative, all while having fun and being supported by/supportive of the team and the organisation.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a truly dynamic and creative team in an Australia-wide financial services organisation, with a dedicated focus on the medical, dental, veterinary and healthcare professions.

Key Responsibilities:
Leadership & Mentoring
Guide team development efforts towards successful project delivery.
Provide technical leadership to teammates through coaching and mentorship.
Maintain high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits.
Identify and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team.
Execution and Delivery:
Assist in the collection and documentation of user's requirements, development of user stories, estimates and work plans.
Collaborate with other software developers, business analysts and software architects to plan, design, develop, test, and maintain web and desktop-based business applications built on Microsoft Cloud technologies.
Prepare reports, manuals and other documentation on the status, operation and maintenance of software.
Design, develop, and unit test applications in accordance with established standards.
Participate in peer-reviews of solution designs and related code.
Package and support deployment of releases.
Data and Cyber Security:
Monitor application security ensuring integrity of confidential information and intellectual property.
Identify gaps or vulnerabilities in current processes and recommend resolution plan.
Promote user awareness on actions to assist in user security and highlight safe computing practices.
Key Requirements:
Knowledge:
College or University degree in Technology/Engineering/Science or related discipline.
Building enterprise could-native solutions on Microsoft Azure using PaaS, IaaS and SaaS platforms.
Automating internal business processes to achieve operational efficiency and scalability.
Strong grasp of modern security best practices and Software Architecture.
Automated and unit testing.
Source control management systems and continuous integration/deployment environments such as Azure DevOps.
Strong knowledge of Angular 9+ and building modern responsive web applications.
Comprehensive understanding of object-oriented and service-oriented application development techniques and theories.
Skills:
Proficient with using Microsoft .NET Core 5.0+ using C#, EF Core, Linq, NuGet packages and modern authentication mechanisms to build secure, modern REST APIs.
Extensive experience designing and developing enterprise grade software using modern architecture patterns such as Domain Driven Design.
In depth knowledge and experience with core Microsoft technologies including: Dynamics 365, Office 365, Azure, SQL Server, SharePoint and Teams development.
Agile development methodologies including Kanban and Scrum.
Multi-threading and concurrency
Debugging, performance profiling and optimization
Using an Enterprise Integration Bus and/or Pub-Sub eventing solutions.
Building iOS and Android mobile apps using Ionic/Angular as well as Backend APIs built on .Net Core.
Abilities:
Engineering mindset, ability to think outside the box and ‘invent’ creative solutions.
Strong communication skills with both internal team members and external business stakeholders.
Strong initiative to find ways to improve solutions, systems, and processes.
Internally motivated, able to work proficiently both independently and in a team environment.
Experience (Preferred):
3+ years’ experience as a Full-Stack Software Developer.
Prior experience with technical leadership or mentoring.
Experience with technology in the Finance Industry.
Infrastructure as Code (IaC) deployment of Microsoft Azure platform resources using ARM templates and PowerShell.
User interface design and prototyping.
Building C# .Net Core APIs using OAuth for security.
Database development including relational database design, SQL and ORM technologies.
Use of Azure Logic and Function Apps. (Durable Functions experience desired)
Developing applications using Power Apps component framework (PCF), Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Dataverse.

Benefits:
Credabl offers an innovative and diverse culture, along with an approachable leadership team across a flat structure. We offer our people flexibility, a competitive compensation package, work-life harmony and even birthday leave. Our leaders actively foster career paths, learning and development, plus personal growth, to ensure you grow and progress with us.

Our people feel valued and well-supported, equipped with the technology to enable efficient hybrid/flexible work. To maintain a safe and healthy workplace for everyone, the company follows its COVID-19 policy. We have fun, embrace coming together to boost productivity and workplace learning, and take pride in strengthening our internal relationships.

Applications:
To apply, get in touch with our People team at careers@credabl.com.au

Strong grasp of modern security best practices and Software Architecture.
Automated and unit testing.
Source control management systems and continuous integration/deployment environments such as Azure DevOps.
Strong knowledge of Angular 9+ and building modern responsive web applications.
Comprehensive understanding of object-oriented and service-oriented application development techniques and theories.
Skills:
Proficient with using Microsoft .NET Core 5.0+ using C#, EF Core, Linq, NuGet packages and modern authentication mechanisms to build secure, modern REST APIs.
Extensive experience designing and developing enterprise grade software using modern architecture patterns such as Domain Driven Design.
In depth knowledge and experience with core Microsoft technologies including: Dynamics 365, Office 365, Azure, SQL Server, SharePoint and Teams development.
Agile development methodologies including Kanban and Scrum.
Multi-threading and concurrency
Debugging, performance profiling and optimization
Using an Enterprise Integration Bus and/or Pub-Sub eventing solutions.
Building iOS and Android mobile apps using Ionic/Angular as well as Backend APIs built on .Net Core.
Abilities:
Engineering mindset, ability to think outside the box and ‘invent’ creative solutions.
Strong communication skills with both internal team members and external business stakeholders.
Strong initiative to find ways to improve solutions, systems, and processes.
Internally motivated, able to work proficiently both independently and in a team environment.
Experience (Preferred):
3+ years’ experience as a Full-Stack Software Developer.
Prior experience with technical leadership or mentoring.
Experience with technology in the Finance Industry.
Infrastructure as Code (IaC) deployment of Microsoft Azure platform resources using ARM templates and PowerShell.
User interface design and prototyping.
Building C# .Net Core APIs using OAuth for security.
Database development including relational database design, SQL and ORM technologies.
Use of Azure Logic and Function Apps. (Durable Functions experience desired)
Developing applications using Power Apps component framework (PCF), Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Dataverse.

Benefits:
Credabl offers an innovative and diverse culture, along with an approachable leadership team across a flat structure. We offer our people flexibility, a competitive compensation package, work-life harmony and even birthday leave. Our leaders actively foster career paths, learning and development, plus personal growth, to ensure you grow and progress with us.

Our people feel valued and well-supported, equipped with the technology to enable efficient hybrid/flexible work. To maintain a safe and healthy workplace for everyone, the company follows its COVID-19 policy. We have fun, embrace coming together to boost productivity and workplace learning, and take pride in strengthening our internal relationships.

Applications:
To apply, get in touch with our People team at careers@credabl.com.au

Credabl is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and LBGTQIA+ candidates. About Credabl 
Hi, we’re Credabl! Being nimble, flexible and responsive with the client top of mind are very important to us. Servicing the medical and healthcare professions means we use a human-to-human approach. Our shared purpose is to help our clients realise their goals and empower them to serve the greater Australian community.
 
In a fast-paced, agile and entrepreneurial environment, we encourage our people to Fuel Ambition. They take the initiative, aim for excellence, stay curious with a growth mindset, provide high-touch experiences and are digitally minded.
 
We place high value on embracing excellence and bringing the energy needed to fuel the ambition. Our culture and work environment embraces belonging together as a team and keeping it real.
 
Credabl is an equal opportunity and LGBTI-inclusive employer.
 
www.credabl.com.au
 
www.linkedin.com/company/credabl/about/

We are seeking a NSW based Full-Stack Developer who will design, build and develop enterprise grade software systems. Located in our Sydney office you will play a key role on some exciting projects, enhancing productivity of our internal users an uplifting mobile ad website experience for our clients.
 
The role will appeal to those who appreciate variety and learning from those around them. It is also largely autonomous, so you are given the responsibility to manage your tasks and your stakeholders appropriately. We encourage thinking outside the box and being innovative, all while having fun and being supported by/supportive of the team and the organisation.
 
This is an exciting opportunity to join a truly dynamic and creative team in an Australia-wide financial services organisation, with a dedicated focus on the medical, dental, veterinary and healthcare professions.

Anonyome Labs is creating a world in which people have exclusive control over their personal data.We’re changing the privacy and cybersafety paradigm—and resolving the greatest challenges consumers and enterprises face.Through our products, MySudo consumer app and Sudo Platform business privacy toolkit, we empower everyday users to decide when, where and with whom they share their personal information, and we help enterprises rapidly develop and deploy branded privacy and cybersafety solutions for their customers.In developing the Sudo digital identity at the heart of our products, we wanted to do something that hasn’t been done before — because that’s what the global fight for data privacy will demand from us all: out of the box thinking and .If you want to join us at the leading edge of data privacy, apply to join our team now. There’s never been a better time.We are looking for experienced developers to join our iOS team, responsible for architecting and developing our next generation of Sudo mobile apps for the global consumer market. You will be joining a high powered experienced team, following agile development principles, and who value well-designed software, creative thinking and thrive on solving the unsolvable. You will be working on technology spanning mobile communications (voice, messaging, email), and fintech/payments all underpinned by strong security and privacy principles.This is a fantastic opportunity to work at a well established global start-up, working with some of the global leaders in the security and privacy space located in our local Gold Coast development lab and US headquarters.Must-haves:Degree in Computer Science or related fieldAt least 4 years of extensive experience in iOS development for customer-facing appsThorough knowledge of Swift, including advanced topics such as generics, protocols and custom operatorsFamiliarity with Objective-CHistory of shipping successful consumer-focused appsExperience implementing and maintaining unit testsAbility to develop maintainable, well-designed software under tight deadlinesStrong communication skillsPassion for solving hard problemsInterest in privacy and the protection of personal informationAustralian citizenship or permanent residencyBonus points:Experience working with a non-iOS programming languages and platformsExperience developing with security APIs and technologiesExperience working at a startupFinally, we expect you to score extremely high on our "Stuff That Matters":Enhancing PrivacyPrivacy is at Our CoreGrowing as One teamWork Inclusively, Embrace Diversity, Succeed TogetherSharing InsightsInformation empowers our decision makingTaking OwnershipOwn it, enjoy it, learn from itFeeding CuriosityAlways learningWe offer company stock options, private health insurance allowance, cool office space, catered lunches, fun exciting work environment overlooking the beach of the Gold Coast, and the opportunity to learn from leading privacy and security experts with a combined patent filing count of 60+ in the privacy/security area. We’re looking for a digital craftsperson, with solid experience in HTML5 banners, eDMs and microsites but is now looking to expand their skills in frontend web application development.
We are seeking somebody with a keen eye for UI and UX. You’ll work closely with designers, other developers and creatives, crafting user-centric solutions.
You’ll work collaboratively with our team to help build and deliver well engineered front-end stacks for each project. Building templates and views that integrate with Content Management Systems and APIs, whilst delivering tested, production ready code with an impeccable degree of finish.
Your days will be spent:
Building HTML5 banners, websites and applications with a focus on creating delightful user experiences.
Writing clean, reusable, maintainable code, including TDD where applicable.
Taking ownership of our frontend technology stack and pushing it forward.
Testing your work across devices with a focus on accessibility and a mobile first approach.
Collaborating with the team in an open, transparent and collaborative environment.
Integrating your work in a variety of CMS and tech stacks.
Contributing to our overall coding conventions, frameworks, automation tooling and ways of working.
Researching and learning new technologies and creating proof of concepts.
REQUIREMENTS:
2+years building HTML5 banners, eDMs and microsites
An interest in responsive web applications, with solid fundamentals in HTML5, CSS3, vanilla Javascript and the latest in web standards and browser developments.
Experience in Double Click and dynamic builds is advantageous
Knowledge of React, native Javascript, frontend tooling as well as accessibility standards.
Building cross-browser websites focused on best practices, performance and SEO, using browser native capabilities where possible and using progressive enhancement where not.
You will also demonstrate:
Passion for delivering high quality websites and products.
High levels of motivation and problem-solving ability.
Experience with managing multiple concurrent projects, sometimes within tight deadlines.
An ability to learn quickly and pick up new technologies.
A passion for automation through continuous integration and continuous delivery (and automated testing).
An interest in learning about AWS Serverless and backend languages (PHP/Python preferred).
An ability to thrive in a collaborative, open, transparent and creative environment.
An ability to treat others with kindness, empathy and respect.

Job no: 939091
Work type: Permanent / Full time
Location: Support Office - Docklands

Work is a whole lot better when you love what you do, we know that. That’s why we make sure that the loves and interests of our people match their responsibilities. We take what they love, and we let them live it.

So, do you want to be part of a team who loves coming to work each day. A team that makes Myer a great place to shop, and an even greater place to work?
Great opportunity to develop your career with a national brand using a modern technology stackOpen to ALL levels including juniors and recent graduates – as long as you have the attitude to grow with us!Flexible hybrid working arrangements – work from our new Docklands office or the comfort of your own home

As a Frontend Developer, you will play a pivotal role in the delivery and support of software capabilities. You will be responsible for implementing new functionality and features of the new and existing platform to enhance the customer experience. You will work within an agile team environment and be expected to form relationships with all Employee User Experience (UX), Customer and Data stakeholders.

About the Opportunity:

Provide well documented, reliable and maintainable codeTranslate designs and wireframes into high-quality codeWrite and maintain automation tests at relevant application tiers ensuring that delivered change adheres to acceptance criteriaProduce well-structured programs/designs, which comply with documented coding standardsAssist in speeding up deliveries and critical projectsParticipate in regular design meetings and code reviews

Your Background:
Experience in React/Nodejs/typescript developmentIn depth understanding of responsive design, browser behaviour and compatibilityExperience working with responsive web designs and mobile web sitesExperience with cloud technology (AWS preferred)Experience with test driven development and testing frameworks/libraries, i.e.: Jest, Nightwatch, Testcafe, etc.

Benefits to you:
Generous team member discounts on all Myer products
Ongoing training and development for your career progression and succession opportunities across the businessEncouraged work-life balance with flexible hybrid working and access to different types of Leave (i.e Lifestyle Leave)

This is your opportunity to join a team of forward-thinking, change-making individuals transforming healthcare experiences. Operating at the intersection of two fast-growing industries – health and tech – you’ll play an active role in shaping the future of healthcare in Australia.The GigWe are looking for a mid-level Mobile Engineer to join our distributed Mobile squad whose mission is to create and maintain the Healthengine iOS and Android mobile applications and create positive user experiences in the app.Reporting into the Mobile Engineering Manager, the purpose of this job is to contribute new features and maintain our flagship app (and our KMM core internal framework) serving more than 300,000 bookings a month to our users and continuously improve the underlying quality of the app and the development processes to ensure the team can deliver great features efficiently.Responsibilities:Work as part of a product team to deliver high-quality and high-performing experiences to hundreds of thousands of usersCollaborate with other developers and designers to build innovative and delight-filled solutionsSuggest ideas to help increase developer velocity and better user experiencesKeep up-to-date with changes in the iOS/Android landscape in order to be on top of mobile development best practicesBe able to contribute to both apps by demonstrating a willingness and eagerness to learn iOS or Android development if you’re a specialist in only one of themAbout YouYou flourish in a fast-moving, agile environment and thrive in a tech culture where growth is inevitable. You are open-minded, collaborative, follow-through on your commitments, and have a strong appreciation for the role people play in the development process.Whilst we’re looking for an engineer who holds expertise in both Android and iOS, we’re also eager to hear from you if you have strong knowledge of just one of them but are willing to expand your knowledge of the other platform.Experience you might bring:2+ years of iOS and/or Android application development experienceStrong understanding of Swift and/or KotlinStrong understanding of native iOS and/or Android architecture, frameworks, and the SDK / Xcode and/or Android StudioHave contributed to at least one commercial app that has been developed and publishedAs our Mobile team is distributed, experience working as part of remote teams, or a willingness to work alongside remote team members is highly desirable.Additional InformationThe perks behind the workHealthengine is where you’ll be your best self. Work perks
While working with us you can take advantage of a wide range of financial and non-financial benefits.
These benefits include financial planning, superannuation education services, salary sacrificing, novated car leasing and income protection insurance. Your extended family can join our superannuation fund and you can even enjoy discounted car rental rates for private use.
We also provide you access to discounted health insurance and paid parental leave to help you welcome a new addition to your family.
To help further your education, you can access study assistance in the form of up to 10 days paid study leave per year on approved study.
To support and enhance the health of our employees, we provide access to our employee assistance program. This free program provides you with assistance in times when you face problems of a work or personal nature.

Melbourne or Perth
