GIS Developer
Location: Melbourne or Perth based

Your new company:

We are an Australian geospatial services company that has been in business for over 60 years. Our offices are located across Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, South Africa and the United Arab Emirates. Last year we joined a larger American company – Woolpert, a leading Architecture, Engineering and Geospatial Services company with 1,600+ employees. AAM specialises in the collection, analysis and delivery of spatial data. We capture measurement and location data by surveying the built and natural environments from the air, on the ground and over water. We build digital maps and models of the physical world. Our clients use our maps, models and spatial data to plan, design, build and manage their assets, infrastructure and environments. This is a technical industry where innovation and technologies are constantly evolving.

Your new role:

You will be part of our growing Geospatial team and will support the creation of new applications and custom integrations to support the needs of the Geospatial business unit. This role will include some client facing work and occasional second level support for our existing client applications and custom solutions.

Your key responsibilities will include:

Developing, testing, maintaining, and supporting GIS focused applications, tools, and web services.
Developing software in an agile environment by working collaboratively with clients and key stakeholders to develop new products and refine existing product range.
Providing second level support, troubleshooting, and enhancements for customised GIS applications, tools, and web services
Enhancing and improving, usability, performance and compatibility of existing applications and services.
Creating and maintaining technical documentation, design specifications and support documentation.
What we’re looking for:
We are looking for a passionate and enthusiastic full-time software developer with a flair for designing and building intuitive applications, integrating 3rd party business systems, and working with our clients to take an idea from a concept to solution along with:

Applications experience utilising RESTful web services, and cloud technologies
Experience maintaining/reviewing existing code frameworks.
Liaising with internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to work independently, prioritise tasks and meet deadlines.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
National Police Clearance
Travel to work at other AAM offices and projects on client sites may be required
What’s in it for you:
Being part of a talented and motivated multidisciplinary team, with a focus on building high quality geospatial solutions and products
Opportunities to receive training and/or exposure to other facets of the AAM business for career development
Flexible and supportive working environment
Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members
Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice
Minimum qualifications and experience:
Tertiary qualifications or equivalent in IT, computer science, software engineering or geomatics
2 years minimum commercial software development experience in web applications development utilising .NET (C#), Javascript, TypeScript, HTML5, AJAX, JSON/XML, jQuery, ReactJS
National police clearance
Must hold permanent and full working rights in Australia
Desirable but not essential:
Knowledge of GIS/ Esri ArcGIS platform
Web + Mobile applications development.
Python server-side development.
Geocortex Essentials development and integration.
.NET MVC, AngularJS, Node.js
IIS 8+ installing/configuring/administration experience.
Exposure to Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or Microsoft Azure.
Knowledge of Agile software development (SCRUM)

Please note that only suitable candidates with a cover letter will be contacted

Interested in joining our team? Send your cover letter and resume (1 document) to recruitment@aamgroup.com or apply by clicking the Apply button.

Confidentiality assured. Please note only applications with unlimited work rights in Australia need apply; only successful short-listed candidates will be contacted.

We value a diverse and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

In line with our COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, all employees of AAM are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 or have a genuine medical contraindication. Work perks
While working with us you can take advantage of a wide range of financial and non-financial benefits.
These benefits include financial planning, superannuation education services, salary sacrificing, novated car leasing and income protection insurance. Your extended family can join our superannuation fund and you can even enjoy discounted car rental rates for private use.
We also provide you access to discounted health insurance and paid parental leave to help you welcome a new addition to your family.
To help further your education, you can access study assistance in the form of up to 10 days paid study leave per year on approved study.
To support and enhance the health of our employees, we provide access to our employee assistance program. This free program provides you with assistance in times when you face problems of a work or personal nature.
These benefits, and more, are above and beyond your remuneration. We want you to be well rewarded for the contribution you make to AAM and the service you provide to our clients.

What we’re looking for:
We are looking for a passionate and enthusiastic full-time software developer with a flair for designing and building intuitive applications, integrating 3rd party business systems, and working with our clients to take an idea from a concept to solution along with:

Applications experience utilising RESTful web services, and cloud technologies
Experience maintaining/reviewing existing code frameworks.
Liaising with internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to work independently, prioritise tasks and meet deadlines.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
National Police Clearance
Travel to work at other AAM offices and projects on client sites may be required
What’s in it for you:
Being part of a talented and motivated multidisciplinary team, with a focus on building high quality geospatial solutions and products
Opportunities to receive training and/or exposure to other facets of the AAM business for career development
Flexible and supportive working environment
Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members

We value a diverse and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

In line with our COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, all employees of AAM are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 or have a genuine medical contraindication. Location: Melbourne or Perth based

Your new company:

We are an Australian geospatial services company that has been in business for over 60 years. Our offices are located across Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, South Africa and the United Arab Emirates. Last year we joined a larger American company – Woolpert, a leading Architecture, Engineering and Geospatial Services company with 1,600+ employees. AAM specialises in the collection, analysis and delivery of spatial data. We capture measurement and location data by surveying the built and natural environments from the air, on the ground and over water. We build digital maps and models of the physical world. Our clients use our maps, models and spatial data to plan, design, build and manage their assets, infrastructure and environments. This is a technical industry where innovation and technologies are constantly evolving.

Your new role:

You will be part of our growing Geospatial team and will support the creation of new applications and custom integrations to support the needs of the Geospatial business unit. This role will include some client facing work and occasional second level support for our existing client applications and custom solutions.

Your key responsibilities will include:

Developing, testing, maintaining, and supporting GIS focused applications, tools, and web services.
Developing software in an agile environment by working collaboratively with clients and key stakeholders to develop new products and refine existing product range.
Providing second level support, troubleshooting, and enhancements for customised GIS applications, tools, and web services
Enhancing and improving, usability, performance and compatibility of existing applications and services.
Creating and maintaining technical documentation, design specifications and support documentation.

We are looking for a passionate and enthusiastic full-time software developer with a flair for designing and building intuitive applications, integrating 3rd party business systems, and working with our clients to take an idea from a concept to solution along with:

Applications experience utilising RESTful web services, and cloud technologies
Experience maintaining/reviewing existing code frameworks.
Liaising with internal and external stakeholders.

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Hello. We’re Bilue.Bilue is an Australian mobile and emerging technology consultancy company. Our founder and CEO, Cameron Barrie, an app developer himself, originally started the company in his living room. 10 years later we now have offices in Sydney and Melbourne and a growing team of 60+. Over the years we’ve partnered with some of Australia's leading brands to deliver innovative and human based digital solutions.Bilue = Big + Blue OceanThe philosophy behind this came from the early days when we viewed companies that weren't investigating mobile technologies as landlocked. We saw them as being stuck where they are, not able to move forward, not off exploring.This was and still is an opportunity for us to seize, because at Bilue, we see ourselves as shepherds. Taking our clients confidently out into the Big Blue Ocean where we can explore new opportunities together.About the opportunity:The role of the UI/UX Product Designer (Mid) is to support and deliver user-centric design solutions for your team, your client and Bilue.About you:You'll have a problem-solving mindset and seek to research and ideate solutions to problems, before bringing them to senior staff for collaborative review and development. You'll be hungry to learn more and consistently seek new opportunities to learn new techniques, review emerging best practices and apply your design skills across a range of projects (mobile, web, cloud etc).Skills & Responsibilities:Leadership DevelopmentFriendly and approachable, you seek to build relationships with the client, your team and wider project stakeholders through your professionalism and punctualityWith guidance and support from leadership, develop and drive a commercial consulting mindset through understanding client contractual obligations and enhancing the clients return on investment (ROI)Take the initiative towards managing your workload, demonstrating an ability to navigate shifting priorities and focus efforts towards successful outcomes for your teams and clientsYou welcome opportunities for participation & collaborationAdvocacy DevelopmentStarting to establish a network of design and commercial contacts through LinkedIn and other networks / communitiesContribute to internal promotion of Bilue through regular participation in design team events and initiativesGeneral Design SkillsModerate Client / Project-based experience in UX/UI tasks spanning mobile, tablet & web applicationsResearch, interviewsMapping - information architecture, user journeys, value propositions and personasIdeation of solutions, in collaboration with senior staff, client and technical stakeholdersPrototyping - low, mid and high fidelity clickable prototypesUser testingUser Interface designSolid baseline understanding of principles in both UX and UI designBe curious and open to questioning the customer and product journey. You will consider suggesting improvements in ways of working or deliverables to others on the project where you feel value can be enhancedTake pride in the work we deliver as a company and play an active role in maintaining qualityWork collaboratively and build relationships to get the best outcomesBe able to be the only Bilue representative in a client team with oversightDemonstrate an ability and willingness to take on helpful feedbackAbout Bilue:Our vision is to 'mobilise millions' and our mission is to unlock exponential growth for our clients, by creating inspired experiences on intelligent platforms. We strive for experience design, UI design and technical excellence, but we thrive on human connection, putting people at the heart of business transformation.Apply now!Location: SydneyMust have full working rights within AustraliaTo find out more about Bilue, check out our website or find us on social media:LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/bilue/Instagram: @bilue.officialFacebook: @bilue11Website: https://bilue.com.auJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $70,318.16 – $136,265.39 per yearBenefits:Employee mentoring programWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication Question(s):Do you hold full working rights within Australia? In a constantly changing world, we work together with our people, clients and communities to enable them to fulfill their potential to do great things. We believe that by bringing everyone together, we can solve problems using innovative technology that can create a world that is sustainable and secure. At NTT, we encourage you to remain continuously curious, as that is what keeps you fast, flexible and relevant. No two days will be the same but that is what will help you grow and realize your full potential.
The power is in your hands to do great things. It’s time to lead the change, be the authentic you, to solve difficult challenges, to set the pace of change and to unleash your potential.
Want to be a part of our team?
We are currently seeking a talented Full Stack/Mobile Developer to join our rapidly growing Digital team here at NTT. This is a permanent opportunity based in the heart of Brisbane CBD.
Working at NTT
This role will see you design, develop and implement strategic business solutions across various projects and consulting assignments. You will contribute to the success of the team through sharing of knowledge, while staying across all the latest technologies including, Azure, O365, Xamarin, .Net (Framework & Core), Docker, Kubernetes, Bootstrap, Vue.Js and Angular.
What will make you a good fit for the role?
Experience in client-side development technologies like Angular, Vue.Js, JavaScript and JQuery
Experience in a server-side web development using .Net (Web Api & MVC)
Experience in Mobile application development using Xamarin
Ability to define/analyse scope and requirements
Ability to adapt and apply existing techniques and methodologies to new users
Experience in Consulting and excellent oral communication
Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.
Equal opportunity employer

Axiom Technologies is an Australia-based entity with a history of providing Managed IT solutions to medium to large-scale enterprises globally. Please visit our website for more information about what we do at www.axiomtechnologies.com.
Axiom Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourage applicants from all backgrounds and gender to apply, including, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates
Roles and Responsibilities:
Research and identify solutions to software and hardware issues
Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues, including account setup and network configuration
Ask customers targeted questions to quickly understand the root of the problem
Track computer system issues through to resolution, within agreed time limits
Talk clients through a series of actions, either via phone, email, or chat, until they’ve solved a technical issue
Properly escalate unresolved issues to appropriate internal teams (e.g. software developers)
Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
Refer to internal database or external resources to provide accurate tech solutions
Ensure all issues are properly logged
Prioritize and manage several open issues at one time
Follow up with clients to ensure their IT systems are fully functional after troubleshooting
IT Skills and Experience
Desired Experience:
Computer OS/Peripherals troubleshooting
Handling Different PC Operating Systems ( Windows 7/8 and 10)
Performing Hardware Software Installation ( understanding of deployment tools like SCCM)
Basic knowledge of SOE and group policies
Printer support
Good knowledge of MS Office tools installation & troubleshooting
Excellent customer service and people skills
Field experience supporting a variety of technologies and services
Advanced technical abilities including solid troubleshooting skills applicable to Windows, Apple, and virtual operating systems
Ability to manage time and resources to meet or exceed expectations in high-profile situations while maintaining professionalism under pressure
Personal Attributes:
Excellent End-user computing skills.
Good knowledge of Infrastructure support.
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
Well organized and extremely detail-oriented
Strong customer service ethic and great communication skills, both oral and written
Passionate about delivering quality no matter what you are doing
Can work both independently and in a collaborative team-oriented environment
A self-starter, motivated to push the limits and think outside of the box
Fondness for solutions that are simple, elegant, and effective
Ability to work with and maintain confidential information
In-depth knowledge of:
Windows OS (e.g. XP, Vista, Windows 7, 10)
Microsoft Office applications
PCLaptop hardware
PCLaptop peripherals, including printers
Mobile devices
Basic knowledge of:
Active Directory
Exchange

Roles and Responsibilities:
Research and identify solutions to software and hardware issues
Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues, including account setup and network configuration
Ask customers targeted questions to quickly understand the root of the problem
Track computer system issues through to resolution, within agreed time limits
Talk clients through a series of actions, either via phone, email, or chat, until they’ve solved a technical issue
Properly escalate unresolved issues to appropriate internal teams (e.g. software developers)
Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
Refer to internal database or external resources to provide accurate tech solutions
Ensure all issues are properly logged
Prioritize and manage several open issues at one time
Follow up with clients to ensure their IT systems are fully functional after troubleshooting
IT Skills and Experience
Desired Experience:
Computer OS/Peripherals troubleshooting
Handling Different PC Operating Systems ( Windows 7/8 and 10)
Performing Hardware Software Installation ( understanding of deployment tools like SCCM)
Basic knowledge of SOE and group policies
Printer support
Good knowledge of MS Office tools installation & troubleshooting
Excellent customer service and people skills
Field experience supporting a variety of technologies and services
Advanced technical abilities including solid troubleshooting skills applicable to Windows, Apple, and virtual operating systems
Ability to manage time and resources to meet or exceed expectations in high-profile situations while maintaining professionalism under pressure
Personal Attributes:
Excellent End-user computing skills.
Good knowledge of Infrastructure support.
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
Well organized and extremely detail-oriented
Strong customer service ethic and great communication skills, both oral and written
Passionate about delivering quality no matter what you are doing
Can work both independently and in a collaborative team-oriented environment
A self-starter, motivated to push the limits and think outside of the box
Fondness for solutions that are simple, elegant, and effective
Ability to work with and maintain confidential information
In-depth knowledge of:
Windows OS (e.g. XP, Vista, Windows 7, 10)
Microsoft Office applications
PCLaptop hardware
PCLaptop peripherals, including printers
Mobile devices
Basic knowledge of:
Active Directory
Exchange
Apple OS
SCCM

At FatSecret, our success is entrenched in empowering people to make healthy food and nutrition habits for lifeWe’re growing our team and are looking for people who would like to join a small, supportive team that cares about making a real difference to our clients' lives. We have a flexible work environment, where the majority of your time will be spent working remotely, with 1-2 collaboration days per week.About the roleFatSecret are a leader in the health and wellness space.Despite being a small team, our data drives some of the biggest nutrition and health platforms in the world.We are embarking on an ambitious journey to extend our app experiences to provide rich personalised experiences for our users that will help them manage their wellness goals through good nutrition.To help us get there, we are seeking an experienced Android developer with a proven track record developing Apps from the ground up.Things that you’ll work on: Collaborate with team members to prototype, build, and test high-quality apps.Identify shortcomings in current technology/architecture and recommend solutions.Provide constructive input into architectural decisions for new features.Stay up to date with Android development technologies, and identify and promote opportunities to make use of these technologies within the mobile team.Who you are: Minimum two years of industry experience in developing commercial Android appsStrong learning agility, combined with a willingness to share knowledge/experienceHigh EQ (empathy with our customers, ability to communicate effectively with colleagues)A demonstrable passion for technology with proven experience developing for Android, as well as being well informed of developments in the Android spacePositive, enthusiastic and willing to contribute at all stages of the SDLCPassionate about continuous improvement, use of lean methodologies in a Kanban style agile environmentFocus on execution and user outcomes over getting everything 100%On your first day, we'd love for you to have: Experience using android development framework (fragment, activities, lifecycle)Proficiency in KotlinProficient understanding of code versioning tools such as GitBe able to show us what you’ve built, tell us your role in the build, and what you’d have done differentlyIt's a bonus, but not required, if you have: Experience in using Coroutine to shift works between UI thread and Background threadFamiliarity with REST api using HttpUrlConnection (JSON/XML)Good understanding of memory management, writing memory efficient code, and troubleshooting memory issuesUnderstand how to use JetPack libraries (such as ViewModel, LifeData, etc...)Basic understanding of animation (ObjectAnimator, ValueAnimator, etc...)Knowledge of analytics platforms and integration in mobile appsExperience in Health, Medical or Fitness categoriesGood understanding of Design patterns (abstract factory, Model View Presenter/ MVVM, etc..)Good understanding of SOLID principleIf your experience doesn’t exactly match the above, but you have a passion for technology and your own learning, we’d love for you to get in contact - our team is as diverse and talented as it is because of our different backgrounds and experiences, and we’d love to hear about yours.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $90,000.00 – $110,000.00 per yearBenefits:Professional development assistanceSchedule:Flexible hoursMonday to FridayWork job_title: Front End Developer - Expressions of Interest
listing_jobDesc:
AKQA are always on the lookout for permanent, contract and freelance Front End Developers. If you would like to share your details with us for future opportunities across Australia or New Zealand, please feel free to submit your details which we will keep on file and reach out to you as soon as a suitable position becomes available.

At AKQA, we have a culture of excellence in Software Development and Marketing Technology and pride ourselves on our track record of helping our clients leverage CMS features. Working closely with Experience Designers and Back End Engineering, Front End Engineers transform visual design into code and static designs into elegant and intuitive solutions.

Our front end developers are accountable for developing web and mobile solutions for AKQA's world-class clients that manage performance and scalability.

Located in Sydney, as part of AKQA you'll work in an innovative and inclusive culture, surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields. You'll also have the opportunity to learn within a creative and technically advanced team.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS

Develop and maintain responsive web applications, website pages and CMS systems for our clients.
Hands-on development translating design concepts to HTML, accessibility, compatibility and performance.
Collaborating with cross functional teams in an agile environment.
Diagnose and solve technical problems related to webapps.
Implement high quality software solutions.
Produce quality code that is readable and maintainable by the team.
Plan and execute testing across multiple platforms and solutions.

 QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS

Development experience in JavaScript frameworks, especially on enterprise-level mobile/responsive website projects.
Skilled in HTML5/CSS/Advanced jQuery/JavaScript/JavaScript OOP/TypeScript/Design Patterns as well as Headless CMS and API integration.
Experience with W3C website accessibility standards, JavaScript frameworks such as React / Redux, Vue and Angular.
Experience with Foundation, Twitter Bootstrap, Material UI or similar frameworks.
A highly motivated, productive and collaborative approach to your work.
Strong communication skills.
Exceptional attention to detail.

AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA's ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Your race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. Aboriginal, Torres Strait Islander and Indigenous people are encouraged to apply for this role. This is quite beneficial to online businesses to make investment in eCommerce web development and generate more sales.We are looking for qualified Software Engineer/Developer Programmer who will be primarily responsible for delivering projects and enhancements across multiple platform applications across client and server side. ​ We aim to deliver peace of mind to our clients about their IT systems and programs. Responsibilities

About Us

aXcelerate is a highly reputable SaaS student management system designed for providers of vocational education and training. We provide a next-generation software suite that powers learning and assessment for millions of students throughout Australia. With a focus on data, design, and innovation, we are currently #1 in the market and are seeking further talent to enhance business growth, both domestically and internationally.

About the Role
Looking to start your career in the software industry? This rare opportunity to join aXcelerate's development team may be the perfect fit for you.

We’re looking for a Graduate/Junior web app developer to assist us in building out new features and products across our web and mobile platforms. You will have the opportunity to work on front-end, back-end or across the full-stack. This is a permanent position with the opportunity to move to mid and senior-level roles eventually.

You will also collaborate and work closely with the Product and Design teams to produce world-class experiences for our users.

Summary of Responsibilities:
Produce high-quality, secure code in accordance with our standards
Document code consistently throughout the development process
Proactively bring issues and problems to the attention of the team and generating, proposing and implementing innovative solutions to solve them
About You
Relevant tertiary qualification(s) in Computer Science / IT
Passionate about all things software and development
Understanding of version control tools such as GIT
Experience creating software or undertaking projects in a team environment
Excellent communication skills and a willingness to learn

Nice to have
A portfolio or github with projects you’ve contributed to
Understanding of the software development life cycle
Familiarity with issue tracking tools such as Jira would also be a plus
Experience working and collaborating with Product Designers or UX/UI Designers
Experience working from design tools such as Figma
Technical Skills
React / React Native
Node.js / Serverless / AWS / SQL

What’s on offer?
Work across our web and mobile platforms
Gain experience in React, React Native, Node.js, AWS and more
Receive mentorship from experienced developers
Opportunity for remote work
Join a company that values your personal and professional development by providing a large range of in house and external training opportunities as well as a $2000 professional development budget
Be provided with a unix based development machine (MacBook Pro as standard)
Parking available on-site (we are located in Milton, close to the train station)
Quarterly company social activities

Please submit your resume and cover letter.

*This is initially a 6 month fixed term role*

Do you have a Computer Science qualification and are seeking a career as a Software Developer? If so this could be the role for you.

You’ll be responsible for the development and enhancement for Stockland’s website and innovation applications in line with SLAs and defined business outcomes.

 Key Responsibilities

Delivering high quality software solutions in the iterative development process of our Website and innovative applications
Solve technical problems, identify root causes and quickly resolve issues
Conduct testing and QA
Participate in development and running of automation test cases
Ensure all documentation (e.g. requirements, design, testing, operations, interface, user guide, etc.) is developed & maintained

About You

Computer Science Degree (or similar)
1 – 2 years industry experience in development role with .NET technologies
C# .NET, JavaScript (including jQuery, ReactJS, NodeJS), HTML, CSS
Experience using HTML, CSS, jQuery for responsive design for mobile and cross-browser compatibility
Experience in developing and consuming Web APIs
Release management and planning for agile delivery
Proven ability to build and maintain effective relationships
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Self-organisational and time management skills

At Stockland we are a company delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career.

Stockland has a strong commitment to achieving the best outcomes through an inclusive and collaborative culture. Our customers come from diverse backgrounds and we want our teams to reflect this.

We offer competitive remuneration and benefits. Benefits include free to access or subsidised lifestyle, health, well-being and financial services products.

Agencies should note that unsolicited resumes will not be accepted for this position and Stockland will not pay any fees related to resumes that are submitted directly to hiring managers and not through our approved process. Where appropriate, the Careers @ Stockland Team will work with our preferred panel of agencies to source candidates for roles. Please submit any queries relating to the approved process of submitting candidate resumes or Stockland’s preferred agency panel to careers@stockland.com.au *This is initially a 6 month fixed term role*

C# Unity Developer
Contract Type:
Permanent
Location:
Pymble - New South Wales
Contact Name:
Brock McFadgean
Date Published:
09-Feb-2022
C# Unity Developer
Hybrid working model
$100k - $120k + super
Sydney location
Operating in several progressive projects, work will advance innovation and the composition of leading-edge technologies adapted to enhance real patient experiences across Australia and overseas. You will be working closely alongside surgeons in operating theatres; therefore, you must have a strong stomach and be able to deal with seeing a little bit of blood!
Must haves:
2-3 years’ experience with developing front-end and back-end systems using C# and the Unity engine
Intermediate knowledge of programming languages of the Microsoft Stack, C#, and testing suites
Engineering application that involves math calculation and 3D objects
Proven knowledge and working of every aspect of the design process from discovery to review
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills
The day to day:
Liaise with our software engineering team and collaborate with Product Management to ensure business goals are met
Alter conceptual design into practical web/mobile applications
Compose technical specifications and design for features
Conduct code reviews and pair programming to safeguard quality and capabilities
Launch prototypes or investigate where needed to determine direction or model of impending features
Collaborate with software delivery and support activities
We offer an exceptional culture with all our staff being professionals in their chosen fields. If you want a supportive environment that offers career progression, click the apply button today! C# Unity Developer

 09-Feb-2022 09-Feb-2022 C# Unity Developer
Hybrid working model
$100k - $120k + super
Sydney location
Operating in several progressive projects, work will advance innovation and the composition of leading-edge technologies adapted to enhance real patient experiences across Australia and overseas. You will be working closely alongside surgeons in operating theatres; therefore, you must have a strong stomach and be able to deal with seeing a little bit of blood!
Must haves:
2-3 years’ experience with developing front-end and back-end systems using C# and the Unity engine
Intermediate knowledge of programming languages of the Microsoft Stack, C#, and testing suites
Engineering application that involves math calculation and 3D objects
Proven knowledge and working of every aspect of the design process from discovery to review
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills
The day to day:
Liaise with our software engineering team and collaborate with Product Management to ensure business goals are met
Alter conceptual design into practical web/mobile applications
Compose technical specifications and design for features
Conduct code reviews and pair programming to safeguard quality and capabilities
Launch prototypes or investigate where needed to determine direction or model of impending features
Collaborate with software delivery and support activities
We offer an exceptional culture with all our staff being professionals in their chosen fields. If you want a supportive environment that offers career progression, click the apply button today! C# Unity Developer

job_title: .net C# Oo Sql Mobile Web Applications Software Developer
listing_jobDesc:
Posting Number: 5385742

Title : .net C# Oo Sql Mobile Web Applications Software Developer

City : Albury - Wodonga

Country : Australia

Business Sector: IT and Telecommunication ( Services )

Job Type: Full-Time

Annual Salary: aud60,000.00 - aud150,000.00

Start Date: As soon as possible

Number of Available Positions: 3

View More Jobs Apply For This Job
primary requirements

 Bachelors in a relevant degree.
 At least 3-5 years’ or more asp.net experience.
 Understanding of Object Oriented and Testing techniques.
 Experience with the full software lifecycle.
 Mobile and web application development required.
 GUI using a common image and graphical design package such as InDesign.
 Able to commit at least 12 months or possibly longer.
 Must be strong with MVC3.
 Prior banking applications development desired.
 Willing to be part of a start-up and work in a relaxed and casual environment where you are just yourself and roll up your sleeves.
 Have Australia work authorisation or able to receive work or residency visa.
 Financially able to pay for your own costs to relocate yourself to Australia, if not already living and working in Australia.
 Open to living and working in the UK for 2-3 months at a time would be an added advantage but not necessarly.
 Excellent team oriented and communications skills.
 Prior technical lead experience a plus.

primary duties
This role will involve working closely with a small team developing web, database, and potentially mobile applications to extend our products into the mobile space.
other duties
This role will involve working closely with a small team developing web, database, and potentially mobile applications to extend our products into the mobile space.
other notes
This is a fast growing company which is wanting to hire a software developer to help them with their qualitative, research products. Full Time
Mid UI Developer
Position Summary
As a UI Developer you must represent our company well by being responsible, punctual and motivated to go above and beyond the call of duty. You must also be highly detail-oriented and organized with excellent analytic and problem-solving abilities. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.
Technical Expertise
UI developers should be thoroughly versed in web development languages, modern application programming languages, content management systems, and search engine optimization. As technology changes, they need to keep up with the latest developments.
Requirements:
Design overall architecture of the web application.
Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications.
Collaborate with the rest of the engineering team to design and launch new features.
Maintain code integrity and organization.
Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements.
Highly experienced with back-end programming languages (Ex: PHP, Python, Ruby, Java, .NET, JavaScript etc)
Proficient experience using (Ex: advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, ReactJS, DurandalJS etc.).
Development experience for both mobile and desktop.
Understanding of server-side languages including (such-as Jade, EJS, Jinja, etc.).
Experience with cloud message APIs and usage of push notifications.
Knowledge of code versioning tools (such as Git, Mercurial or SVN).
Angular 2+ (preferred), Angular 1. x is ok, JavaScript, overall good in web development, Java Enterprise Edition development, Spring, springboot preferred, Restful Web Services, Database SQL experience. Full Time

Fast-paced Environment
Cutting edge tech
Open to being remote in Australia
Progressive career pathway


My Client

My client is social investing app that will increase awareness, transparency and experience in the world of investing. They are now looking for a talented Flutter Developer to build out their mobile platform. Be part of a diverse team who are passionate about the product and the company mission to help people make better investing decisions!


Their office is based in Sydney but this role is also remote across Australia.


Please only apply if you are already based in Australia with full working rights.


Responsibilities:

Be hands-on with designing and building scalable mobile apps (IOS and Android) that will allow us to deliver high-quality features to our community
Work closely with cross-functional stakeholders in product, design, engineering, and operations
Take an iterative approach to building & scaling new features, balancing rapid prototyping - while also pacing high importance on stability, quality, security, and reusability in our overall system.
Follow best practices for mobile application development and automated testing

Skills:

3+ years of experience in a similar role at other startups or software companies under your belt.
Have TWO or more iOS/Android apps developed with Flutter. Either deployed on the AppStore/Google Play or available on Github;
Knowledge of Dart programming language, Rest APIs, and integration of various APIs from third parties.
In-depth understanding of front-end languages like HTML, CSS3, and JavaScript.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Interest in Investing, Trading, or Cryptocurrency
Experience with Git, Jenkins, or other version control tools;
Ability to write readable code, create extensive documentation for existing code, and refactor the previously written code into a readable state.

Interested?

Want to know more? That’s what I’m here for! Send me your CV today: sylvia.hu@opusrs.com.au or call me: 02 8089 0122 Fast-paced Environment
Cutting edge tech

Progressive career pathway

Job Overview

XMPro specialize in creating and deploying IoT applications with little to no coding. Due to growth, we are looking for a .NET Xamarin Developer with some iOS and Android experience to help beef up our mobile presence.

Job Responsibilities
Building new features and functionality to our suite of mobile first applications
Participate in design and review meetings
Collaborate for wireframe interpretation to translate business requirements into technical specifications
Mobile application development, architecture and infrastructure design, technology build and deployment activities on multiple platforms
Required Work Experience
BSCS or equivalent degree or experience
Great communication skills
Ability to adapt and thrive in a constantly-changing environment
Well-organized and resourceful
At least 4 years of experience and knowledge of:
C#
Xamarin including Xamarin.iOS and Xamarin.Android
ASP.Net Core (REST API/MVC)
WPF
XAML
SQL Server
Entity Framework
APIs/Webservices
JavaScript
Mobile UI Test Automation (Xamarin.UITest) – Desirable
This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organisation. Job Overview

Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $50,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearLocation: Office location will be determined dependant on the right applicant, as we have offices based in Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide, Perth, and Brisbane.WPP is searching for an experienced ICT Developer to work within one of our Digital agency teams on a full-time basis. You must be enthusiastic about technology and constantly be looking at the next innovation. On top of possessing strong oral, interpersonal, and organizational abilities, you must be able to work in a fast-paced environment. Flexibility and tolerance is a necessity. Front End Developer
About us:

At M3DICINE, our mission is to create beautiful and intelligent medical devices that capture powerful clinical data and empower health professionals and patients to understand health better. Our first product is Stethee Pro , the world’s first AI enabled stethoscope system.
Stethee Pro is a tool for the passionate. For those who think beyond tradition and outside the box. Those with no regard for the status quo. Who understand that great tools should create new experiences and opportunities at any moment, enabling, empowering, increasing our efficiency and pushing humanity forward. Every great tool leads to a new world of discovery.

Accountability:

The Front End Developer is accountable for the development of web data platform for M3DICINE’s vision of seamless, elegant and easy to use tools which will assist healthcare professionals to capture and record vital signs, and to share data supporting fast, informed clinical decision making.

Role

The Front End Developer provides specialist website and application design skills determining the structure and design of web pages, striking a balance between functional and aesthetic design to ensure outstanding customer experience.

Responsibilities


Day to day responsibilities include:

Develop front end web applications using ReactJS and React’s Context API
Streamline the mobile data in an aggregated dashboard including patient management and sample management views to enable users to review / listen to data and make quick judgements
Day to day maintenance and bug fixes of the site
Ensure application stability through ongoing optimization and development
Liaise with leadership to support development of requested features in line with product roadmap
Follow M3DICINE’s Standard Operating Procedures and undertake ongoing thorough detailed testing processes in line with 6-week cycle guidelines
Develop and maintain test documentation to meet quality and regulatory requirements
Work with UI / UX to ensure consistent best practice user experience
Full stack software development including querying back end Firebase data
Undertake verification reporting to cover 90% of code and ensure alignment of input and output


Job Qualifications


Technical skills required:

Demonstrated experience across
ReactJS / Context API / Firebase / Jest / Enzyme

Skills / Experience:
Front end development experience with a similar tech stack
Experience with / exposure to highly regulated industry (medical device / aviation etc)
Strong attention to detail
Clear concise communication skills and strong written documentation
Able to learn quickly and pick up medical terminology
Ability to adapt to M3dicine’s quality and regulatory requirements
Caution in implementation of new features
Able to exercise patience and comfortable to work with 6 week lifecycle
Able to contextualize big picture
Ability to drill into detailed components
Team player actively engaging with the team to ensure uniformity across the software
Curiosity to keep up to date with evolving technologies Front End Developer

About Capgemini


Capgemini is a diverse collective of more than 330,000 strategic and technological experts based across more than 50 countries, partnering with world-renowned clients to transform and manage their businesses. We are dedicated to leveraging cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering, and platforms to address the entire breadth of their business needs. This passion drives a powerful commitment - to unlock the true value of technology.

Over the last 18 months, we have tripled our business in Australia and New Zealand, with over 3,300 team members devoted to helping clients get the future they want. Now is the time to join our rapidly growing team who are at the forefront of finding new ways technology can help us reimagine what's possible, collecting unique career experiences with global brands and game-changing tech projects.


Let's talk about the team:


Our Applications Managed Services team help our clients create more value for. their business and improve efficiency through IT Systems. Our services are highly industrialized, underpinned by robust SLAs, based on industry-standard best practices, and delivered by a cost-effective mix of onshore, nearshore, and offshore resources. We're about more than 'keeping the lights on for. less' - we provide a commitment to continuous improvement and value generation.


Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:

Enhance applications using Angular, Typescript/ JavaScript, Nodejs or any front end frameworks based on software requirements, as well as back end service with Java, Spring Framework, SpringBoot and Microservices
Maintain adherence to architectural standards/principles, global product-specific guidelines and usability design standards
Solve unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business across Java applications
Ensure the application related incidents are responded and resolved within SLA
Assist the customer with recommendation and implementation of IT Best practices
Support and configure integration layer for new product features and planned enhancements
Perform service life prediction for application components


Let's talk about your capability and experience:

At least 5 years' experience as a Java Developer working client-side with JavaScript frameworks (preferably Angular, TypeScript), Node.JS, NPM, server side frameworks (Java / Spring / Spring Cloud / Hibernate / SpringBoot Microservices)
Experience with JavaScript build tools and dependency management (npm, bower, grunt, gulp, gradle, maven)
Experience working in CI/CD environments and CSS pre-processors (less, sass)
Knowledge of Domain Driven Design concepts and microservices
Experience with Microservices /Rest services / Soap) and unit and automation testing (JUnit)
Experience with Node.js, React, Backbone or other client-side MVC technologies is a plus
Knowledge of Domain Driven Design concepts and microservices, as well as REST API design and implementation
Experience creating responsive designs (Bootstrap, mobile, etc.)
Strong collaboration and communication skills
Must be comfortable operating in an agile, dynamic environment


Let's talk about what's in it for you!


We believe technology is about more than business transformation - it's also about building a more sustainable, inclusive future. This starts with our people, working with you to get the future you want. We invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and a safe place for our people to be themselves and truly belong. Through championing our staff-led community groups, we are committed to being active allies for everyone. We also aim to build an environment where you can thrive at work and at home. We champion remote working - even though you'll want to check out our beautiful offices - and are in the process of making ‘truly flexible' working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. In addition, we strive to ensure your growth and learning experience is unique with access to leading learning platforms, external certifications and opportunities to grow and learn the way you want. Finally, we offer opportunities to use your skills to help society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution, and we're ruthlessly focused on sustainability for our clients and our business - committing to becoming a net zero business by 2030.

We work to recruit and retain a talented and diverse workforce. We strongly encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age.

Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory and regulatory requirements.

#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

About the Company:
Artesian Hospitality is focused on being an industry leader through the delivery of unrivalled service and an ever-changing experience for its guests. We thrive on creativity and teamwork and are currently undergoing a period of immense growth, whilst we continue to invest in our portfolio of brands.
We are currently on the lookout for a motivated individual who can complement and expand our existing software and web development team.
Job tasks and responsibilities:
We're aiming to find an applicant who can work as a part of the larger team, or autonomously, when needed, on a number of new and upcoming website and web-based projects as well as maintaining and improving our existing software and website offerings. This is an ideal opportunity to learn some new skills or expand your existing abilities all the while getting to work on innovative new projects with support from other experienced team members.
Skills and experience
General Requirements:

1-3 years of web / software development experience.
Formal qualifications are not required, just a proven desire to work on new and exciting projects with similar minded individuals.


Specific Technologies / Frameworks:
HTML, PHP (Laravel / Wordpress), Javascript (Vue.js / Node.js), CSS (SASS), basic SQL
Required Skills:

Should be proficient in HTML, CSS / SASS.
Should have a working knowledge of PHP 7+.
Some experience with Javascript, particularly using Vue.js 3+.
Understanding of mobile friendly / responsive user interfaces and front-end frameworks like Bootstrap.
Understanding of UX / UI best practices.
Bonus Skills:

Experience with Laravel 7+.
Experience with Wordpress.
Experience or working knowledge of Node.js.
Working knowledge of RESTful APIs.
Comfortable with working in Linux.
Comfortable working with databases and SQL.
Experience with AWS services (Elemental, EC2, RDS, S3, SQS, SES, CloudFront etc)


The Perks:
Being part of the Artesian family is your exclusive access to the Gold Coasts best restaurants, nightclubs, day clubs and bars. In addition, you will receive fantastic discounts across our venues (50% off food & beverage) and special offers available from our partners.
Our commitment to growth and innovation within the Australian hospitality industry provides career progression and development opportunities as well as the chance to be a part of a culture that is passionate about the industry and delivering magical guest experiences at every moment.

Apply NOW to step into your next rewarding career journey. About the Company:
Artesian Hospitality is focused on being an industry leader through the delivery of unrivalled service and an ever-changing experience for its guests. We thrive on creativity and teamwork and are currently undergoing a period of immense growth, whilst we continue to invest in our portfolio of brands.
We are currently on the lookout for a motivated individual who can complement and expand our existing software and web development team.
Job tasks and responsibilities:
We're aiming to find an applicant who can work as a part of the larger team, or autonomously, when needed, on a number of new and upcoming website and web-based projects as well as maintaining and improving our existing software and website offerings. This is an ideal opportunity to learn some new skills or expand your existing abilities all the while getting to work on innovative new projects with support from other experienced team members.
Skills and experience
General Requirements:

1-3 years of web / software development experience.
Formal qualifications are not required, just a proven desire to work on new and exciting projects with similar minded individuals.


Specific Technologies / Frameworks:
HTML, PHP (Laravel / Wordpress), Javascript (Vue.js / Node.js), CSS (SASS), basic SQL
Required Skills:

Should be proficient in HTML, CSS / SASS.
Should have a working knowledge of PHP 7+.
Some experience with Javascript, particularly using Vue.js 3+.
Understanding of mobile friendly / responsive user interfaces and front-end frameworks like Bootstrap.
Understanding of UX / UI best practices.
Bonus Skills:

Experience with Laravel 7+.
Experience with Wordpress.
Experience or working knowledge of Node.js.
Working knowledge of RESTful APIs.
Comfortable with working in Linux.
Comfortable working with databases and SQL.
Experience with AWS services (Elemental, EC2, RDS, S3, SQS, SES, CloudFront etc)


The Perks:
Being part of the Artesian family is your exclusive access to the Gold Coasts best restaurants, nightclubs, day clubs and bars. In addition, you will receive fantastic discounts across our venues (50% off food & beverage) and special offers available from our partners.
Our commitment to growth and innovation within the Australian hospitality industry provides career progression and development opportunities as well as the chance to be a part of a culture that is passionate about the industry and delivering magical guest experiences at every moment.

The safety and wellbeing of our employees and potential employees are important to us. Our external candidates will interview via Zoom. Not only do we wish to protect the health and safety of our people, we want to assure candidates that there is no expectation from REA to meet face-to-face. A virtual interview will not adversely impact your application. If you have any questions or concerns, this can be discussed through the screening process.
We're REA
An Australian start-up success story we're quietly proud of.
Our purpose is to change the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help on every step - whether that's buying, selling, renting or renovating.
Some of our brands include realestate.com.au, realcommercial.com.au, spacely.com.au, Flatmates.com.au, Proptrack.com, Smartline.com.au and Mortgage Choice.
We’re proud to have been named one of Australia’s Best Workplaces for 2021. This recognition is a great proof point of our unique and special culture. A culture that is driven by our people, our values, and our commitment to making a difference in the community.
What we’re doing
As a Lead Developer you will be responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining our products in a collaborative team environment. You will collaborate with Product Managers and Designers to understand requirements and develop solutions that meet the needs of our users. You will liaise with Tech Leads and Architects to ensure your solution is in line with our technical vision. You will lead the engineering team in the implementation of solutions using a variety of programming languages, databases and cloud technologies. You will champion agile software development practices such as test-driven development, continuous delivery and pair programming and take overall responsibility for the technical quality of the solution. You will liaise with Systems Engineers to deploy your solutions to production environments and monitor its performance. You will use your skills and experience to mentor more junior team members.
The Lead Developer supports the mobile team in the following ways:
Designing, coding, testing and deploying new full stack software products using a variety of technologies and platforms.
Maintaining existing products, including bug fixes and “Business As Usual” feature enhancements.
Supporting production systems.
Working with stakeholders to design high quality solutions that meet the needs of our users.
Leading the implementation of major products.
Providing technical team leadership for a team of highly capable engineers
Providing technical mentoring and guidance to less experienced members of the team
Taking on people management and career coaching of direct reports
Who we’re looking for
Expert skills one or more of our native mobile programming languages –- Swift / Kotlin
Some experience in Scala and/or Java would be an advantage.
Expert skills in modern software development techniques such as functional programming, object orientated programming, test driven development and continuous delivery.
Advanced skills in implementing solutions that scale and perform for millions of users.
Able to communicate and collaborate effectively with business stakeholders.
Able to lead engineering teams in a collaborative team environment.
8+ years of experience working in software development.
Tertiary qualification in Computer Science or similar highly desirable.
Looks at tricky situations through a solutions-focused lens.
Work productively in a fast paced and agile environment - #gsd (urban dictionary will help on this one!)
But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It’s our connection, acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be:
Savvy minded and have curiosity to think a little left of field / outside the box
A strong and creative communicator
Friendly, approachable and have good relationship management skills
An avid contributor to our inclusive culture - we celebrate different perspectives and all play an active role in creating a sense of belonging
The REA experience
The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.
We offer:
A flexible working environment, meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes, our leaders fully understand the benefits of working flexibly)
A hybrid approach to the future of work - https://www.rea-group.com/about-us/news-and-insights/blog/rea-groups-evolution-of-hybrid-working/
Generous and flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers
Summer Fridays – time back to focus on your wellness every Friday afternoon from December through to March
Support for your mental and physical health and wellbeing via our ‘You Matter’ Program
Because We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community
Hack Days for you to bring so you can bring your big ideas to life in a supportive learning environment
An additional day of leave just for your birthday
Oh, and by the way:
At REA we value diversity and inclusion in all forms. Gender, religion, ethnicity, LBTGIQ+, neurodiversity and so much more. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you've got the must-haves, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.
If you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. While we're looking at your application, and preparing to come back to you with an update, why not get to know us a bit more through our various social channels? The safety and wellbeing of our employees and potential employees are important to us. Our external candidates will interview via Zoom. Not only do we wish to protect the health and safety of our people, we want to assure candidates that there is no expectation from REA to meet face-to-face. A virtual interview will not adversely impact your application. If you have any questions or concerns, this can be discussed through the screening process.

:
Required 8+ years of development experience for large, secure, enterprise applications
Have excellent and demonstrated experience in iOS development with Swift
JavaScript & NodeJS (optional)
Java & Spring Boot (optional)
Android, Xamarin and React Native Development (optional)
Understanding of Agile development methodology and development practices such as BDD, TDD, Kanban, Lean, etc
Developing complex UI designs using Xcode interface builder/SwiftUI

Duties And Responsibilities
As a Senior Mobile Engineer in the Digital Experience Platforms Community will work closely with our clients and other engineers to develop intuitive digital products and services that meet the needs of business. We’re looking for a passionate mobile engineer with strong communication skills to co-create next generation digital products and services with clients and colleagues.
Managing and integrating with third party APIs.
MVVM architecture and MVP architecture for UI layer development.
Experience architecting apps using a CLEAN architecture pattern.
REST APIs and experience in integrating with them using RxSwift/Combine.
Dependency injection.
Entire application lifecycle from concept, design, test, release and support.
Continuous integration and continues deployment using XCode, Fastlane and Jenkins environment.
Protocol-oriented programming, writing test cases as well as using source code management software within a programming team.
Ability to co-ordinate with UX and visual designers, challenge when necessary and stand up for correctness.
Salary Range: >$100,000

Next steps
If you feel this opportunity suits you, or Cognizant is the type of organization you would like to join, we want to have a conversation with you! Please apply directly with us.
For a complete list of open opportunities with Cognizant, visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers
Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.

Company Description
Kodez is a Cloud-Native consultancy, helping customers across Australia to make the best out of Public Cloud Infrastructure. We work with clients across a range of industries to help them optimise their products and systems, finding ways to improve efficiency, security, and stay ahead of the competition.
We’re really proud of the work we have done for clients like JB HiFi, Coles and Seek and recognise that our biggest strength and greatest competitive advantage is our incredibly talented team.

Job Description
Why join us?
With Kodez, you can focus on doing what you do best. Solve interesting technical problems, have a significant impact, and work with teams where you’ll be able to use your existing capabilities and keep building your skills. We know that consulting can be hard and your real life is outside of the office so our focus is on supporting you and making sure you are set up to deliver amazing results.
What does that really mean? We won’t treat you like you’re just a “resource”, and we don’t work with clients that do either. We select our projects and clients carefully and recognise the value of the expertise you bring, so we’re able to pay competitive day rates, with sensible expectations and as much flexibility as possible.
No death march projects on below-market rates here; building happy, rewarding, long-term relationships is our focus.
What are we looking for?
We are looking for 2 Lead Mobile Developers to join a major banking client looking to make improvements to their apps.
They have teams of 3 x iOS and 3 x Android developers tasked with delivering improvements and new features, and we're looking for experienced mobile developers to join and lead each of those teams. This is an initial 6 month engagement and we are ready to start now.
You will be able to work from home in this role as long as you are located in Australia.
If you’re interested to find out more, apply now and we’ll get back to you as quickly as we can. Company Description

A leading provider in their market
Great culture with a great vision
Long term career opportunity on the beautiful Gold Coast, what are you waiting for!
About the Client and Role

This business has become a market leader in their market sector. With multiple offices nationwide the company is growing from strength to strength and this has seen an opening in their Gold Coast office

Experience

The ideal candidate will have most of the following experience:

Minimum of 3 years software development experience
Solid mobile programming experience in both IOS and Android
Good knowledge in Javascript specifically React and Redux
Desire to work in and learn functional programming
Be versed in working in an agile environments, sprints, scrums

How to Apply

If this is you, please apply below with your up-to-date CV (in Word format). All suitable applicants will be contacted for a discussion; please ensure you have relevant visa’s to work in Australia. For a confidential discussion, please contact Adam Mander on 07 3193 3221 #LI-AM

We are looking for a passionate Android developer with experience in other languages to join and enhance the capabilities of the Digital Insurance tech team. We have a focus on continuous improvement with all factors of software development including our agile practices, continuous delivery / Dev Ops, development standards and quality assurance with a focus on automated testing and security. Our mission is to deliver value to the client's customers in the digital Insurance service channels.The position’s focus will be to uplift the team’s capabilities at a technical lead level. Some of the day to day duties would include:· Technical leadership:Grow the development and agile cultureMentoring junior developersInput to solution architectureDelivering business objectives and hitting architecture milestonesImproving and maintaining standards: coding, testing, CD, automationDelivering value to production· Liaise with business representatives to understand requirement specifications· Software Development:Mobile & web applicationsDesign, analyse and estimationWriting automated tests and helping the QA lead develop testing frameworks· Dev OpsContinuous delivery improvementsBuild pipeline developmentHelping mature Dev Ops within the team and department· Production support: After hours oncall o Improving production resilienceJob Requirements: · 6+ years software engineering experience with 4+ years demonstrable experience integrating with Android SDKs using Kotlin (preferred) or Java, including some quality Android apps that you can show us.· Experience in developing complex UI designs using Android Studio IDE and AndroidX/Jetpack framework libraries.· Experience with managing and integrating with third party APIs.· Understanding of REST APIs and experience in integrating with them using Retrofit and RxJava & RxAndroid or Kotlin Coroutines.· Understanding of Dependency injection with Dagger (or Hilt).· Understanding of entire application lifecycle from concept, design, test, release and support.· Understanding of continuous integration and continuous deployment using the Android Gradle Plugin and Jenkins environment.· writing test cases (with a BDD framework such as Spek) as well as using source code management software within a programming team.· Understanding of Agile/Scrum software delivery practices.· Excellent analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude. Web/UI Developer
Published April 30, 2021

Marlo is seeking a seasoned Web Developer to join our Melbourne team and work on exciting projects with our clients.

Location: Melbourne

Salary range: $120,000 - $140,000


Key Duties & Responsibilities:

Engage with key stakeholders, internal and external, to understand the product and user requirements of the solutions being created
Generate appropriate design documents, and other forms of documentation to clearly represent the solution being created
Work with other development team members to allow them to implement the design, including design and code reviews
Show initiative in improving the application and up-skilling as required
Team-focused Agile environment where continuous improvement and partnership are prioritized

Skills & Experience required:

Ability to problem solve, create reusable solutions, write clean code
An excellent communicator
Strong experience working with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and React/Redux
Industry experience in creating AngularJS Web UI application
Experience with Node, Express, NPM, Rest API
Strong UX/UI principles including responsive design
Experience with TypeScript ideal
Must have strong skills with Gitlab and continuous delivery practices
Automated UI Testing skill highly desirable
Mobile app development and testing
Experience and knowledge of Kubernetes, Docker, AWS preferred
Good understanding of working within an Agile environment

To apply, please send your resume to careers@marlo.com.au Web/UI Developer

Job Description
The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years experience in designing and developing iOS or Android or both types of mobile applications.

If you are passionate and committed to doing your best and would like to be part of our winning team read on.

For the right candidate this is a great opportunity to accelerate your career.
Your chance to make your mark and be a part of a fast growing company.
Work on innovative and challenging projects - varying market segments.

About the Role:

Primary purpose of the role is to develop and maintain our mobile commerce applications.
The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years experience in designing and developing iOS or Android mobile applications.

Skills:

Experience with both iOS & Android development environments.
Competent in Objective C and/or Java for Android
Swift coding skills are a plus
Ability to build well-optimised and scalable mobile applications.
Exposure to industry-standard approaches in designing secure high performance mobile applications.

Non Technical Skills:

Experience working in an agency or creative environment.
An excellent work ethic and can do attitude.
Attention to detail.
A talent for communicating ideas, issues and solutions in a team environment.
Exceptional English (verbal & written).


No Recruitment Agencies Please. Job Description
The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years experience in designing and developing iOS or Android or both types of mobile applications.

If you are passionate and committed to doing your best and would like to be part of our winning team read on.

For the right candidate this is a great opportunity to accelerate your career.
Your chance to make your mark and be a part of a fast growing company.
Work on innovative and challenging projects - varying market segments.

About the Role:

Primary purpose of the role is to develop and maintain our mobile commerce applications.
The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years experience in designing and developing iOS or Android mobile applications.

Skills:

Experience with both iOS & Android development environments.
Competent in Objective C and/or Java for Android
Swift coding skills are a plus
Ability to build well-optimised and scalable mobile applications.
Exposure to industry-standard approaches in designing secure high performance mobile applications.

Non Technical Skills:

Experience working in an agency or creative environment.
An excellent work ethic and can do attitude.
Attention to detail.
A talent for communicating ideas, issues and solutions in a team environment.
Exceptional English (verbal & written).

WHO IS INTERACTSPORT?
InteractSport is a world class sports data and technology company that is part of Sportradar and has been reimagining the match day experience for leading sports organisations for over 20 years.
During 2021 Sportradar & InteractSport were selected to provide data services for the ICC for the next 3 years including the recently concluded T20 men’s cricket world cup.
We are currently experiencing a strong growth phase and building a team of the best frontend and backend engineers from around the world to build out a suite of significant new products.
WHAT DOES THE ROLE INVOLVE?
InteractSport are building new and maintaining existing applications for its growing number of international cricket clients. Mobile applications include React Native and Titanium apps.
You’ll have a meaningful role in: Help develop a brand new greenfields mobile application, aiming to push the boundaries of sport fan engagement Developing and designing major components of our applications Developing great user experiences and performant mobile solutions Work on projects that are used by thousands of users Maintain existing applications
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
MUST HAVES Building and deploying applications in React Native JS/TS experience (3-4 years) Experience with state management libraries Experience managing applications in App Store Connect & Google Play Developer Console Takes pride in writing clean code, including writing tests and incorporating documentation Must be comfortable with modern software development methodologies such as agile development, git, CI/CD, code reviews etc.
BONUS POINTS Experience building application with Titanium/Appcelerator Experience building NPM Modules Experience building mobile deployment pipelines (Fastlane, etc) UX skills
PERKS & BENEFITS? In early 2022 InteractSport will be relocating to an exciting new working space in Cremorne, Melbourne. Great facilities and opportunity to be within a space with other likeminded companies Flexible working arrangements. Work from home is encouraged with some opportunity to work in our new office according to a timetable that suits you. Candidates outside of Melbourne also supported with opportunities to attend local physical office space or be flown into Melbourne on a regular basis for team sessions. Location: Sydney, New South Wales

Job Type: Permanent

Specialisation: Banking & Financial Services

Salary: AU$140000 - AU$160000 per annum + package - experience dependant

Reference: PR/011362_1659397874

The Client:
Our client is striving to make investing affordable, accessible and understandable, particularly for the millennial demographic. Since launching in 2018 they have welcomed over 200,000 customers and are very confident in their plans for growth moving forward. They are currently looking at scaling globally. Their multiple platforms (web and mobile) are extremely user friendly and really simplify a market which has been complicated for decades.
The fit for purpose office is located in the Inner CBD of Sydney, but they are open to growing the small team they have in Perth as well (currently working from a WeWork space).
The Role:
You will be collaborating with the growing back-end team on a range of exciting projects. Ideal candidate will come with thorough experience in PHP Laravel. An interest in investing will be held with high regard.
This role will provide complete autonomy, and offers the opportunity to really own the code you write.
Senior Backend Developer role - PHP - Laravel
Permanent opportunity with a rapidly growing Fin-tech company
Work from Home flexibility
Requirements:
PHP Laravel experience
Experience working with large datasets
Familiarity with build tools (Yarn, NPM, WebPack)
Familiarity with Agile Projects
Familiarity with Git version control
Great communication skills
Motivation to contribute to culture of continuous delivery
Salary and Benefits
Open minded salary wise - have a large range dependent on experience.
$135k - $170k package including super - Lets Chat!
CBD Location if you prefer to be in the office
Plenty of opportunity for (not to distant) future career progression
Opportunity for equity
Kitchen packed full of snacks and drinks!!
For more information call Hannah @ Finite Recruitment on 0413 248 431
