Who We Are

PALO IT is a global innovation consultancy and Agile software development company dedicated to helping organizations embrace tech as a force for good. We work with clients to rapidly launch products and services, create new business models, and prepare leadership and culture for the future. We are a community of innovators, designers and technologists across 11 offices and five continents (France, Hong Kong, Singapore, Thailand, Australia, Mexico and Colombia).

We're committed to helping businesses transform to better our world. We're proud to be a World Economic Forum (WEF) New Champion, and a B Corp-certified company in Singapore and Hong Kong, currently working towards certification across all other locations.

The role
As an iOS Software Engineer, you'll ensure we're providing the best mobile experience for our customers. You'll provide strong technical knowledge and insight into iOS development, while sharing your expertise to coach and mentor others. You'll own delivery of practical solutions to solve real-world problems for customers, with the knowledge that what you build has an immediate positive impact.

Essential

Strong iOS development background and experience with Swift
Passion for native mobile development and the iOS ecosystem
Solid experience building complex custom UI and knowledge of concurrency and multi-threading
Demonstrated focus on quality and ability to use automated testing methodologies
Understanding of REST, HTTP and efficient networking on iOS
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, prioritisation and communication skills to help shape our technical direction and deliver a fast, secure and insanely usable app
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject

Within projects, you will be part of the development process of course, carry out scoping estimations with your team, implement architecture designs, and participate in writing architecture documents. You will assist our customers in adopting best practices in new architecture patterns. You will carry out code, performance, and security reviews and make proposals for improvement appropriate to the client's business context. Some important attributes:

Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code.
Ensuring high performance, low latency application design.
Familiarity with Agile / Scrum Methodologies and will be part of daily stand-ups, backlog management, demos, retros, etc.
Proven experience providing end to end development that includes testing, maintenance, and support.

Your Role at PALO IT

You will be part of a project team working at various client sites, building or enhancing complex applications in the digital domain and serving as a touchstone for clients around agile development, best practices, and emerging technologies. You will use your skills and experience to teach others and take advantage of opportunities to learn and improve your own skill sets.

More About PALO IT

Using our B Corp certification and WEF status as our north star, we're eager to adapt to change, learn from our experiences and move to meet our planet's urgent needs. With 2025 as our horizon, we are taking action to meet the following objectives:

Become a climate net-zero company
Attain 50% of revenue from projects with a positive impact
Train 100% of our workforce on impact
Achieve B Corp certification among all 11 of our offices across the globe
Attain 90% happy employees at PALO IT

Our clients are amongst the world's most successful companies. We innovate with both established Fortune 1000s, SMEs and start-ups who aim to make an impact, become global leaders and address the world's most complex challenges.

What We Offer

Stimulating working environments
Unique career path
International mobility
Internal R&D projects
Knowledge sharing
Personalized training
Entrepreneurship & intrapreneurship

For more on our team culture and benefits, check out our careers page. Who We Are

We work with clients to rapidly launch products and services, create new business models, and prepare leadership and culture for the future. We are a community of innovators, designers and technologists across 11 offices and five continents (France, Hong Kong, Singapore, Thailand, Australia, Mexico and Colombia).

We're committed to helping businesses transform to better our world. We're proud to be a World Economic Forum (WEF) New Champion, and a B Corp-certified company in Singapore and Hong Kong, currently working towards certification across all other locations.

The role
As an iOS Software Engineer, you'll ensure we're providing the best mobile experience for our customers. You'll provide strong technical knowledge and insight into iOS development, while sharing your expertise to coach and mentor others. You'll own delivery of practical solutions to solve real-world problems for customers, with the knowledge that what you build has an immediate positive impact.

Essential

Strong iOS development background and experience with Swift
Passion for native mobile development and the iOS ecosystem
Solid experience building complex custom UI and knowledge of concurrency and multi-threading
Demonstrated focus on quality and ability to use automated testing methodologies
Understanding of REST, HTTP and efficient networking on iOS
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, prioritisation and communication skills to help shape our technical direction and deliver a fast, secure and insanely usable app
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject

Within projects, you will be part of the development process of course, carry out scoping estimations with your team, implement architecture designs, and participate in writing architecture documents. You will assist our customers in adopting best practices in new architecture patterns. You will carry out code, performance, and security reviews and make proposals for improvement appropriate to the client's business context. Some important attributes:

Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code.
Ensuring high performance, low latency application design.
Familiarity with Agile / Scrum Methodologies and will be part of daily stand-ups, backlog management, demos, retros, etc.
Proven experience providing end to end development that includes testing, maintenance, and support.

Your Role at PALO IT

You will be part of a project team working at various client sites, building or enhancing complex applications in the digital domain and serving as a touchstone for clients around agile development, best practices, and emerging technologies. You will use your skills and experience to teach others and take advantage of opportunities to learn and improve your own skill sets.

More About PALO IT

Using our B Corp certification and WEF status as our north star, we're eager to adapt to change, learn from our experiences and move to meet our planet's urgent needs. With 2025 as our horizon, we are taking action to meet the following objectives:

Become a climate net-zero company
Attain 50% of revenue from projects with a positive impact
Train 100% of our workforce on impact
Achieve B Corp certification among all 11 of our offices across the globe
Attain 90% happy employees at PALO IT

Our clients are amongst the world's most successful companies. We innovate with both established Fortune 1000s, SMEs and start-ups who aim to make an impact, become global leaders and address the world's most complex challenges.

What We Offer

Stimulating working environments
Unique career path
International mobility
Internal R&D projects
Knowledge sharing
Personalized training
Entrepreneurship & intrapreneurship

For more on our team culture and benefits, check out our careers page. Show more

WHO WE ARETealium is the most trusted and world’s largest independent customer data platform. Tealium connects customer data – spanning web, mobile, offline, and IoT devices — so brands can connect with their customers. Tealium’s turnkey integration ecosystem supports more than 1,300 client-side and server-side vendors and technologies, empowering brands to create a unified, real-time customer data infrastructure.Tealium’s customer data solutions encompass tag management, an API hub, a customer data platform with machine learning and AI, and data management solutions that make customer data more valuable, actionable, and secure. Tealium has been a trusted provider of customer data solutions for more than a decade, and more than 850 top businesses worldwide including Microsoft, Hyatt, Gap, HSBC and Novartis rely on Tealium to power their customer data strategies.Team Tealium works and lives across the U.S. and in nearly 20 countries across the world. We are intentional about our culture, our investment in our team members and how we care and connect.Tealium = Teal + Helium. Teal: a vibrant reflection that evokes authenticity, trustworthiness, reliability, open communication and clarity of thought. Helium: we rise above, a kinetic force that elevates our customers’ and our experiences beyond all others.We win together with respect and appreciation for the talents required of all positions and the people who contribute to each of these.We are looking for a highly motivated Australia based SRE and Dev Ops Engineer to run, improve and scale our global AWS production infrastructure including global production deployments. The ideal candidate will have previously shown the ability to design, implement and maintain production infrastructure as well as monitoring, alerting, trending and dashboarding. The Staff SRE/DevOps Engineer will work closely with Product Developers, Product Owners and Customer Success on new infrastructure, software architecture and new feature introductions and report to the SRE Manager based in Australia.YOUR DAY-TO-DAYWorking 38 hours per week, Monday through Sunday from 9:00am to 5:00pm, with one weekend day usually required.Troubleshooting issues with regional customers teaming with Customer Success Enhance and extend production infrastructure performance and scalability. Assist with our Production migration to EKS/Kubernetes.Identify relevant business metrics and implement real time monitoring, alerting, trending and dashboarding.Identify high ROI problems for remediation and cost savings/margin improvement.Analyze tech debt issues and help leadership prioritize resourcing for certain high-value fixes.WHY YOU ARE THE PERFECT FITB.S. Degree in Computer Science or related field5+ years working in a in rotating Enterprise SaaS environment.5+ years experience in automation and infrastructure as code (Terraform, Chef, Codebuild preferred)5+ years experience in monitoring, alerting and trending (DataDog, SumoLogic, Prometheus, Grafana, Cloudwatch, PagerDuty/Opsgenie preferred)5+ years’ experience in Linux/Java/Apache environments5+ years experience in load balancing and autoscaling (AWS ASG, Spot.io preferred)5+ years’ experience in multiple AWS services (EC2, EKS/Kubernetes, Cloudfront, MSK preferred)5+ years’ experience with CICD technologies (Jenkins, ArgoCD, Artifactory, Containerization preferred)5+ years’ experience with SQL and NoSQL datastoresPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSCertification of AWS technology is desirable.WHAT ARE SOME OF THE WOWs ABOUT TEALIUMAt Tealium, we don’t just offer the ordinary, we provide the extraordinary:- Tealium WOWs (Ways of Work), our award winning culture is how with think, act and connect together at Tealium- Mosaic, our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion is grounded in our mosaic of diverse perspectives and shared belonging as we live in work across the US and in nearly 20 countries- Tealium Cares, to promote caring in our communities, 15 hours of paid work time for volunteer activities and programs is offered annually- Tealium Connects (remote-first working), enabling many of us to choose where we do our best work and offering new hire stipends of AUD $700 to assist with purchasing things we need to support a successful home office environment. We also have an amazing office set up in the city in case you want to use it.- Tealium Ownership, share in the success of Tealium by becoming an owner of Tealium beginning with new hire equity grants- Tealium Time, competitive paid time-off policy to take time when needed and robust leave programs, including extended paid parental leave and company holidays- Healium, health and wellness programs to help us be our best selves in the experiences of health, physical, mental, social, and even financial well-being and wellness- Healium Be-Well Break, an annual all-company paid shutdown to provide a true break for us all. This year we will hold this shutdown in the first week of July.- Tealium LIFT (Learning is Facilitated at Tealium), offering a myriad of professional development opportunities with over 6,000 courses available on demand to best-in-class manager and leadership development programs- Health and Related Benefits Programs, offering market competitive benefits programsCollectively, we contribute our individual pieces (identity, experiences, heritage, backgrounds, religions, viewpoints, gender and more ) to form the mosaic of Team Tealium. It is our continuing philosophy to recruit and employ the best qualified individuals without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, and/or any other protected characteristic. About us

Sportsbet's purpose is to bring excitement to life for its customers and we do this by over-delivering on excitement through serious fun, disrupting the status quo and living our values. We’re a flexible, progressive, open-minded, and inclusive employer with over 7,000 cool, clever and curious people around the world. As part of the Flutter Group, we’re a global player, but in Melbourne, Sydney and Darwin we’re tight knit, with 1,000 of us bringing excitement to life every day.

Our commitment to responsible gambling is genuine and demonstrated through the wide range of responsible gambling initiatives and tools

About the role

Acting as a liaison for the business, translating their needs for a variety of technologies, including back office, customer facing (web and mobile) and internal systems.

You will be responsible for eliciting and analysing requirements to deliver quality solutions to the business. You may work alone or with other BAs and will work closely with the other members of the feature team and technology including UX, developers and testers.

 Key responsibilities include:

Be the interface between stakeholders across both business and technology including development and testing teams

Elicit and analyse requirements from stakeholders using a variety of techniques

Maintain a high level of requirements quality

Use data and processes during analysis to clarify and validate requirements

Defines acceptance criteria and monitors user experience

Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to determine the most appropriate technical solution and provide analysis on trade-offs between usability, functionality and performance needs

Expected to run ceremonies like backlog grooming, Sprint planning, etc

Active participant in the BA community

Provide learnings back to the community, to contribute to the uplifting of skills and knowledge of the BA community

Develops assets for re-use and looks for efficiency opportunities

About You

2+ years in a similar role

Strong problem-solving skills and analytical thinking

Good stakeholder management and communication skills, including influencing and negotiation.

Good ability to prioritise with effective time management skills

Business analysis experience with proven experience as a competent generalist BA:

Acceptance and Evaluations Criteria

Backlog Management

Business Rules

Decision Analysis and Modelling

Estimation

Functional Decomposition

Non Functional Requirements Analysis

Process Analysis and Modelling

Stakeholder Analysis

Use Cases / Use Case Models

User Stories

Good technical knowledge to understand the right tools and techniques for each of the above activity.

Previous experience working with CRM systems and Marketing tools is a huge bonus

 The Perks

We work hard and play hard, so along with a very competitive salary and generous performance-based bonus, we will also provide you with:

25 days annual leave (a whole extra week of holidays!)

Genuine flexible working and remote working policy with an $850 work from home office allowance

Discounted gym memberships, free breakfast and loads of event and conference tickets and many more

Access to Headspace App and an employee assist program

Best in class Parental Leave program with six months paid leave for Primary Carers and Circle In membership

Free merch including t-shirts, SB branded coffee keep cups (Frank Green might we add) and much more!

Tailored career development programs, as well as a commitment to developing Thought Leader and Specialist Talent programs

We’re a flexible, progressive, open-minded, and inclusive employer who welcomes you for who you are, as you are- that’s why we assess behaviours, learning agility and expertise to ensure all types of experiences are considered for our roles. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we review candidates with 2-3 weeks of advertising.

Ready to bring excitement to life? Apply now

Business analysis experience with proven experience as a competent generalist BA:

Acceptance and Evaluations Criteria

Backlog Management

Business Rules

Decision Analysis and Modelling

Estimation

Functional Decomposition

Non Functional Requirements Analysis

Process Analysis and Modelling

Stakeholder Analysis

Use Cases / Use Case Models

User Stories

Good technical knowledge to understand the right tools and techniques for each of the above activity.

Previous experience working with CRM systems and Marketing tools is a huge bonus

 The Perks

We work hard and play hard, so along with a very competitive salary and generous performance-based bonus, we will also provide you with:

25 days annual leave (a whole extra week of holidays!)

Genuine flexible working and remote working policy with an $850 work from home office allowance

Discounted gym memberships, free breakfast and loads of event and conference tickets and many more

Access to Headspace App and an employee assist program

Best in class Parental Leave program with six months paid leave for Primary Carers and Circle In membership

Free merch including t-shirts, SB branded coffee keep cups (Frank Green might we add) and much more!

Tailored career development programs, as well as a commitment to developing Thought Leader and Specialist Talent programs

We’re a flexible, progressive, open-minded, and inclusive employer who welcomes you for who you are, as you are- that’s why we assess behaviours, learning agility and expertise to ensure all types of experiences are considered for our roles. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we review candidates with 2-3 weeks of advertising.

Ready to bring excitement to life? Apply now


#LI-HYBRID About us

Sportsbet's purpose is to bring excitement to life for its customers and we do this by over-delivering on excitement through serious fun, disrupting the status quo and living our values. We’re a flexible, progressive, open-minded, and inclusive employer with over 7,000 cool, clever and curious people around the world. As part of the Flutter Group, we’re a global player, but in Melbourne, Sydney and Darwin we’re tight knit, with 1,000 of us bringing excitement to life every day.

Our commitment to responsible gambling is genuine and demonstrated through the wide range of responsible gambling initiatives and tools

About the role

Acting as a liaison for the business, translating their needs for a variety of technologies, including back office, customer facing (web and mobile) and internal systems.

You will be responsible for eliciting and analysing requirements to deliver quality solutions to the business. You may work alone or with other BAs and will work closely with the other members of the feature team and technology including UX, developers and testers.

 Key responsibilities include:

Be the interface between stakeholders across both business and technology including development and testing teams

Elicit and analyse requirements from stakeholders using a variety of techniques

Maintain a high level of requirements quality

Use data and processes during analysis to clarify and validate requirements

Defines acceptance criteria and monitors user experience

Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to determine the most appropriate technical solution and provide analysis on trade-offs between usability, functionality and performance needs

Expected to run ceremonies like backlog grooming, Sprint planning, etc

Active participant in the BA community

Provide learnings back to the community, to contribute to the uplifting of skills and knowledge of the BA community

Develops assets for re-use and looks for efficiency opportunities

About You

2+ years in a similar role

Strong problem-solving skills and analytical thinking

Good stakeholder management and communication skills, including influencing and negotiation.

Good ability to prioritise with effective time management skills

Business analysis experience with proven experience as a competent generalist BA:

Backlog Management

Business Rules

Estimation

job_title: AngularJS and Spring Boot Developer - Sydney
listing_jobDesc: AngularJS and Spring Boot Developer - SydneyJob Type – Contract (6 Months)Contract Type – Full TimeStarling Services is looking for qualified and enthusiastic candidates who excel at working in teams but can also work autonomously. Candidates must be safety minded with a passion for producing high quality work.Starling Services is an Australian owned primary player in recruitment, resource management and facility management services in Australia. The footprints of Starling Services are spread among all segments of the industries- Logistics, Facility Management, Education, Information Technologies, Telecom, FMCG, etc. It is guided, advised and supported by a team of eminent achievers having esteemed backgrounds from multiple industries.Position overviewStarling Services are urgently looking for AngularJS and Spring Boot Developer in the market who are interested in working with us for a long term contract job opportunityIf you are a highly passionate, motivated and qualified AngularJS and Spring Boot Developer, who has all the required documents to get started and looking for a great work/life balance, we are interested in hearing from you!Searching for 4-7 years experienced front end developer with extensive knowledge on Spring Boot framework to join our team. The ideal candidate should be highly skilled in Spring Boot, JavaScript, AngularJS, CSS and HTML5. In addition, experience with ionic and web development will be plus.Job responsibilities include but not limited to: Collaborate with the current team to review requirements and build an end-to-endResponsible for the client side of our serviceTo implement a complete user interface in the form of a mobile and desktop web app, with a focus on performance.Write work flow and business logic using Spring bootMain duties will include creating modules and components and coupling them together into a functional app.Responsible for the artistic design together with a few HTML templatesTo design the animations, CSS, and final HTML output.To work in a team with the back-end developers, and communicate with the API using standard methods.A thorough understanding of all of the components of our platform and infrastructure is requiredCommunicating with external web servicesDevOps and Jenkins pipeline knowledgeWe OfferThe opportunity to work for a major industry supplier with an appetite for growthA positive workplace with an ongoing commitment to continuous improvement and your developmentCompetitive SalaryFull-time EmploymentIf you are interested in applying, send your resume to info@starlingservices.com.au . Please ensure your Resume has your Personal Information, Job Title and Contact details. Applicants will be contacted in line with operational requirements.For further information, please visit – www.starlingservices.com.auJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $600.00 – $700.00 per day AngularJS and Spring Boot Developer - SydneyJob Type – Contract (6 Months)Contract Type – Full TimeStarling Services is looking for qualified and enthusiastic candidates who excel at working in teams but can also work autonomously. About Us
Servian, is an award-winning, regional, and global tech consultancy with a rich heritage in Data, DevOps, Digital app dev, Machine Learning, and cloud. We embrace innovation, change, and the positive impact it has on us and our clients. All roles at Servian involve personal and technical development pathways which aim to facilitate your career growth. We aim to build an employee experience where you will grow more with us, not be drowned out by the loudest voice, and hence we strive to set you up for a career that will have a greater impact.
The opportunity
We have multiple projects where we are looking for experience or passion for mobile development. We are looking for a Developer who is above the rest. Smart, passionate, and proactive self-starter who continually seeks to learn and develop their professional skill set. You will be a brilliant technologist with excellent problem-solving skills.
In addition to mobile development, you will often be working on projects involving multiple technologies from Big Data and Analytics, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, DevOps as well as numerous cloud technologies where you can learn, contribute and extend your career into these technologies if you desire.
About You
Cross-platform mobile development in one or more of the following technologies
Flutter with Dart
React Native with TypeScript
Xamarin or MAUI with C# or F#


Bonus
Mobile development for Android with Kotlin/Java
Mobile development for iOS with Swift and/or Objective-C
HTML5, CSS, SASS, Javascript
GraphQL skills are desirable.
Expertise in Javascript and Node.JS
Expertise in Python and OpenCV
Frontend frameworks: Angular, React, Vue, Svelte
Web services and APIs: GraphQL, REST, gRPC
Microservices, Docker, Kubernetes
Knowledge of CI/CD, and automation
Experience with relational databases such as SQL
Exposure to cloud technologies (GCP, AWS, Azure)
Exposure to Data Analytics, AI, ML is advantageous but not essential


Skills and Experience
Experience with Git, Github, Bitbucket Git Flow
DevOps experience for mobile CI/CD
Write well-engineered, robust code
Review and understand requirements and scope of solutions
Good understanding of MVC and MVVM Design Patterns.
Contribute to the innovation, analysis, design, critique and continual improvement
Ability to develop reusable components
Keep up to date with the latest capabilities and features of iOS and Android releases
Help share knowledge and experience throughout the team and the company
Experience as a Scrum Master and/or SAFe methodology
Key Outcomes
Delivery of quality product features on time and to specification
Gain knowledge, skills and experience across full spectrum of technologies
Make a positive impact to the engineering team and the product we are delivering
This is a great opportunity for someone who is both skilled and passionate about technology and practices and who has a good engineering mindset. Ideally, you’d be looking for a technically challenging problem to solve and be on the forefront of building cutting edge software. If you’re someone who is eager to learn, upskill and grow both in the technical field as well as seniority and commerciality then you’d be a good fit. We’re looking for someone who is a team player that can be responsible and accountable.
Why Servian?
At Servian we believe talented technologists matter, this means we want to help grow your career and develop your passion in the ever changing tech industry.
Variety of interesting projects, using emerging technologies.
Collaborative environment for talented technologists.
Continuous learning and development across multiple dimensions including technology, leadership and commerciality.
Wellbeing & Benefits
Access to a wide range of internal training sessions, across both technical and consulting skills.
Sponsored certifications across all our partner technology vendors.
We provide employees with Life Insurance, Income Protection Insurance and access to an Employee Assistance Program.
Generous Parental leave.
We are proud to have a sociable workplace that values diversity and celebrates achievement with multiple company-wide, social, and family events throughout the year. Due to Covid-19, all social events are currently virtual.
Inclusion & Diversity
Servian recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at Servian.
Our business is focused developing our people and offerings across the following:
Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), DevOps and Automation inc HashiCorp
Data & Analytics - BI/DWH, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics
Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development
Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights
Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning
Cyber Security - DevSecOps, Penetration Testing, Multi-Cloud Security, Security Posture Analysis
What’s Next?
If this role sounds of interest, or you would like to hear about other exciting opportunities get in touch with the Servian Talent Acquisition Team. About Us

This is a great opportunity for someone who is both skilled and passionate about technology and practices and who has a good engineering mindset. Ideally, you’d be looking for a technically challenging problem to solve and be on the forefront of building cutting edge software. If you’re someone who is eager to learn, upskill and grow both in the technical field as well as seniority and commerciality then you’d be a good fit. We’re looking for someone who is a team player that can be responsible and accountable.
Why Servian?
At Servian we believe talented technologists matter, this means we want to help grow your career and develop your passion in the ever changing tech industry.
Variety of interesting projects, using emerging technologies.
Collaborative environment for talented technologists.
Continuous learning and development across multiple dimensions including technology, leadership and commerciality.
Wellbeing & Benefits
Access to a wide range of internal training sessions, across both technical and consulting skills.
Sponsored certifications across all our partner technology vendors.
We provide employees with Life Insurance, Income Protection Insurance and access to an Employee Assistance Program.
Generous Parental leave.
We are proud to have a sociable workplace that values diversity and celebrates achievement with multiple company-wide, social, and family events throughout the year. Due to Covid-19, all social events are currently virtual.
Inclusion & Diversity
Servian recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at Servian.
Our business is focused developing our people and offerings across the following:
Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), DevOps and Automation inc HashiCorp
Data & Analytics - BI/DWH, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics
Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development
Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights
Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning
Cyber Security - DevSecOps, Penetration Testing, Multi-Cloud Security, Security Posture Analysis

DTN is a global leader providing insights and analytics to our customers to feed, fuel, and protect the world. We help people make critical business decisions that impact the agriculture, oil and gas, trading, and weather industries.
It’s a difference you’ve likely felt without even knowing it. From the food on your plate to the gas in your car to the last flight you took, chances are a DTN customer made it possible. And that’s just for starters. That’s why we say, “When our customers prosper, we all win.”
Job Description:
Weatherzone, a DTN Company is a global leader providing insights and analytics to our customers to feed, fuel, and protect the world. We help people make critical business decisions that impact the agriculture, oil and gas, trading, and weather industries.
Working on the entire lifecycle of the apps you will contribute to the entire design process. In addition to delivering the product, the developer will be heavily involved in driving the mobile strategy. In addition to delivering the product, the developer will be heavily involved in driving the mobile strategy.
The developer will have the following:
3+ years in working on Android
Strong OO design and programming skills in Android: Java and Kotlin
Familiar with the Android: SDK, Android Studio and Gradle
Good understanding and experience in working with Continuous Integration platforms. primarily, Bitbucket, Bamboo and Crashlytics / Fabric.
Experience with web service integration (REST, JSON, XML)
Familiarity with map-based SDKs (Google Maps) an advertising integration using a 3rd party ad server (Google DFP)
Great communication skills and a team player
Main tasks and responsibilities:
Work closely with other mobile app developers, our product and back end engineering team
Deliver across the entire app life cycle from concept through design, build, deploy, test and release to the app store and support
Gather requirements around functionality and translate those requirements into elegant, functional solutions
Build prototypes at the scoping stage of projects
Work with the back end developers to integrate new and existing services into mobile apps
Build the interface with focus on usability, speed and platform best-practices
Create compelling device specific user interfaces and experiences
Standardise the platform and in some cases apps to deliver across multiple brands with minimal duplication of effort
Optimise performance of the apps
Keep up to date on the latest industry trends in mobile technologies
Explain technologies and solutions to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Attend industry events / conferences
Ensure the systems always meet the expectations of our customers and users
Minimise the impact of faults and problems within the systems on customers and users
Minimise crashes of apps by regular maintenance
Assist online businesses and support staff in resolving customer and user problems that relate to the technical performance of the systems.
Develop and deploy solutions to address problems raised by operational, sales or customer support staff.
DECISION MAKING AUTHORITY
Decisions expected:
Make appropriate technical decisions regarding coding of responsible systems
Proactively seeking out and sharing the latest research
Recommendations expected:
Recommend appropriate technology that would assist in developing apps
Recommend appropriate procedure changes as necessary
Highlight where procedures can be improved
Critique others’ work to ensure a high level of quality is met
 #LI-KIVP
Why DTN?
OUR VISION: To be the independent, trusted source of insights to our customers who feed, protect, and fuel the world.
OUR MISSION: Empower our customers with intelligent and actionable insights that exceed their expectations and enable their success on a daily basis.
OUR VALUES: Customer-Focused, Forward-Thinking, People-Centric, Solution-Oriented
We have great benefits at DTN – apply today to find out more!
At DTN, we are an equal opportunity employer. Come join us as we help feed, fuel, and protect the world!

Work Styles at Zoom
In most cases, you will have the opportunity to choose your preferred working location from the following options when you join Zoom: in-person, hybrid or remote. Visit this page for more information about Zoom's Workstyles.
About Us
Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best video product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinar.
We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.
Developer Advocate Engineer - iOS SDK
Zoom is an award-winning workplace. We have been recognized by Comparably as #1 CEO, Company Happiness, Benefits, Compensation, Diversity, and more! Not to mention we’ve been awarded by Glassdoor as the 2nd Best US workplace & Best Large Company US CEO in 2018, Wealthfront, and Business Insider. Our culture focuses on delivering happiness, our commitment to transparency, and the tangible benefits we provide our employees and our customers.
Zoom is growing at an explosive pace by every measure - revenues, people, innovation, and customers. Led by Eric S. Yuan, the #1 ranked CEO on Glassdoor, our unique culture makes Zoom an awesome place to work. We are expanding teams across the organization.
As a Developer Advocate Engineer at Zoom, you will create meaningful relationships with developers around the world in a scalable way. You will create tools and resources for Zoom developers to help them develop on Zoom, such as sample apps, tutorials, blog posts, documentation, and other developer tools and materials. You will also foster a bustling community of developers that love Zoom and turn their feedback into action to improve Zoom’s growing Developer Ecosystem.
If you are a software developer, who are looking to pivot or a change in the career and also who likes to teach, learn, and grow with new challenges and want to be a part of a team that is dedicated to leading the way for developer programs around the world, then come join us at Zoom!
You will

Own Mobile SDK from a developer evangelism and advocacy perspective.

This will include creating sample apps, working with engineering teams to improve tooling, documentation, core platform features, releases, and helping Zoom customers and partners integrate their apps.

Deeply understand the Zoom Marketplace architecture and integration components.

Work closely with our strategic partners in the APAC region to help them integrate with Marketplace and ensure value creation.

Represent the external developer’s view on our products to help prioritize the product roadmap accordingly.

Develop tools and documentation to help scale the Marketplace.

Develop sample code and other materials to share with the broader Zoom developer community.

Engage with customers to understand their business objectives and demonstrate the value proposition of new apps.

Identify key system architecture components, propose and help clients build solutions that unblock deployments.

Troubleshoot customer technical issues in real time.

Represent Zoom and its Developer Ecosystem offerings at developer events within the APAC region.
You should have

Previous experience (3+ years) as a software engineer

iOS development experience.

Hands-on experience with Swift and Objective-C.

Communication skills including experience speaking to technical and business audiences.

Understanding of the enterprise software space.

Experience working with cloud identity providers and collaboration tools.

Experience with security protocols (SAML, Kerberos, etc.) and enterprise user management systems (e.g. Active Directory).
The Team

We are a team of developers turned evangelists who believe the future of tech is in the hands of developers.

We support growth and career advancement. We want you to be successful because at the end of the day your success is our success.

Our mission is to bring together a community of developers on the Zoom platform and empower them to create amazing experiences.

Developer Advocates Engineers support and evangelize our developers.

Partner Engineers support our strategic partners directly.

Developer Educators are the main catalyst for developers. They guide the developer’s first impression of us and are a vital part of this team.

Together these roles function as a complete unit that allows developers to make impactful tools, applications, platforms to meaningful customers.

Zoom requires all U.S. employees who will work in person at a Zoom office, attend in-person Zoom meetings or have in-person customer meetings to be fully vaccinated. Zoom will consider requests for reasonable accommodations for religious or medical reasons as required under applicable law.

About Us
Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best video product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinar.
We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.
Developer Advocate Engineer - iOS SDK
Zoom is an award-winning workplace. We have been recognized by Comparably as #1 CEO, Company Happiness, Benefits, Compensation, Diversity, and more! Not to mention we’ve been awarded by Glassdoor as the 2nd Best US workplace & Best Large Company US CEO in 2018, Wealthfront, and Business Insider. Our culture focuses on delivering happiness, our commitment to transparency, and the tangible benefits we provide our employees and our customers.
Zoom is growing at an explosive pace by every measure - revenues, people, innovation, and customers. Led by Eric S. Yuan, the #1 ranked CEO on Glassdoor, our unique culture makes Zoom an awesome place to work. We are expanding teams across the organization.
As a Developer Advocate Engineer at Zoom, you will create meaningful relationships with developers around the world in a scalable way. You will create tools and resources for Zoom developers to help them develop on Zoom, such as sample apps, tutorials, blog posts, documentation, and other developer tools and materials. You will also foster a bustling community of developers that love Zoom and turn their feedback into action to improve Zoom’s growing Developer Ecosystem.
If you are a software developer, who are looking to pivot or a change in the career and also who likes to teach, learn, and grow with new challenges and want to be a part of a team that is dedicated to leading the way for developer programs around the world, then come join us at Zoom!
You will

Own Mobile SDK from a developer evangelism and advocacy perspective.

This will include creating sample apps, working with engineering teams to improve tooling, documentation, core platform features, releases, and helping Zoom customers and partners integrate their apps.

Deeply understand the Zoom Marketplace architecture and integration components.

Work closely with our strategic partners in the APAC region to help them integrate with Marketplace and ensure value creation.

Represent the external developer’s view on our products to help prioritize the product roadmap accordingly.

Develop tools and documentation to help scale the Marketplace.

Develop sample code and other materials to share with the broader Zoom developer community.

Engage with customers to understand their business objectives and demonstrate the value proposition of new apps.

Identify key system architecture components, propose and help clients build solutions that unblock deployments.

Troubleshoot customer technical issues in real time.

Represent Zoom and its Developer Ecosystem offerings at developer events within the APAC region.
You should have

Previous experience (3+ years) as a software engineer

iOS development experience.

Hands-on experience with Swift and Objective-C.

Communication skills including experience speaking to technical and business audiences.

Understanding of the enterprise software space.

Experience working with cloud identity providers and collaboration tools.

Experience with security protocols (SAML, Kerberos, etc.) and enterprise user management systems (e.g. Active Directory).

WorkJam’s mission? To provide the best Digital Workplace for frontline and hourly workers. Through our industry-leading Digital Frontline Workplace platform, we are positively impacting the lives of millions of frontline employees worldwide, enabling them to achieve breakthrough productivity levels at companies of all sizes. We’re proud of our dedicated teams who are driven to make a difference in the world. Join our team today and bring your innovative ideas, passion, and commitment to excellence to make an impact on our products and the new markets we create!WorkJam is a high growth global organisation with operations in North America, Europe, and Australia with our head office based in Montreal. Learn more about WorkJam at WorkJam.com!SummaryYour Role as Java DeveloperIn this role you will join WorkJam’s Application Support Development team. The team is a growing, unique, dynamic group with plenty of energy, technical skills, and ideas.The role of Java Developer is to work with the application support (SWAT) team to provide technical troubleshooting and solve complex problems for our customers around the world. Job no: 515375
Work type: Full Time Fortescue Employee
Location: Perth
At Fortescue Future Industries (FFI) we are leading the global energy transition by developing a portfolio of renewable energy and green hydrogen projects.

Our large scale, low-cost hydropower, geothermal, solar and wind assets will support establishment of green energy and green product industries around the world.

FFI is committed to building thriving communities by delivering social, environmental and economic benefits.


Senior Developer

Work Location: Perth

Roster: Monday to Friday

We are looking for senior full stack or front end developer with experience with using Vue.js to craft intuitive user interfaces. Our team is a small group of developers and analysts sitting within the Project Services division of FFI. Our team develops business critical software that has impact across the business.

Key Accountabilities:

Develop and maintain web application that is critical for the business
Build custom reusable components with high levels of interactivity
Work with users to understand their requirements and take this through to solution
Work with the team to understand synergies and produce a cohesive application
Provide user support
Write documentation and track code in Git
Collaborate with the rest of the team and broader business

Skills and Experience:

At least 4 years of professional experience in web development
Experience with Vue.js
Experience with Mobile development favourable
Familiarity with capital projects also favourable
Ability to work under pressure in a time constrained environment
Work to understand our users and their needs in order to deliver the best possible outcome
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate your rationale
Ability to build positive working relationships with internal staff and stakeholders

Candidates must be able to bring a flexible mindset, challenge traditional thinking, and be prepared to work outside of their comfort zone.

Our values drive our culture and performance through a strong focus on safety, family and determination. We celebrate and respect people’s differences and commit to providing an inclusive work environment. This is an exciting time to join Fortescue.
We encourage Aboriginal Australians and female candidates to apply.

www.fmgl.com.au/jobs-at-fortescue

Fortescue reserves the right to close applications early should a suitable pool of candidates be identified

Key Accountabilities:

Develop and maintain web application that is critical for the business
Build custom reusable components with high levels of interactivity
Work with users to understand their requirements and take this through to solution
Work with the team to understand synergies and produce a cohesive application
Provide user support
Write documentation and track code in Git
Collaborate with the rest of the team and broader business

Skills and Experience:

At least 4 years of professional experience in web development
Experience with Vue.js
Experience with Mobile development favourable
Familiarity with capital projects also favourable
Ability to work under pressure in a time constrained environment
Work to understand our users and their needs in order to deliver the best possible outcome
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate your rationale
Ability to build positive working relationships with internal staff and stakeholders

Candidates must be able to bring a flexible mindset, challenge traditional thinking, and be prepared to work outside of their comfort zone.

Our values drive our culture and performance through a strong focus on safety, family and determination. We celebrate and respect people’s differences and commit to providing an inclusive work environment. This is an exciting time to join Fortescue.
We encourage Aboriginal Australians and female candidates to apply.

Location: Sydney, New South Wales

Job Type: Permanent

Specialisation: Banking & Financial Services

Salary: AU$140000 - AU$160000 per annum + package - experience dependant

Reference: PR/011362_1659397874

The Client:
Our client is striving to make investing affordable, accessible and understandable, particularly for the millennial demographic. Since launching in 2018 they have welcomed over 200,000 customers and are very confident in their plans for growth moving forward. They are currently looking at scaling globally. Their multiple platforms (web and mobile) are extremely user friendly and really simplify a market which has been complicated for decades.
The fit for purpose office is located in the Inner CBD of Sydney, but they are open to growing the small team they have in Perth as well (currently working from a WeWork space).
The Role:
You will be collaborating with the growing back-end team on a range of exciting projects. Ideal candidate will come with thorough experience in PHP Laravel. An interest in investing will be held with high regard.
This role will provide complete autonomy, and offers the opportunity to really own the code you write.
Senior Backend Developer role - PHP - Laravel
Permanent opportunity with a rapidly growing Fin-tech company
Work from Home flexibility
Requirements:
PHP Laravel experience
Experience working with large datasets
Familiarity with build tools (Yarn, NPM, WebPack)
Familiarity with Agile Projects
Familiarity with Git version control
Great communication skills
Motivation to contribute to culture of continuous delivery
Salary and Benefits
Open minded salary wise - have a large range dependent on experience.
$135k - $170k package including super - Lets Chat!
CBD Location if you prefer to be in the office
Plenty of opportunity for (not to distant) future career progression
Opportunity for equity
Kitchen packed full of snacks and drinks!!
For more information call Hannah @ Finite Recruitment on 0413 248 431

All conversations will be held in strict confidence. Location: Sydney, New South Wales

Responsibilities:

Determining the structure and design for desktop and mobile
Ensuring user experience determines design choices
Developing features to enhance the user experience
Striking a balance between functional and aesthetic design
Ensuring the design is optimised for desktop and mobile
Building reusable code for future use
Optimising web pages for maximum speed and scalability
Utilising a variety of markup languages to achieve the desired outcome
Maintaining brand consistency throughout the design

Required skills:

Understanding of key design principles
Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery
Proficiency with JavaScript frameworks such as NextJS, ReactJS
Understanding of server-side CSS
Understanding of CSS frameworks such as Tailwind, Bootstrap
Experience with graphic design applications such as Adobe Photoshop
Experience with responsive and adaptive design
Understanding of basic SEO principles
Good problem-solving skills

listing_jobDesc: The Company & RoleLikwidity is a Sydney based fintech who operates an Enterprise Deposit Platform for corporate and enterprise market.The timing for this position could not be better. With interest rates increasing, the need for an Enterprise Deposit Software as a Service / Platform as a Service has never been better timed.Please note that this position is only for Australian based (Sydney/Melbourne) candidates with Permanent residency/Citizenship.You will be joining at an executive level and be in a position to shape the success and future of the business at a very exciting juncture.More importantly, through our partnering with a professional Big4 accounting firm, you will be exposed to professional and C level exposure.We are seeking a .NET developer to join our Technology team in Sydney. You will be a key part of the team and partnership / share ownership options are available.As an Engineer, you will be expected to contribute with high-quality code as well as being an awesome problem solver helping the team create innovative products and raving fans.The team at Likwidity is small, cross-functional with expertise in financial markets, technology, marketing, sales and management.You'll be working for a young, innovative company where you can make your mark. You will be afforded a lot of opportunities to grow and flourish in a culture which fosters teamwork, humility and openness.Being a start-up, working from home options are very much available.You'll get to work with some of the latest technologies including:.NET CoreMySQL with Entity FrameworkDockerAWSJavaScriptPythonPrior experience in the .NET stack is essential, AWS experience is preferred.Your ProfileYou will be at least Mid-level .NET developer working in a culture of providing simple solutions with clean, scalable and testable code.You will have:Experience across the SDLC, having worked in commercial environments for at least two yearsProven commercial experience in the .NET space (web)Experience with Cloud platforms (AWS is advantageous, Azure is okay too)Strong familiarity with AgileA go-getter attitude, someone who solves problems and can take initiative. Note: As of 2021: there is no active role right now. Please add your resume/details here for future consideration.
SMG Studio is looking for a junior / graduate Unity game developer that wants to make awesome games for every platform. You're at the start of your career and keen to show off your potential.
If you are a senior developer please see our other job listing. Do not apply to both positions.
You'll create game prototypes, work as a team on larger projects and help deliver projects to completion.
Our games: [Unannounced New IP], Moving Out, Fast and Furious Takedown, Thumb Drift, OTTTD, One More Line, One More Dash, RISK & Death Squared.
Our Showreel or go behind the scenes of the studio.
You will have the opportunity to work on high-profile IP as well as original IP.

Requirements:
 Demonstrated knowledge of C# (Unity3D) with strong coding standards
 Understanding of game design principles and player experience
 Experience with GPU programming / shaders (targeting mobile devices)
 Ability to work in a team and develop re-usable commented code
 Experience in SVN and GIT version-control software
 Experience in cross-platform (Android & IOS) development
 Working knowledge of 3D modeling / lighting / UV-mapping / texturing
 Experience with VR, Kinect, Leap Motion = bonus points!
 Experience with car games = Let's talk!
 Able to work in-house in our Sydney studio (we can help with accommodation)
What we're looking for:
 A keen eye for polish, detail and performance
 A passion for focused game design / innovative ideas
 A team-player looking to collaborate and share
 Ambitious use and embrace of new technologies
 A passion for constantly making things better and mastering your craft
The Team:
We're a tight and experienced team from all around the world from Russian, Brazil, France, Italy, UK, Germany and even NZ!
Perks & Benefits:
 Remuneration based on experience
 5 weeks annual leave after 2 years
 Increased paid primary carer's leave from 12 weeks to 16 weeks
 Superannuation is paid on any unpaid leave (up to 52 weeks)
 Increased paid secondary carer's leave from 2 weeks to 4 weeks
 Learning workshops across a variety of topics (Project Management, Resilience & Stress Management and Time Management)
 Flexibility to work from home on a regular basis
 One day a year paid charity volunteer day (One Day for Change)
 Employees can apply for seven short winter/summer days per year
 Free counselling . Employee Assistance Program, 24 hours | 7 days.
 Health insurance discounts from Medibank Private
 Vehicle discounts. Discounts from BMW, Mini, Jaguar, Land Rover and Holden
 Novated lease available for new cars
 Qantas Club discounts
If you're starting your career, care about your work, want to work with like minded people then let's talk.
Please send through samples of your work so we can play & videos of gameplay to watch.
Applications without games to play/watch will be ignored.

Our games: [Unannounced New IP], Moving Out, Fast and Furious Takedown, Thumb Drift, OTTTD, One More Line, One More Dash, RISK & Death Squared.
Our Showreel or go behind the scenes of the studio.
You will have the opportunity to work on high-profile IP as well as original IP.

Requirements:
 Demonstrated knowledge of C# (Unity3D) with strong coding standards
 Understanding of game design principles and player experience
 Experience with GPU programming / shaders (targeting mobile devices)
 Ability to work in a team and develop re-usable commented code
 Experience in SVN and GIT version-control software
 Experience in cross-platform (Android & IOS) development
 Working knowledge of 3D modeling / lighting / UV-mapping / texturing
 Experience with VR, Kinect, Leap Motion = bonus points!
 Experience with car games = Let's talk!
 Able to work in-house in our Sydney studio (we can help with accommodation)
What we're looking for:
 A keen eye for polish, detail and performance
 A passion for focused game design / innovative ideas
 A team-player looking to collaborate and share
 Ambitious use and embrace of new technologies
 A passion for constantly making things better and mastering your craft
The Team:
We're a tight and experienced team from all around the world from Russian, Brazil, France, Italy, UK, Germany and even NZ!
Perks & Benefits:
 Remuneration based on experience
 5 weeks annual leave after 2 years
 Increased paid primary carer's leave from 12 weeks to 16 weeks
 Superannuation is paid on any unpaid leave (up to 52 weeks)
 Increased paid secondary carer's leave from 2 weeks to 4 weeks
 Learning workshops across a variety of topics (Project Management, Resilience & Stress Management and Time Management)
 Flexibility to work from home on a regular basis
 One day a year paid charity volunteer day (One Day for Change)
 Employees can apply for seven short winter/summer days per year
 Free counselling . Employee Assistance Program, 24 hours | 7 days.
 Health insurance discounts from Medibank Private
 Vehicle discounts. Discounts from BMW, Mini, Jaguar, Land Rover and Holden
 Novated lease available for new cars
 Qantas Club discounts
If you're starting your career, care about your work, want to work with like minded people then let's talk.
Please send through samples of your work so we can play & videos of gameplay to watch.
Applications without games to play/watch will be ignored.

If that excites you, read on...ABOUT THE ROLEXAM Consulting is a high-growth company and we have an opportunity for a permanent, full-time ICT Business Analyst based in our Sydney CBD office.XAM Consulting continues to grow through transformation phase that will deliver both beautiful and functional web and mobile applications across multiple sectors. Reporting to our Project Manager, your primary objective will be to study and redesign computer systems, applications, and processes in order to provide expert analysis on business systems and applications. You will be working on exciting and interesting projects for periods between 1 to 12 months at a time.You will join a team of Australia's finest developers, including 2 Microsoft recognized MVP's.The key task areas of focus will include:-Effectively engage with senior BAs, technical teams and business contacts to understand, document and resolve system request-Create user stories, functional specifications-Working with clients through the full SDLC-Working closely with developers and internal QA-Participation and contribution to stand-ups and other sessionsYou'll also be provided with access to the world's best business training and education so that you continue to develop your skillsMost importantly, your work will matter, be recognised and rewarded.Experience and Skills-Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar role required’-Keen interest and understanding of technical business requirements-Ability to translate Business requirements to user stories and / or functional specification-Experience across the full SDLC preferably with AGILE experience-Familiarity with JIRA-Ideally you will have experience/understanding of mobile and website development-Excellent client facing skills-Self-starter eager to learn new technologies; enthusiastic about researching opportunities to grow and improve your skill set-Working with clients and understand the relationship value with clients-Excellent communicator (written and oral)-Willingness to help teammates and pitch in when needed on various tasksABOUT XAM ConsultingSince 2013, XAM Consulting has been Australia's leading app development team. We've worked with more than 60 different companies, from start-ups to big enterprises across Australia, the UK and USA. XAM's delivered top quality applications for brands such as Kmart, Telstra, National Home Doctor Service, University of South Australia, UGL and many others. The reason our clients want to form long termrelationships with us is because we walk hand in hand with them from the beginning, we work as if we are part of the fabric of their business.We take pride in the hard work we do, but most importantly, we take pride in the results our work brings to our customers.As a team, we are a group of inspired technologists, software engineers and app developers who fundamentally believe that mobile solutions help taking businesses to the next level. Be part of the foundation as Westpac embarks on a bold new venture to expand its Digital Banking team into Southeast Queensland as we deliver award-winning customer experiences to millions of daily active users.
Build the Next Generation of Fintech products right here in your own backyard
Be part of a world class team on the Gold Coast
QLD based Permanent Role
We are reimagining our digital platforms to deliver the best customer experience in the market, and you could be part of a team that is instrumental in delivering cutting edge technology into the hands of millions of our customers
The Digital Mobile Engineering team is responsible for the technology that is the powerhouse for our award-winning Westpac Mobile App . The team collectively builds 10+ mobile apps (iOS, Android, iPad) for both external and internal customers. This team is entrusted to deliver the bank of tomorrow for Westpac’s five million plus customers.
How will I help?
This role is within Customer Service and Technology, Digital – Mobile, AI and Engineering team. This team uses a variety of technologies to design, architect, develop and support solutions for both internal and external customers. This team is responsible for all mobile apps at Westpac - both customer as well as employee experiences.
Core Responsibilities in the role will include.
Collaborate with team members in a cross-functional team to deliver world-class and high-quality products on the Westpac Leading Mobile App
Contribute to the continuous improvement of applications throughout lifecycle and provide technical input into the planning of future applications
A practical approach to development including the reuse of shared components and open-source projects rather than always reinventing the wheel
Write clean code & build applications in line with the best practices
Keep the code free from vulnerabilities by performing npm audit / sonar scan
Participate in Agile ceremonies
Provide technical guidance/coaching/mentoring to other engineers
Contribute to growing the engineering community through our grad/intern programs
Contribute and be an advocate to the wider development and engineering community through participation in development guilds for knowledge sharing and learning
What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?
Mandatory Skills:
Passion in developing robust and secure native applications in Swift and/or Kotlin
Extensive experience with mobile application design and development best practices
Experience integrating RESTful API’s using any of the following technology stack .NET, JAVA or NodeJS with iOS/Android applications
Sound enterprise application architecture experience in design patterns, concurrency and performance
Understanding of relevant iOS (SwiftUI) and/or Android (Jetpack Compose)
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Experience with Unit Testing
Desired Skills:
Experience in using Redux in both Swift and/or Kotlin
Experience in multiple platforms including iOS and Android
End-to-end experience that extends beyond front-end mobile to the back
Experience working with Agile methodology using tools like JIRA, Bitbucket, Confluence etc.
Understanding of design patterns- MVP/ MVVM / Clean/ Viper architecture
Experience with CI/CD tools such as Bamboo and exposure to testing automation
Passion for delivering quality customer experience as well as writing quality code for reusability and scalability
Keeping up to date with latest trends in technology with a passion to bring new ideas to turn to reality
Growth mindset and not afraid of a challenge.
Familiarity with the below skills:
Languages: Swift, Kotlin
IDE: Xcode IDE, Android Studio
Toolset: Carthage, SPM, Git, Bitbucket, JIRA, IXGuard, DexGuard
CI/CD: Bamboo, Fastlane, Artifactory, Gradle, Maven
What’s it like to work there?
As well as competitive remuneration and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market.
We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work.
As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy , and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy. CI/CD: Bamboo, Fastlane, Artifactory, Gradle, Maven
What’s it like to work there?
As well as competitive remuneration and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market.
We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work.
As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy , and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy. Show more

About Kindred:


What started as Unibet in 1997 is today Kindred Group. With more than 1,700 employees, we are one of Europe's fastest growing betting companies. We make leading sports betting and casino products, available on desktop, tablet and mobile. You can visit one of our platforms at https://www.unibet.com.au. We have led the development of technological advancements, mobile solutions, new product launches, and player safety and responsible gambling improvements. Having a proven track record of success in Europe, our aim is to conquer the Australian market.


Job Description:


We are looking for a motivated and data-driven back-end developer to join our growing team of talented engineers. You'll be working on our global racing product, a microservice-based distributed system that is in use round the clock all over the world.


This is a fulltime permanent role that offers remote work (With limited travel to Sydney) for candidates based in Queensland and Victoria. You must be in Australia with a valid work visa, permanent residency, or citizenship. This role doesn't offer sponsorship for remote work.


Key responsibilities:


Design and build new C# RESTful Web APIs and microservices.
Maintain and enhance existing C# RESTful Web APIs and microservices.
Continuously add to suite of unit, integration and acceptance tests.


NOTE: CODING TEST IS A MANDATORY STEP IN THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS.


Essential skills & required experience:


Strong C# with IoC/DI.
Web API, REST (.Net framework, ASP.Net Core).
Micro-services.
Event Driven Architecture & messaging (Solace, Kafka, RabbitMQ, ZeroMQ, MSMQ).
Distributed caching (Redis, Memcached, Couchbase).
Unit Testing & mocking frameworks (nunit, Moq, NSubstitute or similar).
Working knowledge of SQL (SQL Server 2012+/ Oracle / Postgres).
ORM experience (EF6, EF Core, NHibernate or similar).
CI/CD - Continuous Delivery (Git, Jira, Jenkins, Teamcity, Octopus).


Desirable skills & experience:


Exposure to high-traffic / distributed software systems.
Docker, Kubernetes or similar.
.NET core.
Exposure to SOA design and maintenance.
AWS, Azure.


Benefits:


We are in a fantastic new office near Barangaroo, close to Wynyard station.
Our office has a sports hub, if you want to challenge a mate to a game of table tennis or darts.
Fancy a good cup of coffee? We have an in-house barista to get you that perfect cup!
Many social events to take part in (Melbourne Cup is just one of them).
Great work life balance and flexibility.
A continued commitment to employee development.
Employee share program.
Life insurance and income protection plans.
Wellness benefits.


If you have the above skills and experience and are looking for an exciting and rewarding career apply today. We look forward to hearing from you.

The Role
This will be a diverse position, seeing you as a key team member responsible for the further development across Scantek’s front and backend applications such as Mobile Responsive websites, Web SDK’s and our platform.
This role will see you designing, estimating and developing high-quality web based applications using our standards and best practices.
About You:
You have a strong interest in tech, enjoy solving problems and like to learn new ways of doing things. You’ll have worked in a collaborative team and be comfortable switching gears with a few projects on the go. You’ll also naturally live and breathe our core values!
Get it done
You don’t pass the buck, and you take ownership for getting things done. You express sincere gratitude and praise for colleagues and client’s good work and extra effort.
Accountable
You share accountability for delivering team outputs while helping and supporting colleagues in their work.
Collaborative
You demonstrate respect for the opinions and views of others. You contribute to an environment where differences are valued and encouraged.
Innovation
You try new problem-solving, seeking ideas and suggestions from others as appropriate.
Ambition
You challenge the status quo by continuously reviewing personal work processes and questioning traditional or established procedures to make suggested improvements.
Required skills:
Javascript
SQL
Object-Oriented Design knowledge
Mobile – responsive front end builds in Android and Safari
Non-Essential (but desirable)
React
Git or other Version Control Systems
AWS
REST API use or experience
Linux O/S
Qualifications:
3 years minimum commercial development experience.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science.
What you’ll get in return:
Work on projects you’ll be proud of.
Career development and engagement are a top priority; we want to invest in you!
Work-life balance – Flexibility is in our DNA, don’t let work get in the way of life.
Be empowered to make decisions and bring your ideas; you’re the expert!
Push the boundaries, continuous learning and discover new ways of doing things.
Rub shoulders with thought leaders in the industry and collaborate with a sensational team.
We create digital products that people love and that matter.
4 weeks of annual leave
Gifted 3 days leave between Christmas and New Year
Competitive salary
Employee Share Option allocations after 12 months of service
Health and wellness activities The Role

Backend Scala EngineerRapid Global is looking to hire for the position of ‘Backend Scala Engineer’ in Sydney. Rapid Global helps keep businesses safe and secure through its unique Access, Attendance and Monitoring software. We are a high-performing team pursuing growth and rapid product development.We build solutions using a wide range of technologies ranging from containerized cloud services to low latency on-premise machines, AI and ML recognition, web apps to native mobile apps and more. This will be a full-time position based in Sydney CBD, but we can accommodate flexible working arrangements.The RoleOur cloud based software stack, on-edge devices and applications are experiencing increasing demand as our customer base grows, and we are receiving new feature requests each and every day. We are looking for highly skilled Backend Software Engineers or Developers with strong Java/Scala skills, an interest in Functional Programming and a great understanding of AWS to help develop our web services and take the company to the next level.DutiesAs a Backend Scala Engineer, you will be expected to:Deliver high-quality code (predominantly Scala and Typescript) for an AWSenvironment.Engineer and maintain scalable features and services, from design to implementation and deployment in production.Work with a micro-service architecture to build highly available and scalable services.You will be able to understand business objectives and develop new and improved services to achieve those outcomes.Work closely with a team of professionals across many disciplines and backgrounds including generalists, ML/DL engineers and application developers.Follow software development best practices, source control, agile methodologies, CI/CD, testing, etc.Experience & Skills2+ years’ experience as a software engineer or developer or similar roleBachelor degree in Computer Science, IT, IS, or relevant areas of technical study or qualification is preferredExperience or interest in functional programming, ideally strong and demonstrable skills with Scala / JavaTypescript and Python knowledge/experience desirableKeen understanding of core Amazon Web Services, able to architect complex applications using these servicesBackend Developer Scala / AWS 3Excellent communicator, great problem solving skills, process-oriented, and appreciation for clean, well documented, tested codeFamiliarity with relational database schema design, Terraform, CI/CD tooling, Kube/Docker, NodeJS is a bonusJob Type: Full-timeSalary: From $96,500.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:Sydney, NSW 2000: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Work Authorisation:Australia (Preferred)Application Deadline: 25/07/2022 Backend Scala
