We are a high-performing team pursuing growth and rapid product development.We build solutions using a wide range of technologies ranging from containerized cloud services to low latency on-premise machines, AI and ML recognition, web apps to native mobile apps and more. This will be a full-time position based in Sydney CBD, but we can accommodate flexible working arrangements.The RoleOur cloud based software stack, on-edge devices and applications are experiencing increasing demand as our customer base grows, and we are receiving new feature requests each and every day. We are looking for highly skilled Backend Software Engineers or Developers with strong Java/Scala skills, an interest in Functional Programming and a great understanding of AWS to help develop our web services and take the company to the next level.DutiesAs a Backend Scala Engineer, you will be expected to:Deliver high-quality code (predominantly Scala and Typescript) for an AWSenvironment.Engineer and maintain scalable features and services, from design to implementation and deployment in production.Work with a micro-service architecture to build highly available and scalable services.You will be able to understand business objectives and develop new and improved services to achieve those outcomes.Work closely with a team of professionals across many disciplines and backgrounds including generalists, ML/DL engineers and application developers.Follow software development best practices, source control, agile methodologies, CI/CD, testing, etc.Experience & Skills2+ years’ experience as a software engineer or developer or similar roleBachelor degree in Computer Science, IT, IS, or relevant areas of technical study or qualification is preferredExperience or interest in functional programming, ideally strong and demonstrable skills with Scala / JavaTypescript and Python knowledge/experience desirableKeen understanding of core Amazon Web Services, able to architect complex applications using these servicesBackend Developer Scala / AWS 3Excellent communicator, great problem solving skills, process-oriented, and appreciation for clean, well documented, tested codeFamiliarity with relational database schema design, Terraform, CI/CD tooling, Kube/Docker, NodeJS is a bonusJob Type: Full-timeSalary: From $96,500.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:Sydney, NSW 2000: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Work Authorisation:Australia (Preferred)Application Deadline: 25/07/2022 Show more

Work with us to develop the latest Magento extensions, apps, features, and much much more. GREAT CULTURE & WORK WITH THE CREATIVE TEAM
EXCITING CAREER DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES
UP TO $100,000 + Super


ABOUT THE COMPANY

The cornerstone of the business collective is to provide solutions at the forefront of the superannuation industry that maximize and secure the financial wellbeing of every Australians in their retirement.

They are innovators in the superannuation investment space, delivering ever-evolving solutions for our clients via our team of highly skilled, vibrant, and forward-thinking individuals. An amazing facility with dynamic, high-energy, and relentless delivery of the next big wealth-building solution for our clients.


ABOUT THE ROLE
This is a newly created fixed-term opportunity, an in-house role reporting to the Marketing Manager.
This will include:
Provide outstanding support to the marketing team in the development of multiple website UX/UI elements
Design sites that engage clients of specific age ranges and demographics, holding interest, while being simple to use
Provide insight and support to assist in delivering the broader marketing strategy
Ensure compliance, exceptional quality credentials and deadlines are always met
Conduct UX research for the various brands
Create user personas and sitemaps
Keep up to date with the latest UX/UI trends
Work closely with the web developer to create and update websites and landing pages
ABOUT THE CANDIDATE

This role will be perfectly suited to a Designer who enjoys working on a variety of exciting and innovative projects across a group of companies where things change quickly!
You will have the following:
3+ Years’ experience as a UX/UI
Responsive design skills
Strong UI / Product Background
Design experience with Desktop, mobile devices, and cross-platform environments, responsive design
Understanding of the strategy/reasoning behind the UI/UX
Prototyping/wireframing etc.
Experience using Figma (or equivalent program)
Remarkable self-motivation and comfortable working autonomously, as well as collaboratively within a small team
WHAT ARE YOUR NEXT STEPS
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your resume, or call Hans Swartz now on 0406 045 525 525.

My Client

My client is looking for a React/React Native developer to join their growing team and help revolutionise travel insurance for modern travellers. Not only do they have big plans to launch and expand into new countries, but their greenfield projects also mean you will never be bored. They provide clear career pathways and are constantly looking to upskill their developers in a nurturing and close-knit environment.


If you are a React/React Native developer who wants to have your input heard and see your ideas come to life in a beautifully designed mobile application, apply now!


Only apply if you are based in Sydney Australia with full working rights.


Responsibilities

You’ll develop high-quality code that is well documented and follows best practice standards
You’ll design and implement an application architecture that is extensible in the future
You’ll write unit tests for your code, and perform code reviews along with occasional pair programming
You’ll contribute to solution designs and future technology roadmap for the company
You’ll ensure the implementation of security and data protection best practice standards

Skills:

You’ll have proven experience developing high quality secure apps using React & React Native
You’ll bring a strong understanding of Typescript, Redux State Management, WebSockets, RESTful HTTP and GraphQL (ideally five years’ experience)
You’ll have extensive experience with software development in the context of the JavaScript ecosystem, and can design and build a modern scalable app from the ground up
You’ll have experience working in an agile environment and participating in scrum ceremonies
Bonus points if you have understanding of CI/CD platforms and experience with iOS and android deployment processes
You’ll have an understanding of software development best practices, design patterns and coding standards

Benefits:

Flexible hybrid work environment
Progressive career progression
Inclusive and collaborative team mindset
Bonus scheme available

Interested?

Want to know more? That’s what I’m here for! Send me your CV today: sylvia.hu@opusrs.com.au or call me: 02 8089 0122 My Client

AKQA believes in the imaginative application of art and science to create a better future with our clients. Supporting this, we have a culture of excellence in Software Development and Marketing Technology and pride ourselves on our track record of helping our clients reimagine customer experiences. Working closely with Experience Design and Back End Engineering, Front End Engineers transform visual design into code and static designs into elegant and intuitive solutions.

As a Senior React Native Developer, you will help ensure we develop the highest standard mobile solutions for AKQA's clients, devising best practices to manage performance and scalability.

Located in Melbourne, as part of AKQA you'll work in an innovative and inclusive culture surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields. You'll also have the opportunity to learn and grow within a creative and technically advanced team, and have access to ongoing personal and professional development. At AKQA, we are committed to both your career growth and your work/life balance.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS

Develop and maintain modern React-based customer experiences across both web and mobile, focused on React Native mobile applications.
Produce high-quality reusable, effective and scalable TypeScript / JavaScript code, components and libraries.
Work with native modules when required.
Release amazing applications to the Apple and Google Play stores.
Plan and execute testing (unit and integration tests) across multiple platforms and solutions.
Partner with developers, producers, QA and UX/UI specialists to deliver a range of best-in-class digital products/projects.
Collaborate within an iterative Agile methodology, participating in sprint planning, retrospectives and daily standups.
Provide accurate estimates for work to be completed.
Consult with project leads in high-level planning and defining the technical approach.

QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS

Experience developing and releasing high-performance and elegant mobile applications with React Native for Android and iOS.
Strong development experience, especially on enterprise-level mobile/responsive website projects.
Able to diagnose, troubleshoot and resolve technical problems with forensic attention to detail.
Experience across TypeScript, GraphQL (Apollo or GraphQL Mesh), StoryBook is advantageous.
Cross-platform browser testing ability in Mac PC/IOS/Android.
Experience with web and mobile accessibility standards, JavaScript frameworks such as React, Vue.js
Web CSS preprocessor experience such as SASS/LESS, as well as like Emotion and Style Components.
Sound knowledge of concepts such as Atomic Design, OOP, SMACSS, OCSS or BEM.
Experience with Twitter Bootstrap, Material UI or similar frameworks.
Desire to learn and embrace the latest technologies.
Strong communication skills.

AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA's ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Your race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. Aboriginal, Torres Strait Islander and Indigenous people are encouraged to apply for this role. job_title: Frontend Developer - Close to train (North Shore)
listing_jobDesc:
Front End Web Developer with REACT Experience
The Company
Our client is a specialised Financial Services and Technology company that expertise in developing world class financial social analysis platforms. Innovation is an essential component in the key to their goal. Based in the heart of Chatswood CBD, you will be working in a brand-new modern office in a supportive and professional work environment just a 5-minute walk from the station! Working as a Front-End Web Developer in a full-time position, the salary package is made up of a competitive remuneration package
What we are looking for
An individual who is technology savvy and is eager to explore new technologies. Willingness to contribute like a start up will be greatly valued!
An experienced senior front-end web developer to work on our newly and existing projects.

What you will be doing
Working with the development team to build front end web interfaces to increase engagement and show strong technology impression

What we are expecting from you
Minimum 2 years commercial experience, with at least one contributed commercial projects using React !
Essential experience: CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, HTML,HTML5
Proficient design skills will be held in high regard with expertise in Adobe Suite
MUST HAVE experience creating responsive designs
Any previous experience working on mobile/tablet web applications will be highly advantageous.

Don’t let this amazing opportunity slip away! If you are uncertain that you are a great fit for this role, apply anyway!

Our agency guarantees that all applications made to our advertised positions are 100% confidential. Applicant resumes will not be passed onto a 3rd party without your prior consent.

jobref: MSJC1905-004 Show more

Primary Responsibilities:
 To be experienced in handling different layers of the code
 They are expected to have expertise in Server Side coding in Node.js
 Experience in SQL and MySQL databases
 Experience in Front-end development like HTML, JavaScript technologies
 The primary focus for this role would be defined solutions and implementing the backend code
 Examples would to building APIs, consuming APIs, designing databases and workflow
 They should have some knowledge of servers and some experience in wiring views on the front-end
 Good problem-solving skills, attitude and aptitude are important
Job Description:
 Proficient in Angular.js, React.js with Node.js
 Work collaboratively in a fast-growing startup building products and services for positive social impact
 Implementing an elegant, intuitive user experience using latest front-end technologies
 Implementing server-side code and designing the data architecture using modern web frameworks
 Write, test, and release world-class, production-ready code
 Proficient in developing applications using Node, Express
 Experience in developing with MongoDB
 Familiar with Node toolchain and other utilities ( WebPack, CoffeeScript )
 Experience on REST with JSON, and developing APIs
 Experience with client side JavaScript, HTML and CSS
Skills:

Vero is multi-channel messaging for modern marketing teams. Marketing teams use Vero to create a communication experience that is a true extension of their digital product.Vero works with hundreds of companies from around the world to send useful email and mobile push messages to over 750 million end-users.With nearly a decade's experience in this space we've recently launched a new take on our product: a version that sits directly on top of customers' data platforms like Redshift, Google BigQuery, Snowflake and more. This enables teams to use data they've already got, faster and for less cost.About the roleYou will be working closely with Vero's small but senior product and engineering team, including other senior UI/UX team members, to design and implement new features and improvements to Vero's web-based UI.Our front-end is built in Ember.js and we are looking for a talented front-end engineer with React, Ember.js or similar experience who can both help execute on our product roadmap and improve the way we structure, test, build and deploy our front-end.We have many challenging front-end components including our drag-and-drop email editor and visual canvas that make designing, developing and scaling Vero consistently interesting.We follow Basecamp's ShapeUp methodology and have found it extremely effective for our organization.ResponsibilityDevelop tools and applications that use clean, efficient code, ensuring code quality and standards while meeting agreed deadlines and delivery targets.Think ahead and build for the future as opposed to bandaid fixes for today. We aim to balance “getting things done” with work that improves our velocity and long-term outcomes.Working closely with our product manager and lead designer to prepare and scope work.Be interested in customer feedback, our overall business strategy and use this to develop customer-focused solutions.About youWe're looking for someone to join our team who can ensure we build for the long-term. You need to have a strong problem-solving ability and the aptitude to consider the big picture when solving engineering challenges.We strive for elegant solutions that are as simple yet as effective as possible.We expect that you'll have an interest in and respect for both the latest technologies available on cloud providers, as well as traditional solutions. We have often found that tools and frameworks tried-and-tested over decades provide the most elegant solutions.Three key values lived at Vero are:Humility. We listen and learn. We aim for as little politics and ego as possible at Vero.Empathy. We're a remote team with people from all over the world. We believe in inclusivity and work hard to understand and support each other.Care. People at Vero look out for each other. We work together to achieve tasks, and we back each other up.We're proud of our culture and if these values sound on point to you, we'd love to hear from you!Requirements4+ years' experience building and delivering Ember.js, React or similar applications for production usage.Understanding of common browser APIs and recent extensions to the HTTP protocol as they relate to frontend development.Understanding of how to write secure frontend code and an awareness of common web application security vulnerabilities.Testing and the ability to write unit tests/specs using common JavaScript testing frameworks.Ability to work independently.Preferred experienceBSc/BA in Computer Science or a related degree.Contributions to major open source projects.Experience working in remote teams is an advantage.Salary range$130,000+ (excluding superannuation)LocationOur preference is to find a team member in Sydney, Australia or surrounding regions as the majority of our product and engineering team is on the East Coast of Australia. That said, we are absolutely open to candidates in other locations and timezones as we are remote-first organization.BenefitsCompetitive salary. We use Sydney salary data to maintain our salary matrices. We pay in the top quartile. We pay Sydney salaries regardless of team member location.Flexible work. Work in the way that produces your best results. Many of our team members work from home one day a week, others come to the office every day and many are completely remote. We’re committed to helping you feel like you can be the happiest and most productive you.Team conference (COVID-pending). We host an annual team conference to get together as a team, challenge the status-quo and expand our vision for the future.Parental leave. We offer a generous parental leave policy.You can learn more about life at Vero on our website.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $130,000.00 – $150,000.00 per yearBenefits:Work from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:Front-end development: 3 years (Required)Language:English (Required)Work Authorisation:Australia (Required) Vero is multi-channel messaging for modern marketing teams.
